text:
Just left Crave right now in huge disappointment. . Chicken was super dry. Wait time was long but of course It is their 2nd day opening totally understanding. . 

To MANAGEMENT: 
Please teach your staff to be more professional. I was eating at the end of the bar. My wife ordered a roasted chicken and I ordered a sushi boat while I was eating by your well station you have servers and bartenders giving guest checks right next to my plate invading my personal place and i just couldn't enjoy my food. We have your long black hair bartenders giving out free drinks to these two guys. Gosh, mind as well give me some free drinks too while she and her friends talk over my shoulder! 

Advice to everyone: please give this restaurant some time to improve trust me. The food quality and service is not worth the price yet.. But we shall wait n see..

So disappointed not because of the food mattar of a fact the food was great, but because of the poor treatment that we received from the manager. To my knowledge dogs are not allowed in restaurant unless is stated some where on there wall/door/ window, we were subjected to witness dog pissing next to our table while our food being served sat through the smell, and we mentioned that to the manager she said I can move you!!!! Really???? There was 9 of us the food is in front of us we were her first!!!! No apology nothing. I'm surprised and I had never experienced such a poor treatment from restaurant manager. Crave you disappointed me, never again .
Atmosphere is nice, casual, well appointed. Service was fine. Hostesses very nice. Food was ordinary. Out of 5 in our party, four would not return.  The fifth had left so didn't weigh in!

Excellent stop in Downtown Summerlin. The food and ambience was phenomenal. Had the Lemon garlic wings. Came out piping hot and delicious. The happy hour specials were a great deal too. Will come back

Decided to give this new restaurant a try since this was just a few of the restaurants that were actually open for the grand openining of Downtown Summerlin. Sorry to say that my boyfriend and I were not impressed. The quality of food was something I would expect from Applebee's but with a 75% mark up in their prices. 

We started off with the Aloha roll and the Pork Belly Sliders. The roll it wasn't anything special but for $15 I was expecting more and the sliders came on some hawaiian roll bread, it was just ok. My boyfriend ordered a their signature Crave burger, the meat patty was a bit dry and the fries were soggy. I ordered turkey BLT and I got somewhat of a flat bread sandwich, kind of threw me off. The smell of the bread was too dough-y, wasn't very pleasant.

In conclusion, we left dissapointed and unsatisfied. Probably won't be coming back.

A must have when visiting Downtown Summerlin. 

Crave offers a variety of food ranging from pizza to sushi - and each dish I've tried has been exceptionally crafted. The restaurant is lively but quiet enough to have a work lunch and also serve as a good date spot. 

The bar offers a decent selection of drinks and TVs for watching sports. 

I'd definitely recommend the egg rolls!

Normally when we frequent Crave, which is about 3-4 times a month, we are very happy. Food is good, service is good, all around very nice. However, today we went and ordered ice-t and the waiter informed us the machine was broken so we could not have ice-t which was fine. We then ordered bottled water and he then informed is that they were out of bottled water as well! How disappointing !!!!!! We left and went to CPK next door. 


Went back to Crave after a less than stellar performance the last time and they got it all right! Everything was amazing! We had sashimi and it was spot on! There are two Maggie's that work there. Both are servers and both are very very good at their jobs! Thank you Crave for making tonight's visit what we are accustomed to!

After reading all the bad reviews, I was hesitent about eating at this new Summerlin Restaurant. They have got the bugs out and it was a very nice experience. Deanne the Hostess was lovely, friendly and helpful in telling us about the place and the menu items. Craig, our server was very helpful, attentive and couldn't have been nicer. Tea glasses were filled before completely empty. Food was very tasty and presented very well. Prices are not really bad. They are keeping with area. Portions are large, we shared a Bison Burger and a house salad. I will be back again.
This place has something for everyone and after a few trips of trying different things I have yet to be disappointed.  They even have vegetarian sushi, which my wife is a big fan of.

My cup of fish chowder was weird. There were little bits of stuff that seemed like chopped bits of meat, no idea what kind of fish. It was a flop. My Margherita flatbread was excellent. My wife's beef Stroganoff was ok. I was put off by the high wine prices and the lack of prices for beer and mixed drinks.

Service was terrible. I had to get my own refill at the bar......our plates weren't removed till about 15 minutes after we finished our apps.  The restaurant was nearly empty ( now I know why) the food was okay. The bison burger was excellent  but the sushi was bland with no flavor. I've worked as a food server in the past and I would not recommend this place for lunch nor dinner. The service was terrible. This was our first time here and it did not impress. ..... Good thing there are more options to eat around summerlin mall...

My wife and I have been here twice now, and the food has been fantastic both times.  That said, we were even more impressed with the service.  The first time we were here, the waitress was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, which always makes ordering much easier.  The second time we came because we received an email about a four course meal being offered 26-31 December.  We came on the 26th with the intention of having the four course meal, but as it turned out, this location was not prepared to offer the four course meal until the 31st.  We were bummed, but stayed anyway and had a great meal which was comped by the manager Jamie.  Excellent service all around!

My wife and I came here 3 weeks ago. Service was great and the meals were very good. I made a reservation last week for 5 of us. The hostess asked if this was a special occasion, I told her yes. Our daughter was coming in from New York to celebrate her 30th birthday. 

We arrived on time and we we sat within 5 minutes. Four of us were served our meals, unfortunately we had to wait 10 minutes for our last meal. One of our party ordered the Bison burger medium rare. It was well done. 

I understand that things happen, but why ask if it is a special occasion, and then do nothing but bring the check. Disappointing.

Oh well.

Made a 4pm reservation for the three of us including my 6 year old son. Still waited 20 minutes to be seated. Ordered an appetizer and they forgot to bring it out. Food was mediocre at best. Spent 90$ for what! I would never return to this place again. Don't know what all the rave was about Crave.

went with family for lunch had the bison burger and was very good french fries were ok a little soggy had the bread basket and was very good for appetizer all in all would go back and hostess was very friendly.

I visited Crave for the first time tonight, and I have to say that it was a wonderful experience. The service and promptness was impeccable. Hayley was our waitress and she did a fantastic job, always making sure we were taken care of.

Great Food, Great Atmosphere, Great Service.  

There was a slight wait, but it was worth it.  Joelle took great care to ensure questions were answered, and she made great suggestions.  She is the service professional everyone hopes for on a nice evening out.  

The menu is varied and includes a wide range of house-made dishes.  Try the hummus (I forget the menu word for it).  They also have very tasty sushi options. 

do it!

Saw "Logan" at Regal 5 Cinemas on Sunday.  Stopped by Crave with the lady afterwards.

It was our first time going to Crave and we knew they had all day happy hour for drinks on Sunday.

We didn't know it was all day happy hour for food on Sunday.

Soooooooooo...

We get to our table and our server doesn't tell us about happy hour, at all.

So I go ahead and order a $12 appetizer not knowing they have $4 / $5 / $6 appetizers and trust me I would have easily gotten the $12 worth - or more - and the server would still have gotten the same tip.

We had to ask for the happy hour drink menu.  Fail.

I ordered a Blue Moon, they brought a Miller Lite.  Fail.

The lady ordered a Passion-something drink of Crave's which is New Amsterdam and something.  They bring a red mint julep looking drink that was wrong.  Fail.

We watched our appetizer (which was good) float around the lobby an extra lap when it wasn't busy at all.  We were planning on dinner but we settled up and left.  

$25 for two drinks and one appetizer with four eggrolls.  

Yes, I tipped the waitress $2 on a $23 bill.

We'd try their happy hour again, but we'll sit at the bar and see if they have their $hit together.

If I could give this restaurant zero stars, I would.  It has a nice setting and appearance, but it is all looks. Our waitress was very nice and helpful but everyone else, especially the managers were soooo lazy. They would walk by past my empty water and look at the table and keep on trucking. My Bison Burger was not good and the fries were more than soggy. The Mexican Roll was pretty gross and tasted old. Everyone at the table was served at different times so we could not all eat without waiting for one another. Plus it took over an hour to get our food. Their service overall was bad and their food was even worse. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY.

I went with my family for mothers day and it was a disaster from the minute we sat down.  We had three adults and two children 3 & 4.  My daughter immediately ordered food for the kids (fruit sushi rolls and donut holes) and it took at least 45 minutes to get them.  FYI we arrived at the restaurant at 10 a.m. and there were only two other parties there at that time.  Our drink order was taken and again at least 15 minutes for the drinks to arrive.  NOT ONCE during the entire meal were we offered coffee refills or other beverage refills.  One of the party ordered an omelette, salmon, chicken brio cheese sandwich and the kids pancakes with chocolate chips.  The wrong omelette was served and it appeared to have been made with one egg, cold.  The right omelette finally appeared 20 minutes later - 1 egg, toast, no butter, no jelly and ice cold.  Pancakes arrived after the adults had their food and no chocolate chips.  The service, the food was awful.  I don't know what is going on with this restaurant but they clearly need a lesson in prep, cooking and serving.  It was suppose to be a relaxing mothers day brunch which turned into a stressed out experience.  The manager was sympathetic and told us "good help is hard to find".  He did reduce the bill and gave us a gift card.  We met friends at another table and the same situation applied to them as well.  Too bad this restaurant use to be good.  With all the competition in Downtown Summerlin they need to get it together.

Dining review: CRAVE Downtown Summerlin

Food was ok. Service....SUCKED. It was only 3pm and not busy. Waited approx 10 minutes to get seated basically since they were waiting for the new shift of staff to come in. Waited at our table for another 15-20 minutes for a server to arrive. We had plenty of time to figure out what we wanted so we did drink and food order at the same time. Drinks arrived (we only ordered water and never were given refills)....then waited well over 30 minutes for just a turkey burger and chicken stir fry to show up. We saw our server only 3 times in the hour we were there and had to almost tackle him to pay attention to us to get our tab. Manager walked around a lot and was on his cell. Not a good view when people are waiting for food or have that look like they need assistance but no one is showing up. We weren't the only table that seemed to be forgotten. Staffing needs some work and management could step up and help out more as well in my opinion. We probably won't be going back.
Turkey burger was average and the chicken in the chicken stir fry was thinly sliced like it could of been used in a chicken sandwich or BLT style sandwich.
OMG, It was outdtandong. We sat outside for lunch  everyone treated us so special  the waiter went out of his way to please us. The food was absolutely  great. Definitely will return.

I hadn't heard of Crave but as a girlfriend and I were already at Downtown Summerlin to see a movie, we decided to go there for happy hour and a quick bite to eat. Our server Nicholas was a real joy. His suggestions for food were excellent and there's no doubt that his service is the reason we'll go back. We tried a couple of flatbreads and the honey sriracha wings. It was a perfect portion for the two of us. We had some happy hour cocktails, that went down a treat. The atmosphere was lovely, it had a pretty trendy feel to it, and was really spacious. All in all we had a great time and would recommend to our friends.

The food here is good and the atmosphere is nice. I'd definitely say that everything is a little bit overpriced. However, the staff is friendly and my friends & I had a good experience. I don't think I'll be 'craving' to eat here again but definitely wouldn't mind trying it out again.

Place was a joke salad wilted pizza cold and soggy tempura carrots cold and soggy really bad food all the way around.I asked for a glass of water the waiter dropped it off in a hurry.When he came back I asked for a straw he said they don't give straws with water unless you request so he would have to go get one really bad! So many things wrong with this place.60.00$ for lunch for me and my wife and 6year old grandson no alcohol.Will never go back
Crave in Downtown Summerlin. -awesome service, great ambiance and superb menu selections.  The salmon salad was the best I have ever had.  Jessica you rock!

I seriously created an account just to rate this bad restaurant. The service was horrible. Empty drinks for 20 minutes, no silverware, every time we asked a question to our waitress (not sure her name but she was a bigger black lady) she said "hold on let me check" and one question was about the price on the drinks since there are no prices listed. Ridiculous! Very bad first impression and I will not be going there again. I was so mad I really just started to ignore the waitress because she was quite useless.
Loved it Super awesome Yellowfin Tuna and Hamachi

The family and I decided to check out this new restaurant because there seemed to be a lot of buzz around it. We stopped by for a late afternoon bite and walked into a crowded entry. The place just opened, why wouldn't it be packed in here! However, that was not the case, there were 4 tables and 2 couch areas opened on the outside patio and the bar area had only a handful of patrons. There were 3 women at the hostess podium who were engaged in their own conversation. It looked like they were trying to figure what they were going to do. There was no friendly greeting nor did they even acknowledge our existence. One walked away, another when to seat the group in front of us, the blonde in the white shirt (I'm assuming she was management since everyone else was in all black) continued to ignore us and stare at her laptop even as I walked up to her. Another girl came by and greeted us, I asked if we could be seated outside. She commented that we can but she's not sure if there were any open tables as she hesitantly went to go check. My Husband commented that there were open tables, she returned a minute later and directed us to the patio. 

Our server was friendly, however service was bad. It took a while for him to greet us, take our drink order, take our food order, and our food took 40 mins. If the food was good, the wait time could easily be overlooked. The food is MEDIOCRE AT BEST! Seriously, we travel a lot, we eat out a lot and we love trying new places, nor are we snooty food critics. We simply enjoy dining out and appreciate getting what we pay for.

The menu is all over the place so I had a hard time deciding on what I wanted. There's sushi, burgers, pasta, salads, etc. There's no rhyme or reason for the menu. I ordered a salad and added a grilled chicken breast, my husband got the crave burger and our daughter got the baked mac n cheese. Yeah, we settled for this because nothing else seemed appetizing and as much as we love sushi I'm glad we didn't order from here. 

Again, the food was mediocre at best you can go elsewhere to get better food. The icing on the cake however was that THEY RAN OUT OF BEER! The server was kind enough to tell my husband that there was a possibility that they were out of Stella and make a 2nd choice just in case. The server ended up coming back because they were also out of his 2nd choice which was Miller Lite. Are you kidding me?? OH and did I mention, I also ordered a cocktail, some dragon drink. I don't remember the name of it nor can I comment on it because I NEVER GOT MY DRINK! I get it they just opened up, but you ran out of at least 2 types of beer at 4pm?

There's not too many restaurants open at Downtown Summerlin yet, until then go to the Red Rock Casino and enjoy better food and over 150 beers on tap at the Yard House!

No wait on a Friday night... Noise level is loud.  Sushi was ok had the Hamachi, Salmon and Rainbow roll.  Soy Sauce was very salty (more than most).  My daughter had the Bison Burger w/ Fries.  Said it was good but not great.  My son had the chicken and veggies off the kids menu.  Chicken was very dry and the broccoli was hard as a rock.  Prices were fair but I have to say I was not impressed.  Our server was very nice and on top of drink refills.  I guess I was expecting more and it was just average...

I ordered the Roasted Chicken, and it was unappetizing. The sauce was too sour or bitter. It had a hint of BBQ and soy sauce. The taste was just weird. The taste was confusing. The fried plantain tasted like soap. I would NOT recommend this place.

If you are looking for a pleasant dining experience this is not the place to go. Was greeted with nothing, but attitude when we walked in the door from the hostess. We asked for a booth and were told they had to clean one. We said no problem we would wait. 10 minutes later we still had no booth. I asked the hostess what the delay was and she tells me sorry they are waiting for people to get up foe desert and it may be 15 more minutes. I told her the table was empty. She responds with, sorry someone else took that table and there is nothing she could do about it. I said can't you ask them to get up? Needless to say that wasn't happening either. Then I asked to speak to the manager and she did nothing to help either so we left and definitely won't be back. There are a lot of great options in the area. Don't waste your time or money here. Your business will not be appreciated.

Came here for lunch. We sat out on the patio which was interesting on a side note as all the booths were filled and they weren't seating in general at the tables in the center due to having to sit in direct sunlight, but we noticed that they had umbrellas so we asked to be seated at a table and had a umbrella moved to give us some shade. It took about 10 - 15 minutes before a wait staffer came to ask for our drink order, so as we waited we noticed a table of 3 women who order the hamburgers which looked really good, but what caught our attention was that all 3 of them ate their burgers with a knife and fork. It took another 10 -15 minutes before our drinks came and the waiter informed us that he was actually not the waiter assigned to our table and that our assigned waiter would come shortly to take our orders. It took another 10 mins before we saw our new waiter, so in the meantime we watched as a family of 3 insisted on being seated in a booth near us where the sun was shining directly at the table. The woman was pushing a stroller and we saw that there was a small dog inside, not a baby. When our waiter finally appeared to take our order we chose a starter of the Walleye cakes and then for entrees I ordered the Mexican sushi roll which was the only roll on their menu that had any hot spice to it, my partner ordered the Kogi tacos. As we now waited for our food, I noticed the lady at the booth looking distressed and covering her head with a magazine to block out the sun, she was frantically looking around for something. Her husband and son looked peaceful and were chatting quietly over the menu, the little dog in the stroller was soaking up the sunshine, finally the lady waved down a waiter and much to my surprise, asked him if he would move the umbrella that was at OUR table over to hers. Seriously?! Wow... The waiter looked confused and said that he couldn't do that as it was in use at OUR table. Ok, moving on now to the review on our food. The Walleye cakes were interesting but not enough to ever order again and personally felt they were overpriced at $ 13.95, they were just 3 little patties of wild rice and red onion with a tarter dipping sauce. My partner's kogi beef tacos were good with a nice flavor but a bit too sweet for my taste. My Mexican sushi roll was just eh....nothing memorable or different from any other standard roll. Overall, we spent almost 2 hours there with 3/4 of it waiting for service and food, if not for the side notes of "people watching" it would not be a memorable experience at all.

I tried this place fir the first time for a late dinner. I thought the menu had a nice variety and the food was pretty good. If you can score a discount coupon it is a great deal. Our server was friendly and attentive.

I really can't say this place deserves one star.  We are visiting our son and he was taking us out to eat and chose this place.  I suppose the food was good but finally after over an hour we still didn't have any food even though our server said it would just be a few minutes about four times, even saying they would take 20% off our check, which really equates to a tip they wouldn't have received and didn't deserve anyway. They seem to cater to the bar group.  There really weren't that many people in the place.
The menu is way too extensive to begin with.
By the way if this place makes another year I'll be very surprised.

Enjoyed a great meal with 7 of my girlfriends! Our server Casi was outstanding! Her knowledge of the menu was great, but her ability to know how to serve us without over doing it was refreshing! She is friendly & a real pleasure! I loved the Bison burger, but everyone at our table was very happy with their food. I can't wait to go back again!

The 3 stars are only for our server! He was great! We were a loud party of 12! The food was not good at all. So bland and such small portions! I had been there for lunch and didn't eat my food at all, it was just not good but a friend wanted to have his b day brunch there. The breakfast had no flavor and it wAs so small, we were hungry after we ate so we ordered donuts, and they tasted like empty calories. However the bottomless mimosas are great and only 11 bucks!

Walked in today looking for a place that has happy hour. We were greeted by a rude young Asian lady wearing a skimpy dress who seemed like she didn't want to be there. She gave us attitude and seated us in an area that does not have a server! We waited for about 15 mins and decided to walk out. Place looks fancy, service absolutely sucks.

Went during lunch hour on a Friday and was surprised at how empty it was.  I ordered the Vegas Roll and my husband had the mac and cheese with chicken as recommended by our waiter.  Both our meals were amazing!  The service was awesome as well.  We asked our server if they offered a military discount and he stated they did but later discovered they actually didn't.  He then gave us a discount that he picked up.  The only complaint I have is that when we were seated the hostess' dress was so short she was literally holding it down as she walked us to out table.

We normally come here and are usually happy with the service. Tonight our bartender was busy so we asked William if we could get ramekins and soy sauce for our sushi. He said yes. William had the GALL to sit next to us with his friends, drink a shot and never told our bartender that we needed the ramekins and soy sauce or get them for us. William represents CRAVE, he was still wearing his CRAVE uniform when he sat down with his VIP friends and drank that shot. Apparently it doesn't count if you regularly go to CRAVE, only if you're friends of William does it matter. I hope William's friends come as often as we did. Or maybe we should befriend William, I think NOT!!!
This place has amazing sushi! Alfred at the Sushi Bar is exceptional! Sushi was so fresh, I highly recommend it.

I had the Lobster and Shrimp flatbread. Decent. I advise coming here at night because the day time its pretty gloomy and feels like night anyway and no one spoke to me as if I didn't exist. Maybe will try again but first will try more restaurants in this mall

First time with my wife. Had happy hour and the Sushi and Kogi Beef Taco are wonderful. Great greeting at the door and wait staff was great. Being they are new they have a lot in training and they all seem very attentive  and professional. Beautiful Resturant.  We will be back. 5 stats guus. Keep up the great job. Will be back for my birthday on the 20th. Looking for a full dinner. Will post how that goes.

I took my husband here for his birthday with my daughter. We were seated and they only brought us two waters. They brought us another water and took our order. I asked for the dressing on the side for my salad and when it came the dressing was drizzled on the salad. The food is pretty pricey and the fish is not fresh. My daughter had the California roll and it was $9 for 6 little pieces. The imitation crab was dry and the roll did not hold together. Our bill came out to be $100 with some other things. But other than that the server was nice and helpful.

30 minutes to get drinks, (beer for me, and lemonade for kids).  This was very disorganized situation understandably being the opening day of downtown summerlin.  The food was above average actually so they get 2 stars when you factor in 30 minutes to get the first drinks, and almost 1.5 hours for food to arrive.  The complete disorganized situation negates the desire to return here.

All of the staff was very cold and unfriendly from the hostess to the server.  You do not feel welcome at all and almost like you being there is putting them out.

We asked to sit outside, but they only had tables in the sun.  We took the sunny table but after about 20 minutes it was just too hot.  We saw the hostess setting up more tables outside in the shade and asked if we could move.  She just said no she was setting these up for another party but did not offer to move us inside or elsewhere.  A couple minutes later her, and who I think was the manager, were setting up chairs for the tables and we we asked if we could just move inside then.  We were told yeah give us a minute.  So they proceeded to both push in chairs and get everything ready for the guests who hadn't arrived yet instead of relocating the guests who were already there and sweltering in the sun.  It seems like one of them could have handled pushing in the chairs and the other could have re-seated us.  

Once we were eventually moved and received our food nobody ever came by to check on us or refill our drinks, which were both empty.  After we had finished eating and our drinks were still empty the server finally came around, but by that point we were just ready to go.

I can deal with bad service if the food is good, but that was not the case.  I ordered a flatbread pizza and it barely had any cheese on it.  Maybe 40% was covered in cheese.  Most of my bites were just the flatbread with tomato sauce.  All of the entrees were way overpriced too.

The whole vibe in this restaurant was just bad.  We couldn't wait to get out of there.  I will not be giving this place another try.

The food is okay, I wished it was better.  I really like the concept and decor., but I wished the food was more on par with the pricing.  With a name like Crave, the food should be so good, that you crave it.

We just went to crave for lunch.  We were given a high top, which we asked politely if we could change, to no avail.  We felt like we were annexed to a time out seat!  The hamburger was rare, when I had ordered med well.  My husband ordered a noodle chicken stir fry, which looked and tasted as if it came out of a can!  Inedible!  We won't be back.

30 min wait for seating.
1 hour for bread on table. 15 more mins for food.

"Aint nobody got time for that"


The place is a mess right now. Not just us but multiple tables with the hand on face bored looks and wtf is going on faces.

I know it's new but come on. I have been to new places that aren't this messed up.

Hold off on this place for a few months and see if they get their act together.

The food seemed OK but not THAT good.
The bimbimbap is special and tasty. I like it. It mixed some thai food element. Especially i am surprised to taste coconut rice.

Fantastic meal was had by all. Jacob was a wonderful server. Extremely attentive given how insanely busy this new restaurant is. It was difficult to b pick just a few dishes. Everything on the menu looked great. The Chicken Sausage flatbread is not to be missed. The Sliders, both pork belly and sirloin, were great. The sushi was good, but order early as there was a considerable wait from the sushi counter. The kids devoured the chicken fingers, mac n cheese, and s'more brownie. It's a new restaurant, folks, wait a couple months before posting your negativity.

The flatbread pizzas were delicious.   A few unique flavor options which was nice.  I had the asian chicken salad.  Very large portion...wasnt able to finish it all.  It was good, not the very best I've had, but still good.  A wide selection of food on the menu.  I will be back to try other items.  Modern and clean place.

Great locations as few restaurants are open at downtown Summerlin. Nice busy bar vibe but that carries into the restaurant and it becomes noisy.  The menu is very limiting unless you are there for sushi but it you really wanted sushi wouldn't you go to a dedicated sushi restaurant for added freshness. 

I ordered the lamb meatballs which was a special and sounded great, and luckily the waitress told me that many patrons had said how spicy it was. I ended up with the Asian salad.  Nothing special.  If you want bread its $1.95 for a basket that comes with soggy crisps, two small pieces of just ok foccacia and pita bread.  

Grand total bill was over $65 for a salad, two drinks...one so bad I could not drink it, and a pasta dish that I could have made at home 

The waitress was adorable and the design nice so maybe after they close someone can make something more out of the space. 

I won't be back
Have been here a couple of times. It is a great spot for relaxing after shopping in Downtown Summerlin. The service is always great and they have a variety of food, including sushi!
Had dinner here three times now.  Tonight we had Mahi-mahi again.  This time the Mahi-mahi was not prepared correct.  The rice and sauce was flat. Disappointed  with tonight's fish.

This was my first time here and I had an amazing time! The food was good and so were the drink. The best part of our experience here was our server, Bryan. He was very attentive and sweet from start to finish. He would constantly round to make sure we did not need anything and had a smile every time.  Definitely check this place out and request him. We came Saturday night and also got love music and the dj was spinning great songs!

There's a reason this place can't make 4 stars... Just pay attention and you'll see why.  Found a large long hair on my 702 burger... And the greens on the burger were awful... Yellow with rotten tips.  Didn't look like the chef was even trying to hide the zero quality of the arugula.  I wouldn't call the cook a chef to be honest.  

I wasn't offered any real apology, a free dessert or anything, still had to pay full price for everything and the replacement dish.  

When I found the hair, it took 5 minutes and I had to get out of my seat for me to get someone's attention, still had to wait after getting up when finally a manager noticed after a second pass.  It wasn't busy, the service was just poor, neglectful, just sad... The burger was returned and I ordered something else because I didn't trust a cook who served spoiled arugula (that should have been thrown away awhile ago) to not try and recycle some parts of the burger I sent back.  

Water was empty 3 times and had to wait 3 times.  

People need to remember, these low star reviews are just showing what people see.  It's always worse than how it looks.  The only reason I went here was because I had stubborn company.  I would guess that the idiot owners have a lot of money and take for granted that this place is in downtown summerlin and resting on the value of the location, so they don't seem to actually care about the quality of the food or service.  

An infant in a high chair was playing with their paper menu, it fell on the floor and a hostess walked right by it without picking it up.  This table was not situated in a way where I could believe anyone sober could actually not notice it.  The parents didn't see because of how the infant was positioned around the table.  The manager walked by, noticed, and picked it up and put it back on the table.  The infant picked it up and dropped it again.  Things that fall on the floor don't belong on a table... Especially in a restaurant, especially in front of babies that put their hands in their mouth.  In the food industry, there is absolutely nothing, in any circumstance ever, where the right thing to do when something falls on the floor, is to pick it up and put it back where it fell from.  

Whoever owns this place definitely did not deserve the money they thoughtlessly threw into this place.  

This is my 3rd or 4th Yelp review... Maybe only second... Because I only dump on places that actually deserve to be called trash.  This is not an isolated bad experience, a bad apple... This is pretty foundational.  The staff doesn't need a pep talk or a little staff meeting, it needs an episode on Restaurant Impossible.

It's truly a hit or miss.  I've been to CRAVE 4 times now.  I went there yesterday around 2 pm.  There were no more than 4 tables and 2 servers, yet the service was poor.  I asked for items and did not get them.  Our server never asked us if we needed anything.  On top of that, the kitchen was incredibly slow.  I ordered the premium bento box.  The dynamite roll was mediocre.   Best part was the fresh fruit... the funniest part of my experience was when we complained to the manager, while he gave us our check, and I noticed that my table was charged an extra plate!!  Thankfully the manager gave us a discount.  It's really the least he could do. Management really needs to improve their system and service.  It's not worth your money or time due to the inconsistency.

The atmosphere was upscale but relaxing. We sat outdoors with our 14 month old son. He ran around the patio(we were the only ones out there) and the staff were so kind and interactive with him. The bison burger was AMAZING! Tip: order the bison medium/rare. It's a very lean meat so the rare meat juices mixed with the egg yolk was to die for. We will definitely be back here to try more of their dishes.

After seeing a lot of the negative reviews my friend and I decided anyways to check it out since the menu seemed pretty tasty. Upon finishing our lunch here I'd have to say I don't know what people are talking about in terms of bad service. My water was constantly refilled and my server was super nice and checked back multiple times during our meal to see if we were doing ok. Great feel to the place. Would definitely come back again. I had the Bison burger which was amazing and also the sliders to start. Also amazing. The only thing I didn't like was the butterscotch pudding for dessert slough it was risky probably to order it anyway but the texture was a little strange and it was too much. But that might just be the butterscotch flavoring. I dunno but other than that great experience. Will come again for sure one day.

Just order simply grill steak with medallions option didn't like it because the medallions ONLY 3!!! With some potatoes and rainbow califlower and honestly too expensive for such 3 little pieces of meat....for having meat in your dinner menu it should be at least good pieces of neat for the value $$$$ so sorry
Had some great sushi today at Crave . Gary did awesome job. Had special desert chocolate treat to finish our experience at Crave. Nice place to start your day off right.

Came here with a group of 8. Took 25 minutes to just get our drink orders. 6 out of 8 orders were incorrect. I ordered the steak medium and it came out well done and the appetizer soup came out after my steak???

The waitress was very nice but you could tell the the mess the kitchen was in was taking its toll on her and her customers.

It almost felt that there was too many staff working Friday night and they would just form these little groups and chat for 5-10 minutes and then go off and do some work again.

Like I mentioned above most of what we ordered came out all wrong. Sushi orders were all mixed up, items we didn't even order were constantly being dropped off at our table. It was chaos and we pretty much rolled with the ouches and just had to laugh at how it was one thing after another. It was definitely one of the most bizarre dinners we ever had.

Oh and someone might want to let the hostess know she doesn't have to scream the large font headers on the menu to the patrons at the table when she seats them, I was near deaf afterwords and we could barely keeps ourselves from bursting out laughing.




I won't be returning.

We had tried Crave when it first opened and felt it was nothing really special. We went back for a date night based on their signage outside offering a date night special! It consisted of 2 appetizers and 2 entrees (from a choice of 5 or so) 2 small desserts and a bottle of wine for $50! It was a great deal and great food as well! The portions were perfect and enough that we took home some for lunch the next day! Nicholas was a great server and appeared to be happy at what he was doing! We will definitely do that again!

I ate here several years ago and the food was excellent, so leading into yesterday I had high expectations for this place. My girlfriend and I go in and I'm so excited to eat here. Our waitress comes and says hello, and my girlfriend immediately asks about happy hour. She returns about 15 min later and just sets down the happy hour menu and takes off. We've been sitting there for 25 min with just waters, and I haven't even been able to ask for a drink yet. Another waitress came over to take our order which I was grateful for. The people sitting next to us were already getting their appetizers and drinks, despite having sat down 10 min after us. Our waitress continued to walk past us not talking to us, so we just left because we couldn't take it anymore. We went to the fine establishment, Raising Canes, which was a great choice that also saved us about 50$. I'm a waiter so I know when customer service is bad; I am understanding and I don't ask for a lot at all. I JUST WANTED A BEER, WINGS, AND A BURGER! Probably dessert too because I was starving. It's too bad our waitress missed out on an easy 20$ tip. 1st bad review I've ever had to write on a place.

Second and last time at Crave. The host was friendly and we were sitted immediately.  Atmosphere was pleasant. A beautiful day to enjoy their patio.

For an appetizer we ordered the truffle fries. My wife and daughter loved them. For our entree we ordered the Crave burger, a sushi roll and Asian salad. Food was good not great. 

Unfortunately, it took over 45 minutes to get out food. Two tables next to us both ordered after us but received their food before us. 

When we complained to our server, Marcos, he said he would have the manager talk to us. Our food came, the Manger never did. Our server told us one more time that the Manger would come to our table. When our bill came, our server said all he could do was give us a coupon for a free appetizer on our next visit. The problem is there will not be a next visit. We where not looking for a freebie, we just wanted an acknowledgment that this is not the norm or an apology for making us wait. 

You can't tell customers that the Manger will come to the table and he/she never shows.  On top of a lunch Bill of $60 for three people  (no alcohol, one soda)

I went there on a Wednesday night and it was deserted. Happy hour is from 9 pm to close. Ordered buffalo wings and they came out cold. They were gracious enough to make them for me again but they were slightly better than the first order. I was hungry and so I didn't complain. In addition to the wings, I had chips and guacamole, plus crispy pork dumplings. Both wee alright. Maybe next time, IF I go back, I will try the sushi. The waitress was really nice and attentive which really helped. The food wasn't horrible but it wasn't anything spectacular. The best part of the meal was my mini dessert!

Food was average, but definitely overpriced for what it is -- bar food and wannabe sushi. Ordered 2 appetizers, one roll, drink, and my  bill was $60. Probably won't come back unless they lower their prices or increase the quality of their food.

Went here for Easter Brunch. I made a reservation because I figured their brunch buffet would be popular, especially on Easter. Got there and discovered the buffet was only at their Minnesota locations...maybe they should have advertised that. Regardless, we decided to stay because we were starving. We were seated at a table closest to the kitchen and shortly after we ordered our food there was complete chaos in the kitchen. I've never seen so many blank stares. There were so many dishes under the hot lamps and some of them sat there for 30+ minutes! It took TWO HOURS to get our food and when we did it wasn't even right. My sandwich was missing cheese and my sister's chocolate chip pancakes were full of blueberries instead. The manager came over to give us our bill and never apologized or anything. Plus it was the FULL bill. Even after they said they would take off the pancakes. The manager never even apologized until my boyfriend went up and complained about the terrible service. We ended up getting 30% off and a gift card for our horrific experience, but I have no intention of returning here. What a waste of time. The only breath of fresh air was our waiter, he was just as frustrated as we were but had a good sense of humor about it. Needless to say, our Easter did not start off on a good note because of CRAVE.

We dropped in here during a 3-night stay in Vegas and enjoyed it immensely. I had mashed potatoes, turkey, fried chicken, corn, and biscuits and would rate each as extraordinary. I also had shrimp which was very good but not extraordinary like my other selections. On the down side, the brisket was kinda chewy and the crab legs disappointed. Fruit and watermelon on the buffet tasted like it was fresh off of an Iowa farm. The server working our area was friendly, alert, helpful, and worked like crazy. Well worth the cost and really was a nice satisfying place.

Horrible experience on the first visit!! I visited the restaurant for work dinner on Wednesday night. We had calamari and bread platter as appetizer and I had scallops as the main dish. I got a terrible food poisoning after the dinner. I was up all night, feeling very sick and I was close going to the emergency room. I have every reason to believe that those scallops were either not properly stored or were not fresh. I would highly recommend not going to this restaurant for sea food unless you want to spend your night on the toilet and throwing up. 

I eat seafood 1-2 times a week and I don't think seafood has ever made me sick.

Edit: ended up going to the emergency room in the morning. Definitely not a good choice of restaurant.

Had dinner here last night and I won't be coming back. The food was mediocre, definitely not worth the prices they charged. $13 for a crab and artichoke dip that was very small and had no visible crab in it.
My friend order the Mac and cheese and I had the special ancho-chili ribeye. She had maybe 6 bites and kept adding salt&pepper to it bc it had no taste. My ribeye was ok, the sauce was very tasty but I enjoy the one at Outback more. 
Our server took about 15-20 minutes to deliver my drink/take our order. Then she returned maybe 2 more times before delivering our check. 
Overall don't bother coming here, it's bad service and mediocre food with a very high price tag.

Super pricey and not that delicious! We spent Valentine's Day at home with and invited our best friends (another couple) over and my bf ordered food from bite squad to be delivered to home. The packaging of the food was ugly, and the portions were ridiculously small! My bf spent over 300$ that night and everything was blah! Nothing special even the chocolate cakes he ordered (tasted like grocery store cake). Complete disappointment.

Sat in bar area.  Service was decent.

The food:

Crispy rice -  Two large square of pale pinkish tuna that looked like very low quality and the consistency of a well blended hummus.  The pieces were too large and had a gagging consistency

Duck Flatbread - Supposedly a specialty.  Tasted like Fig jam and the duck looked like it was microwaved.  Greens were dirty and flacid. 

Sushi - very large pieces but not very good.  Too much rice on the rolls and didn't look appetizing or taste very good

Dips - Soggy cucumber pieces and cold flatbread with three spreads that were decent.  Best food item but not saying much.

None of our food went back to the kitchen empty and almost all of the flatbread was on the plate when the server took it away.  No questions were asked if we liked it or if we were just full.   The truth is it was hard to eat any more.

Manager looked like she was going to a coffee shop with a very large back tattoo and could only be distinguished when she helped with a credit card.  Her appearance was a reflection of food and experience.

Good selection , sushi was ok..
Soup and Turkey Blt was good.
Most likely will come back again !
Atmosphere was fun , clean and no wait
Service was great! Food was average, some servings were cold. Mimosas were not included for brunch. Needed more variety.

I do not know why this place has only 3 stars!! My experience here was great!! The service and food was absolutely amazing!! The ambiance was very relaxed. If you are looking for something different to try out definitely pay a visit to this place! Did I mention the dessert was awesome!!!

The Crave Burger was awesome! I rarely order a burger nevertheless finish one but I ate the whole thing and smiled with each bite. I definitely recommend the Crave Burger. 

The quinoa spinach salad side was good - not as flavorful as the burger but good.

So yummy!!! We had the yellowtail app and sea weesld salad too. Both AMAZING!!! Norwegian Salmon and MahiMahi was on point. 
Our waiter was perfect. He had a man bun and i failed to get his name but he was so good.

From out of town. Great restaurant, wonderful staff, very friendly. The food was superb, excellent service, each course came exactly on time. The manager even came over to see if everything was okay. Will definately go back we we go back to Vegas!

I have been to Crave several times for lunch and have always had a wonderful experience :-) I love the idea that it is a scratch kitchen and the interesting menu choices too (not your average boring items)! The kale salad, bison burger, and lobster mac n cheese are definitely items to try..delicious!  The atmosphere is fun too! I enjoyed being able to watch all the action in the kitchen! If you're looking for a new, fun place to enjoy different kinds of food...this is your spot!!

Terrible service, very rude. I felt like they didn't  care if we will come back or not.  So guess what me and my husband are boycotting Crave.  We will tell all of our friends not to eat there as well.  Good luck surviving next door to Wolfgang puck!!!!
Bernaise Burger & Pablano Ceasar IS SO DELICIOUS, HEARTY, RICH .. FLAVORS Are PERFECT!! YUMMM  Marcos our waiter was knowledgeable & recommended the above dishes, which I will have again

What an great experience at Craze.  Staff was on the ball with food and drinks during busy holiday season.  About three to four  Christmas parties were going on and staff was amazing to watch. They were very attentive to us and the parties. Great customer service and cant wait for our next visit.

The seabass was so good think we will be back next week.

Came here for lunch after a few hours of shopping at Downtown Summerlin. It's quite a large place and wasn't very busy, but it was earlier than the lunch rush and a weekday.

The waiter was very nice and attentive. He was very cute as well. A little young for this old cougar but I won't complain.

Between us, we had the chicken wings and an asian salad. Pretty healthy now that I look back. Five stars for the food and service. Minus one star for my average sized lunch costing me $18. Yeeshka! 

I would say this place would be good for a business lunch where you company is paying or a date, where the guy is paying. Great vibe. I need to get back into dating.

First time here. Sat at the bar and was told the draft beer system was broken for a few weeks, ordered a few drinks, looked over the menus but was ignored time and time again from what seemed to be a short staffed bar....not impressed. Will not return.

3 stars is exactly what it is...although if you consider the prices it maybe should be 2.5. Food was ok, service was ok, and the place was pretty empty for a Friday night. When you are paying good money you should not have to ask for silverware when your food gets to the table. I found it funny that all the empty tables had bread plates, but no silverware. I don't feel any need to go back, so I guess I'll wait for it to go out of business  and change hands before I return.

For being open less than a week, this restaurant is horrible. 6 hostesses at the front telling us it is a 45min wait only to be seated in a restaurant that is only 1/3 full. The meal took an insane amount of time to be brought to us only to have soggy luke warm fries. Sushi was average but not memorable. Dessert (a small mousse cup) took nearly 15 min to be served and STILL had a shortbread cookie in it in spite of us being told it was the only gluten free dessert and us making it clear we needed it without the cookie. Since we had to leave (since the whole meal took twice as long as necessary) The waitress merely suggested it be removed from the bill since it could take another 20 minutes to put mousse in a 2in cup. Absolutely absurd. Looking around the restaurant at any time one saw waiters just loitering around....so they are clearly not under staffed on the floor , maybe the issues stem from the kitchen that isn't even prepared to serve to a restaurant less than half full. I won't bother returning.

This place is a joke and a disgrace to summerlin!
I had the blackened fish tacos and they were mostly filled with the slaw and a very small piece of cold fish... zero flavor! Not to mention, who the hell wants French fries with tacos!!!??? Chips and salsa should be automatic... the fries were cold and undercooked! Not to mention someone there is obviously afraid of salt! Ridiculous

We enjoyed Happy Hour and happy hour prices ($8 and under), even though with adult entrees, kids eat free! We tried the lemon butter wings, crab artichoke dip, chicken lettuce wraps (amazing), truffle fries, shrimp guppies, firecracker shrimp and some other things. The customer service was absolutely amazing! My son said this is his new favorite restaurant.

I've dined at Crave restaurant twice.  The food was just ok.  Nothing to rave about.  The atmosphere is nice.  The management staff was just mediocre.  During my first experience, our party ordered 4 Sangria's.  The waiter heads over with the drinks, places three on the table and drops the fourth.  Glass and red sangria spill all over my sister.  The waiter was very apologetic, but the management staffs response was lackluster at best.  They made no attempts to accomodate my sister or replace her sweater which now had red sangria and glass all over it.  The manager never provided her card or name for follow up.  This experience left a bitter taste with us, forcing us to move our weekly girls outing to another location.
First and last time here , food is just average and service was not good , sorry to see a restaurant in such a great location can't do any better .

Being the only place open in Downtown Summerlin we were kind of forced to try this  restaurant out. 

The atmosphere was alright, it was your typical chain restaurant bland atmosphere.

I know I can't give 0 stars but even if I could I would still give 1 star because our server, Victor, was fun and knowledgeable. 

 I LOVE sushi and was excited to see that they had a menu that was relatable to sushi and non sushi lovers. I ordered the Mexican Roll and a side of sashimi. I was super excited because i love anything spicy. I ate the majority of my roll because it was good! Everything was going great until early the next morning when I felt extremely sick, as did my other friend (who also got the sashimi).

OMG!!!! Kayla is an amazing bartender! She read my mind and came up with best cocktail possible for me!!! She was super nice and friendly, her personality lit up the room. I'm gonna be back! 5 star service Bravo Kayla!!! bravo!

I was amazed as soon as I walked in! The hostesses were very welcoming and enthusiastic. The waiter had so many great recommendations for their sushi and sandwiches. The food arrived in a timely fashion, the prices maybe a little high for some but it's well worth it.

we visited Crave for the first time today.  The establishment was nice with modern decor and very clean.  The service was excellent, our waiter was very attentive and answered all of our questions.  Our food selections were not so great however.  We started with the edamame appetizer, it was boring no and bland.  Our son had a flatbread pepperoni pizza that looked good and he enjoyed but the side selections were no good.  I had the pork butt Rueben, didn't like it at all.  Just slices of fat with slaw, should have guessed that though.  My husband had the miso salmon.  He said it was bland and flavorless, where was the miso glaze?  Would maybe give it a second chance sometime.

Had the Crave Burger, it was very tasty, meat was cooked as ordered. The customer service was not good. I asked twice for utensils as my dad had ordered pasta. I ended up and just getting my table's own utensils from another adjacent table. We weren't going to sit there while the food got cold while waiting for utensils. No one stopped me to offer service or replace the utensil sets i just took. It is also very loud. 

I think the concept is great where you can get anything, even sushi here all in one location, but If customer service continues to stink, folks are better off going to sushi loca and 5 guys across the mall.

The happy hour is reasonably priced but the service was not too good.  The drinks were watered down and took forever, meanwhile all the food came out at one time which was quite annoying. The food was okay. The fire alarm went off several times no one came over to apologize or tell us why it was happening. All and all happy hour was not so happy.

We were waiting for a table when we decided to sit down at the sushi bar. We were Amazed by the creativity and delicious plates. Thank you Chefs Luis P., Kevin V., and Aldredo T. for the great experience.  If you are looking for a fresh sushi place this location will exceed your expectations. We will definitely be back very soon.

Went for lunch this weekend, and enjoyed it very much.  We were seated promptly, and our server took our drink orders.  My daughter was with me, and ordered off the kids menu.  Her sliders were delicious.  I had a Cuban sandwich, which was also delicious.  Our server was friendly, and quickly took care of an item that came out wrong.  Prices are reasonable.  My only complaint (and this happens frequently at other restaurants, too) is that I was about 3/4 through my meal, when our server asked if we had room for dessert.  I finished my bite ( ;-) and said no.  The check was then presented.  I can see that maybe our server thought we were in a rush to get back out shopping, but it's a pet peeve of mine to be asked about dessert when I'm still chewing on my meal!  All in all though, we would return next time we are at Downtown Summerlin.

Have the rib eye, was amazing!!! Cooked to perfectly, girl had a sushi roll she said it was really good. Had a app the crab and artichoke dip was very good, service was amazing, will def recommend this to everyone I know.

Not a terrible experience, but I won't be back. Paid $13 for a sandwich and salad but the portioning is really small for the price. They gave me a small cup instead of a full side salad and the sandwich was pretty small and didn't really have much on it. Service was fair and everything else was fine, but I don't feel I got my money's worth. Bummer!

Did not expect a great meal because Crave was new  and I assumed that they were not 100% up to speed yet...  I was wrong. It was great!

The cocktail list was amazing! Expertly crafted artisan style.
Sushi was the best I have had in Vegas. (Not the "same old" boring sushi that every other place has. ) New quality ingredients and textures that create wonderful flavors that I had yet to experience.

The decor is upscale, warm, and welcoming.

For this price point... definitely a five star experience!

We were at this restaurant about 4'ish on Monday afternoon during happy hour.  I ordered the Kobe tacos as an appetizer and they were so spicy I could hardly eat them.  My girlfriend ordered the roast chicken w/salsa and specifically asked for no halopenias.  The meal came out spicy hot.  Upon complaining to the waiter, who was also the bartender, we were given the bill with no apologize or reduction in the amount.  Although the restaurant is very quaint, customer service needs to be improved. We will not be going back to this facility.

My husband and I like trying new places to eat. We finally went to Crave for lunch on Father's day. 

We had the dumpling & bruschetta for appetizer which was good and it all went downhill after that. For entree my husband had the crave burger which took forever & I had the bento box which sat at the counter for a while, bento box was a waste of money!!! We were seated right by the service area & sushi bar. Timing was very bad. Our server kept apologizing for the delay in our dessert.

They should have anticipated that it was going to be busy due to father's day.

Our waitress was extremely nice and friendly. She always had a smile on her face which was very welcoming! We ordered our food and it felt like eternity until it came out. Considering the very very small amount of people in the restaurant, I was confused as to why it took so long... the portions are smaller than usual and the prices are also much higher especially for lunch. I don't even wanna know how much a pasta dish costs for dinner...overall the food was good, nothing special and nothing I couldn't get anywhere else.

New concept of having American and Japanese food fare.  Dishes looking appetizing, but the taste are just average.  Service is off balance.  Not sure if it is due to new opening or volume of folks being served.

Came here for the first time last night. Wasn't very impressed. The hostesses were nice & since there was an hour left of happy hour and my honey is a beer connoisseur we decided to sit at the bar. Wow, wish we would have just gotten a table. 

One of the bartenders came around & asked me what I'd like to drink. I asked if they had coke. She said "umm..." And had to turn around to look at the sodas to see. Then she said yes they did. After she brought our drinks, somehow she disappeared & another woman bartender, Samantha, took over. 

Now I'm not sure what was going on behind the bar, but there was some drama & confusion because the three bartenders were muttering to each other. I'm not sure what the problems were but you could tell they were stressed out. I've worked in restaurants before & I understand how stressful it can be, but that's no excuse to give bad service. And that's what she did. 

We asked for menus & decided we'd just order some apps from the happy hour menu. Samantha, in the middle of listening to our order, walked away from us when another bartender walked by her and said something to her. Just walked away! I wasn't sure if she had gotten all of our order or what! Then she came back and said "I'm sorry" & looked at us so we ordered again. 

Basically once we ordered we hardly saw her again. Pretty sad considering we were AT THE BAR and so on front of her the whole time.

Our food was good, especially the beef tacos & the tempura sushi. Very good. 

When it was time to pay the bill we put the money in the glass & waited for Samantha to close it out. Only she didn't pick it up. She kept walking back & forth, making drinks, etc. completely ignoring us until finally my boyfriend called out "excuse me. We'd like to close our tab out". Pretty sad. 

All in all, we'll probably go back again. But never will I sit at the bar.

Decent food and atmosphere was ruined by absolutely poor service.  Our server made horrible errors at every stage of the meal; forgot a cocktail and a second drink, brought the wrong bottle of wine (didn't catch it until AFTER we opened it - my bad) but the right bottle was on the bill (more expensive than what we drank!), brought starters out WITH the entrees, didn't check on us until AFTER I'd already finished my entree... really annoying stuff you'd expect at a noisy family burger joint, not a mid-priced restaurant posing as a four-star dining establishment.  It's an over-glorified Red Robin, complete with sophomoric cheers and "alrights" as we ordered, from an amateur server who is best suited for a college hangout than a "dining experience".  I blame management for this nonsense; I won't be back.

I'm giving this restaurant 1 star.. Although the service is good... The food was not something I would come back for. It was very bland and unsatisfying. This was my first time and more than likely my last
Overpriced, overrated....have had better food from a Food truck.
Came here with some friends and everything was delicious! Will definitely be back... Ordered the chicken caprese rosa and risotto balls to start and both were amazing! Loved the cute live music too
Lisa& I came here for lunch. Have to say very nice place with different variety food. The customer service friendly& helpful. Highly recommend this place to everyone ..

I will never go back again! My husband and I went there for the 1st time; needless to say, we were starving. The hostess sat us down and nobody showed up to take our orders. We literally sat at our table for 12 minutes w/o any service. We walked out, but before leaving we stopped at the hostess stand. We politely told them why we were leaving. They stared at us blankly without remorse, and did not even try to stop us.

There are plenty of good restaurants at Downtown Summerlin, but we love to support the annual Restaurant Week, so we decided to stop in here on a recent weekday. The food was fine, and the price was right--especially considering that some of our $20 lunch was going to a good cause!

My husband had the avocado rolls and the Crave burger. Not much to say about the rolls, but the burger was pretty good. I had the edamame and bento box, and I think I got the better bargain. The edamame was delicious--among the best I've ever had--served warm with a tasty Sriracha soy glaze. The bento box was chock-full of delights, from fruit and salad to fried shrimp and four different types of rolls (tuna, salmon, yellowtail, and cucumber). We both had the mini blueberry cheesecake for dessert, which was served parfait-style. As I said, the food was fine, but nothing (except for that awesome edamame) was compelling enough to bring me back.

Service was good, although they brought out our entrees before we had finished our appetizers. While waiting for our food, I read their happy hour menu, and that looks like a promising deal. Much of the menu reads like the Yard House happy hour, which is one of my favorites, so if I lived nearby, I think I would stop in occasionally for that. But otherwise, I think I will try one of the other Downtown Summerlin restaurants next time I am in the area.

We were starving and since this was the only restaurant open, we decided to give it a try.
From the moment we walked in, the hostesses were pretty clueless and despite many empty tables, they said there was a 15 minute wait. No problem we said, we will have a drink at the bar. There were three bartenders working, and the tall male bartender directly in front of us wouldn't turn around to ask me if I wanted anything to drink. He was too busy chatting to the other bartenders and slicing his lemons and garnish.  I was practically waiving the menu to get his attention but was unsuccessful. Luckily the hostess came over and said our table was ready. She brought us to a high top table in the bar area which was too small for me and my guest. I asked for a normal table in the restaurant area and she said no problem, but it will be another 10-15 minutes. Ok, I will try to get that pumpkin spice Ale that I was thirsty for. Still unsuccessful in getting the bartenders attention (he is really focused) the hostess comes back and seats us at a booth in the back. On the way, I told her about the problem with the bartender. She just smiled and told me to ask my server for a beverage. She was totally unaccommodating.

The server came and she was great, so no real complaints about her. I did notice however that most of the servers came and went like waves. I mean they would be all over the tables and then they would all disappear for  7-10 minutes at a time. I mean no service staff at all in the restaurant. 

The appetizers came and they were fantastic. It took about an hour for our entrees to make it to the table, steak salad and burger. Steak salad was great, however the french fries on the burger plate were soggy as a sponge. So they were sent back and replaced. When I went to eat the burger, the bottom bun was saturated from grease. In fact, the hamburger was sitting in an oil slick puddle of grease. Pretty gross. The manager came to the table after speaking to our server about the issue after about 10-15 minutes. Seems there were some problems with their Point of Sale system and he was concerned with that issue. He took the burger away and he replaced it with a sandwich which was more of a wrap, and it was tasty. He replaced the replacement fries as well again as they were just as soggy as the first if not more.

The acoustics in the restaurant are not very good either, it is very loud inside. Very much like a sports bar. Good luck having a conversation.

I know this restaurant just opened, but I expected more from them. I would be willing to give them another try, but it wont be any time soon. Hopefully they will still be in business by the time I do decide to patronize them again.

First time at Crave yesterday for brunch. I probably won't visit again. Our waiter was super friendly! Such a nice guy, but only came around a few times. We had the manager on duty help us out most of the time just because he was always near by. Once we ordered our food it took over 30 minutes to get to our table, for 3 of us. Wasn't a busy afternoon at all either. We ordered Huevos Rancheros & 2 plates of Chilaquiles. We were served tortilla chips & eggs. Nothing special. Price too high for someone who knows what Chilaquiles & huevos rancheros look like & taste like.

I sell furniture at the macys summerlin store and frequent CRAVE quite often. Their lunch specials are delicious and reasonably priced. The service is hit or miss, which is the reason for the 3 stars. 
I also went for drinks here and am obsessed with their red sangria, SO good. 
They also have groupons $15 for $30 of food, a great buy!

First off...those who are reading reviews about wanting to go to Crave, ignore all the reviews where people are bashing them about service.  Keep in mind, they just recently open and like all new restaurants, venues, hotels, there will always be some level of service issue.

I for one can say, we did experience some negative service but not by the staff.  But the organization of the kitchen.  Our experience ended up where dinner turned out to be an 2 hour ordeal, but it wasn't unpleasant as the staff were very tentative and apologetic.  We sat by the kitchen so we were able to see what all the held up was.  So I can ding them for the slow service but I am not going to because service provided by the staff was execellent and I honestly cannot fault the staff for something that is out of their control.  I would say the the GM is to look at your kitchen, your line cook and get that together.  But I won't be harsh because we went on openinlg weekend.

Now for the food, I made two appetizer plates into my dinner; the Pork Belly Sliders with kimchi, Korean BBQ sauce, cilantro and the Kogi Beef Tacos with red miso, napa slaw, sesame.  I was a bit disappointed that the Pork Belly Sliders weren't serve in the steam buns that I am so used to have pork belly with, but the flavor and the meat was excellent!  I may ask next time when I order to see if it is possible to get the steam buns.  Now the Kogi Beef Tacos were my favorite!  I can eat those ALL DAY!  And I might even just order two of those next time as dinner!  The meat was so flavorful and rich, with the red miso, napa slaw to give it that nice sweet and spicy kick!  

I can't find fault in this place.  Food was good, service (staff) were attentive and friendly and I am sure it will take time for the kitchen to figure out a smooth system.  Until then, I will still be coming back!

Let me start by saying that this place has been open a few weeks, ample time for a new restaurant to get it together. We went in the middle of the afternoon, so it was not busy. We were sat right away, and our waiter came out shortly after to get our drinks in. We paid the $2 for the bread basket, and while it was adequate, the stuff that was supposed to be crispy was soggy. Just, no. it really should have been free. The runner who dropped it off took the time to explain what each of the breads were, by touching each one! Wtf! We had to laugh. The menu is extensive and appealing, but, They were out of the sandwich my boyfriend ordered, which seems to be a theme in alot of other reviews. He settled on a burger that featured a foie grais butter, and i got the steak sliders, both with fries. As we waited for our food, we had time to look around the restaurant, It was not busy at all, and it was obvious because there were waiters everywhere, standing around and talking in the middle of the restaurant, one guy even stood in the middle of the restaurant and texted on his phone! Gross! Some food got dropped off at a table near us and we could hear the waiter say to another one, "bet that food gets sent back, looked pretty bad." Umm what? At least we were entertained while we waited for our food. Our food comes, and yikes, it didn't look good. My sliders were sloppily put together, the crispy fried onion strings were really pale and under done, the steak had no flavor and the color of it was... Unappealing. There was no detectable juniper mayo, and the buns were underwhelming. There were about 9 soggy greasy French fries on my plate, and the temperature of my food was Luke warm. My boyfriends burger was ordered at medium well, it came out well done, and the bun was burnt to a crisp. His fries were also cold and soggy. There was no foie grais butter to speak of, either. I felt really bad for our waiter, he must know how bad their kitchen is because he brought us out fresh fries without us even saying a word about them. 

We left our waiter a nice tip, as it wasn't his fault, it is clear to me that he was trying his best despite a kitchen that doesn't seem to care.

Bottom line, this place needs to get it together quick, or it will be gone as soon as the other restaurants open. It seems poorly managed and the kitchen is a mess to say the least, zero quality control. For a $40 lunch, we would have had a better meal at 5 guys.

This place is absolutely amazing. I am a server and can easily find something to complain about but this time there is NOTHING! Our first time here of soon to be many times. We will be back. Merissa was our server and she was so nice, very helpful. She made a new experience so much better. Very initiative and great service! The rib eye and avocado roll was to die for!!! I can't wait to try new things and come back! You will not regret coming here!

When I first saw this restaurant in Downtown Summerlin, I wanted to eat here. It seemed modern and interesting. Plus that, it was crowded so must be a good thing. It was easy to make reservations and I made them on open table. 
There were a lot of items to choose from on the menu from appetizers to drinks to entrees to desserts...we just got to come back again. For our appetizers, we tried their edamame and namasu (guess we missed Hawai'i a little). I had the mahimahi with shrimp and macadamia nut rice and banana fig butter. "So Ono!"  My husband just loved his sea bass with pesto and guacamole salsa. So innovative. 
We had a difficult time deciding on dessert but finally decided on the sampler with 3 items; triple berry, blueberry cheesecake and chocolate silk parfaits. 
The next time we visit Vegas, Crave is a must!

we go out as a group of friends and we go out regularly and every time we leave dinner we always compare it to crave hahah. I got the 702 burger and it was amazing probably the best burger i have had in months the staff was friendly and took great care of us

We finally checked this place out during Restaurant Week. Love it! Service was fantastic. Cone during happy hour on weekdays and the sushi is half price. Food tastes great. Parmesan truffle fries are amazing. Trendy ambience. We will be back for sure.

Stopped in for happy hour while our kids were still shopping at Downtown Summerlin. The service was average as well as the food. The happy hour menu was pretty extensive. We chose the California rolls & pesto chicken flatbread. The California rolls were good and came out fast. Then we ordered the flatbread. It took a long time to get to our table and when it finally arrived it was warm at best.  I think it would have tastes better if it was hot. A little disappointing because the restaurant was not busy. I think we will go back and give Crave another try.

Came in for happy hour and the place was empty other than 2 girls at the bar. Bartender was great but lacked knowledge of a roll and I couldn't eat mayo and it came out with spicy mayo. Beautiful bar and I'll give this spot another chance one day.

I'm compelled to write a review. We went to dinner last minute and took our little dog with us. They were so accommodating. Everything from our hostess making sure we were comfortable and she clearly had a good handle on everything - to the server and food. And our little dog was welcomed too!

Everything was edible but below average at best. I had the steak sliders and they were okay but the bun was phenomenal. The side salad was pretty good.
My wife ordered the baked penne which tasted like a cheap lasagna that you would bake at home.
We also got the truffle fries as a snack and those were GREAT. 
Good atmosphere but bad service. Our waiter walked by several times without even asking if we needed anything after we were completely done with our meal. We probably won't be coming back, and I doubt crave stays in downtown Summerlin very long.
Our bill took FOREVER to come and it had 2 items on there that we didn't even order

Good food. Good service. Would definitely return.
I had 2 items from the sushi menu and really enjoyed the Aloha wrap. Great pita bread for snacking on while waiting for the food. It kinda feels like a newer Kona Grill for anyone who goes to Boca Park. Good stuff!

My wife and I decided to try Crave for the first time yesterday. The restaurant is designed to be very comfortable and inviting. Overall I gave the restaurant four stars because I thought my meal and the meal my wife ate was really good. If I had to rate the service from our waiter who was named Craig, I would give him a a solid 5 star rating. He was very friendly and attentive to our every need. I guess everybody has their own experiences here, but I know for sure that my wife and I will be going back again and hopefully we get Craig as our waiter.

After having dined at CRAVE several times, I feel like I have enough info to write a review.

The first time I went to CRAVE was at the soft opening months ago. I thought the restaurant had great ambiance and being able to try several items on the menu gave me a prespective of the type of food CRAVE offers. The items we tried were hit or miss, but overall I got a good feeling from the food we tried and knew we would be back.

We came back probably a month or so after and I ordered the Lamb Meatballs which is a Signature Dish at crave. It was AWFUL and I do not use that word often to describe food. The pasta portion of the dish was fine but the Meatballs were extraordinarily bland and did not taste fresh. I would not be surprised if they used frozen meatballs. My mother-in-law also had to send her dish back because the lobster tasted awful.

I came back last night with a livingsocial coupon and because opentable was giving 1,000 dining points. I actually was pleasantly surprised with my meal. I ordered the edamame starter which at $8 was definitely not worth it, but tasted fine. I ordered the chicken apple sausage flat-bread and a couscous salad as a side. The salad came out first and it was great. The dressing was very refreshing. The flat bread next came out and it was amazing! The mix of flavors between the sausage, bell pepper, and balsamic vinaigrette was unique and blended together well. It was around $16 which is a little over-priced but I would order it again. My husband just got a burger and fries and it was the perfect medium rare, very juicy and he was a happy guy! I also thought the service was great.

Overall, food is VERY hit or miss. Additionally, the food is generally not worth the prices. It appears there is a happy hour menu, which might be a better deal, but I have not tried.
