Service is just ok. I have had terrible service there, but last night it was great. Jury is out on that.

Ambiance is great. Beautiful restaurant in a great location. Food is average and not worth the price.
Everything was great! Service, food ... Except for the sushi .... The volcano roll had huge cucumber chunks that made it difficult to eat. After removing the cucumber the roll was okay.

It's hard to say... Haven't decided on the ratings yet, I guess I'll determine that at the end of my review.... Well two times I have been there and both experiences have had issues. I usually Pay attention to my surroundings with what can be taking so long or what can be possible on why it's been so long on waiting for pretty much everything. With that being said the manager is great, checks up on you a few times to make sure everything is ok, the standards with the waiters and waitresses are there, but what causes me to be there for an extensive amount of time? Two words, -Understaffed - (wait is that one word or two) haha! You get the picture! But yes service lacks with being understaffed even when it's not busy. But you know lets put that aside. The food is great here for what it is. The 702 burger is a hit. The truffle fries for sure. Chips and guacamole, yup! And the crispy pot stickers are great. The half off wine is what keeps me coming back, you take that away then there is no way I'll be back. So I guess it gives you plenty of time to Drink the bottle  but you know I see what the situation might be with the waiters and waitresses, and I always take care of them real good because I know they are short staffed. If I'm wrong I want my $20.00 back ! Jordan thanks for the service!

We were a group of eight getting together to reminisce and reconnect over dinner. the atmosphere is great and in western tradition blends meat (burgers) with Asian (sushi). Just up our taste. The service is excellent and helpful.
Overall, we had a good time but nothing really stood out. All the lows were raised but the highs were also lowered. The best thing was who we were with and we chose to go elsewhere as soon as the meal ended.

Celebrated friends birthday here. Apart from the fact that we got 50% off on our total bill which is very nice for a group of 9, we had a great deal. However there were very few staff in the restaurant and our waiter was basically attending most of the tables in the back area with another big group. It must be frustrating on his part  which makes the service slow. Not to mention that we even asked him to take photos of the group several times. Food is just ok but we had a great time anyways.

I was thoroughly impressed with the service we received today from Cassie.  

It was a beautiful but hot memorial day lunch hour so we opted to sit out on the patio.  Our server Cassie was very attentive to our needs from making sure our water glasses were always filled to going out of her way moving our table under the umbrella as the shade shifted. 

As for the food, I was thrown off by the menu which seemed to be all over the place.  The cuisine is "American" and Sushi. We ordered various dishes from sushi to macaroni and cheese to a burger to short rib tacos and my pork belly on fried rice.  See what I mean? 

Overall,  the food had good flavor but I've had better.   My rating is mostly based on Cassie and her service.  If it weren't for her,  I'd only be giving this restaurant 3 stars but the fact that she ran all the way to the parking lot in 90+ degree heat to hand us the sunglasses that my niece forgot at the table,  just earned themselves an extra star. 

Thank you for your exceptional service!

Service was ok. Three of us for dinner. The wedges salad was just fair. The soup tasted like marinara and very thick. Edamame was full of soy sauce and tasted burnt. Kogi beef tacos were just awful.   The crave burger was good.  Mascarpone stuffed chicken. The crust was burnt as was the asparagus. Overall the experience was just ok.  They refunded the soup and Kogi tacos.

I wish I had read reviews before coming in, we were greeted promptly and with a smile but it took awhile for anyone to come to our table (there were 2 other couples at two other tables-so it was not busy) our server was just ok, he was polite. He kept forgetting to bring our waters and only refilled our waters once (and that took awhile). I ordered the black bean soup (it was also jUsT ok- actually Panera's is mucH better!) I also ordered Caprese flat bread no complaints there,  portion was good for the price. My fiance ordered the lobster linguine (I believe it was around $23-25, additional charge if you want a side of bread with your pasta) we could not believe when it was served how small the portion was, I've seen children's meals with more food. Price doesn't matter when you get what you pay for but to pay the prices we did and have my fiance still leave there hungry..... yeah total disappointment. Too many other options within walking distance, we won't return.
I would just like to say: CRAVE has some of the best jambalaya I've ever had! And I've been to New Orleans where I have had some great jambalaya.

Came to check out their happy hour with my girlfriends. The restaurant has nice interior, great flow to the bar. 
They have a huge selection of happy hour drinks and food. Drinks range from $4-$6 and food from $5-$8. We ordered shrimp tempura roll, veggie roll, margarita flat bread, chips and guacamole, queso and Parmesan truffle fries. Food was very good, definitely bang for the buck at the happy hour pricing. Although I wish there was a little more guacamole and queso. There were a lot of chips but not enough guac and queso. For drinks we had their happy hour Cabernet and Chardonnay. 
Our server Ashley was friendly and efficient. 
Will definitely return.
I was actually impressed with this place. They had delicious cocktails and a decent happy hour selection for food. I could see myself coming back.

We went here for a family dinner and we were all pretty impressed. Aside from the service glitches, CRAVE is on the right path. 

For starters we placed an order of the cheese and bacon loaded tater tots in addition to edamame. Plain edamame can get pretty boring, CRAVE adds a twist by tossing the edamame in a special sauce blend - so good! 

For an entree, I was craving (ha!) a burger, so I went with the 702 burger and I loved it! The bacon was the right amount of crispy, the burger was cooked exactly how I ordered it and the egg was a perfect touch... in hindsight, I'm wondering why they didn't just call it a breakfast or hangover burger, ha!

CRAVE has a decent beer list, when it's available. It took me three beer brands to finally order something that they actually had in house... Pro Tip: Update your menu as often as you switch out the menu items so that your guests don't get let down. 

The only major discrepancy was the service... the evening wasn't TOO cold so we wanted to sit outside. The hostess was prompt and our wish was granted. The server, not so prompt. I feel like it took her quite a bit to greet us and when she finally did, we were treated as if we were inconveniencing her more than anything. She couldn't seem to get away from our table fast enough... quick to walk away before everyone had even had their questions answered. People have bad days/nights though, so I'm willing to give it another shot!

This is the 2nd time my husband and I are here.  Because of our first time here, we ordered conservatively. We ordered the chicken wings and the chicken pandoori sandwich and split.  Most of the sliced apples were on one side of the sandwich along with most of the chicken. It tasted good but had too much sauce. The French fries were terrible!  They need to have good oil or fresh oil for the fries to taste good. The manager needs to step it up with his quality control. This would be a great place if they were more attentive to the food that was served.

Food was excellent. We ordered scallop shooters, lemon garlic wings, Bison burger and the Lamb meatball pasta. All had fantastic flavor, no complaints there. 

But the service........ Terrible. 
First, we waited 10minutes after getting seated for someone to notice us.  Food took a long time to come out even if they were about half capacity. They served us the wrong food. I had to stand up to ask for water 2x. It was hard to get the servers to pay attention even if a lot of them were just standing around.

Came here tonight for a company dinner party , and too put it nicely it was nothing special , their menu is very random from sushi to burgers to pasta . I ordered the rainbow roll and the fish was okay again nothing amazing very similar to sushi from a grocery store and for the price defiantly not worth it I also ordered the albacore nigiri and that was a huge disappointment, a coworker ordered the Godzilla roll it was so big and tasteless too much work for a blain roll , onto the burgers the bison burger was served literally burnt and the fries were over salted ,the lobster linguini was flavored good  but for the price you get 1 1/2 claw very tiny  and a very small portion of pasta that was undercooked lastly another coworker ordered the gluten free chicken salad (a plus this place has a gluten free menu) so you really couldn't go wrong with lettuce , we also had to constantly ask for refills mind you our group was only 9 people very disappointed . It's such a great location and very nice place itself but the food just isn't up to par

Food: My wife ordered the pulled chicken farfalle pasta, I had the lamb meatballs, and for appetizer and calamari which came out good. The pulled chicken and the lamb meatballs wasn't any good didnt understand how the spinach, chicken, and artichoke combination became a pasta dish. As for the lamb meatballs I expected the taste to be of meditteranean which it did, I just did not like how the lamb meatballs were prepared they were dry and  the sauce wasnt really a good combination with the meatballs.

For the price of the food expected the quality and taste to be at par with the restaurants at the strip sadly its not.

Ambiance: The ambiance is very good. The restaurant would be good for date nights 

Location: Downtown summerlin, which is a very good location.

Overall: I would not come back not unless the quality of the food improves. Paying a high price with so so food is not for me.

Went to this restaurant this past weekend. WOW. What an amazing place this is. We walked in and was greeted by a wonderful hostess, she was friendly and polite.The decor here is very beautiful.  We were seated as a party of 6. Got menus and waters right away. They have a variety of things to choose from to eat. We ordered all sorts of stuff and we were able to share and try everything out... FOOD was BOMB.... Service was BOMB also. When Im back in Las Vegas I will sure to be back. The one thing that I noticed was we sat at a booth and if you want a more romantic and intimate setting they have a curtain which I assume you can close so you can have your privacy,,, Very cute for couples...

Came here on a Sunday afternoon. We assumed the slow service was due to it being busy. But we were wrong, it seemed as if the crew were not only understaffed but miserable as well. I could see it on the hostesses' face as well as the rest of the staff. What we thought would take us an hour ended up being two hours. Staff would disappear for minutes on end to the point that two groups who were sat down decided to leave. Refills took forever. The food however was good; I'll give them that. The service is just really bad. Go elsewhere, there are better choices a few steps away.

The sushi was very good, but entirely over priced.  I.e. Scallop poppers were $10 for three little poppers. The Godzilla roll was $19 for an average sized roll.  Like I said, it was tasty, but a $73 bill for two rolls , app, 2 beers, and glass of wine...........could have just gone to a local sushi joint and saved about $25-$30

I picked Crave for Mother's Day for my wife because my daughter and I absolutely loved it when we ate there a few weeks ago.
I figured it would be busy being it will be Mother's Day so I made reservations.  There was a slight wait when we got there but no big deal.  Our waitress walked by and stopped with a stern look and said, "I'll be back!"  Who are you, the effing Terminator."?
Anyway she came back to take our drink order.  My wife wanted a cappuccino but couldn't find it on the menu and our kind waitress said, "Oh it's not on the menu."  Helpful, but doesn't tell us what other drinks you may have.  At this point, I'm starting to notice food boogers all over the silverware and asked for a cleaner option but spoke too soon.  The water glasses had stuff chunked on the sides as well and once we finished the appetizer, there was some pasty/dry/cheesy crap now smeared across the table which was nothing of the likes of what we ordered.  This apparently is on the bottom of the disgusting plate.
Since our dining experience is not quite going as expected, we begin discussing places we should have gone.  I was thinking to myself, are we really discussing my shortcomings of picking a suitable restaurant for Mother's Day?  Wow, now I feel like an ass!  I felt even more like an ass when the food came out.  Not sure who the broad was that brought out the food but she had no clue what she was doing nor could identify anything on the plates.  No worries, here comes our friendly neighborhood waitress that's been such a joy.  Everyone finally got what they ordered however the food was cold.  My daughter got the Crave Burger.  I'm assuming the buns are not fresh because when I say cold, I mean you could have reduced swelling of an injury with her hamburger.  Both my wife's food and mine were also below room temp.  This was the straw that broke the camels back.  Check please!

My daughter and I were excited to take my wife here for Mother's Day.  Now we're going to one of the places we discussed while waiting for our food.  Sorry Crave, won't be back...ever.
I just went there there for lunch today.  The food was good and it was a great price.

Second time I've eaten here.  Food good. Service absolutely the worst and slowest on the planet.  
 Each time
I've been here 25 minutes to order cocktails and server rarely returned. 

Also looks like a cafeteria style setting way too any tables that are empty.

Just dined there last night for the first time and actually had a wonderful experience! My family and I came in around 5pm for dinner. It was pretty quiet because it was before dinner time, and a Tuesday night. Our server was Jordan and he provided amazing service throughout our dinner. He started off by giving us waters right away. He gave great recommendations and was very knowledgeable with the menu. Some time in between he came back with warm steamed hand towels for us to clean our hands, which was a great touch. Our food came out shortly after. We order tuna tataki, Philly roll, Angus sliders, chicken pesto flatbread, and caprese chicken pasta. Everything was really great, although I'd skip the pasta and flatbread. They were kinda boring and bland dishes. At the end Jordan let us know that if we signed up for a rewards card, we'd receive a free mini tiramisu. We signed up and the tiramisu was delicious. Overall the  service was impeccable and the food was pretty good.

Well...that is nice to actually give 1 star. Service was BEYOND mediocre! Hardly had patrons seated and nobody came to get the drink orders. The table next to us had the same experience. When we stopped a server walking by our table he said "we are short staffed and too busy"... without any exaggerations there were maximum 5 occupied tables with an average of 5 people per table. Finally, after 45 minutes waiting we got our food....and it was nothing excelling!!!!
Would NOT recommended to anyone...except for s secret dinner.

I was looking for a place to duck out of Halloween much to the chagrin of the GF.  I thought Downtown Summerlin would be a chill place to avoid trick or treaters.  The GF informed me this was the only restaurant currently open in the mall.  I thought we should give it a shot.

I read some of the reviews talking about the wait.  We were fortunate to be seated in quick fashion.

Our Harry Potter dressed server was prompt in taking our drink orders.  I tried a "Lazy Uncle Jack."  It contained JD whiskey, blueberries, and sweet and sour.  Tasty enough..I ordered a second.  These were about in the area of $10 a pop.

For my meal I chose the "Bison Burger."  It was topped with pork belly, cilantro mayo, and pickled shallots.  Cooked to medium, it was A-OK.

Until Downtown Summerlin launches everything it is going to offer in the way of dining, CRAVE will do you in a pinch.

It was just before 10pm, they are still open. Went up to the host's stand to get a table. The girl said sorry we're closed. I asked "what time do you close?"  she said 10. I said well it is 10 to 10 so you are still opened. She said sorry the kitchen is closing and by time you order will be too late. Wow for a new business trying to make it not very professional. They should be happy to get what ever business comes in. Won't be back!! Impression starts at the front door!

We were so impressed with this restaurant! I've been wanting to come here for awhile since it has sushi and American food as well. My husband got a small roll and said it was fresh. He got the bison burger and I got turkey burger. They both were made fresh and tasted great! Our waiter was Vincent and he was excellent. We will be coming back!

Crave burgers, Parmesan/truffle fries, & salad were tasty, but there's something about lukewarm-coldish food, especially soggy fries, that I strongly dislike. Our waitress was friendly but seemed eager to clock out already.  After our food was served, no one asked how we were doing. This place might have strong potential if they improve on service. Otherwise, there are many other places to get the same if not better and less expensive type of food.
Place looks great so we decided to try it. The food was disappointing. The service was ok. I don't think I will be back here again.

The place is slipping. Service and the dish quality varies each visit. Tonight our super pleasant server forgot the bread and took forever to bring the check. Otherwise, a really nice kid.

But the food... First, their draft beer is served way too warm. My steak was thrown on top of the mashed potatoes, asparagus was as thin as I've ever seen, kids carrots were discolored and inedible and the Mac and cheese was a runny, tasteless mess.

Last trip for us.

Well my husband and I with some friends decided to ignore the recent reviews and try this new restaurant. We all thought let's give it a try and chance. We went for happy hour and at first it was ok. We ordered drinks and appetizers though our food came first warm we had to ask for our drinks ... A bit strange !!! Then we ordered  a second round food was cold and our drinks were not only total wrong and completely off with no alcohol and they served a martini in a juice glass !! Who does that !! The drink that was to be made with rum was served with a splash of whisky instead. Service was horrible had to ask for everything at least twice. Happy hour  for what you got is pricy and don't go in the bathrooms I had to rummage thru the storage units to find the toilet paper. To say the least if they don't get it together this Restaurant won't last !!! I expected a lot more especially from a new Summerlin hot spot.

I visited this restaurant last night for dinner and after waiting 25 mins for a table we were seated and our server was excellent.  Very attentive and quick.  We ordered wine which was very good and got to the table within minutes.  On the server's suggestion, my fiancé ordered the jumbo shrimp appetizer and I ordered the poblano Caesar salad, both very good but the jumbo shrimp was not hot.  Our mains came out midway through eating our appetizers which was quite annoying, we felt rushed.  He ordered the half chicken which was good, Jamaican flavours.  I ordered the farfalle pasta which was warm in the middle and cold on the outside when I received it.  I mentioned the temperature to the server and she offered to take it back to pan fry and I said no that's ok.  Our bill was $98 and we tipped $15.  A bit expensive for the rushed feeling but the flavours of the food was very good and I will give this new restaurant a chance to work out its kinks.

The parmesan truffle fries...sigh. I *crave* them all the time. The Salmon nigiri is fresh and sweet. The sushi rolls are sadly heavy on the rice, and light on fish and veg. We've been twice, and the service has been pleasant and friendly each time. The atmosphere is typical Summerlin, whether that be a positive or negative is up to you. I'd go back for the fries any day, any time.

The few times we have been there have been a mediocre experience.  I was expecting more being one of the anchor restaurants for the Downtown Summerlin mall.  Maybe it's just because they are working out the bugs.  The food is decent and presented well but the service is a little off still.  We've been there a total of 4 times and will wait to try again in the future when they have some more experience.

My partner and I decided to give this place a try as we had plans to see a movie. Our waitress brought us our drinks and we ordered the lobtser and spinach dip. For 14.00, we both felt it was a really small portion, but tasted fine.  He then ordered the salmon and I ordered the crave burger.  The wait was very long for the food and our waitress only came by once to refill our drinks. After the food arrived, I found the burger to be really bland and my partner's salmon was really undercooked.  We didn't have time to order anything else, so asked the waitress to just take the salmon of the tab. It was amazing how fast our waitress was to get us the tab and get us cashed out, but couldn't even stop by twice to see if our drinks needed refilling. My partner didn't get dinner and had to order food at the theater.  Sorry, but this experience isn't worth another trip back.

Our hotel concierge recommended this place gave us a coupon for a free appetizer so we thought why not.
   Convenience store sushi will top this place 10 to 1.

First time in downtown Summerlin and thought we'd stop by for some lunch. My boyfriend and I thought this would be a good spot. When you walk in and the atmosphere was very nice and we were greeted right away by the hostess. We didn't have to wait to long, had a wonderful waitress and gave us the lunch menu. Had a variety of choices to choose from.  We started off by the chicken avocado spring roll which was good.  It had more of avocado than chicken.  On to our entree's my boyfriend ordered the chicken, apple brie' sandwich and I got the salmon salad.  When his sandwich came out it was different it than your regular bread it came as a focaccia bread folded in half - Like eating a taco.  It was yummy!  Very good tasting.  My entree' had great presentation and the portion was just perfect - My salmon was cooked perfectly along w/ the other wilted spinach and israel couscous. Every bite was complimentary to everything.  We also had dessert which was good.  You can pick individuals or sharable.  We chose from sharable - Smore's brownie (it said ice cream but it wasn't it was just a marshmallow topping) and the cheesecake w/ rhubarb strawberry topping - Very good but huge. All and all, I would come here again.
Great happy hour menu. Bradley the bartender is great. We left wolfgangs still hungry and we found a wonderful menu at the bar that was perfect.

I was in Vegas visiting my daughter and grandkids.  We went to Summerlin to do some Xmas shopping.  Since we were hungry , we decided to get a " quick bite " and go on our way.  The restaurant was not busy and we liked the fact that they were not playing loud obnoxious music.  Then everything went downhill.   In hind site i wish we had just left .  We had our menus which were long and there were about 3 different parts that went with the menu - there was the main one and then I think a lunch one and maybe something else.  The server asked what we wanted and we told her we needed more time but we did want some drinks and 2 waters    For whatever reason it took quite awhile to get our drinks and had to ask a 2nd time for water .  She finally reappeared to take our order and since we had already been there for 20" we requested an appetizer to ( hold us over ).   Another 10 - 15" went by  and no appetizer so we grabbed the manager (?)  and he said there was a mix up because of shift change and our appetizer had not been made yet !  To appease us he brought us some calamari (on the house because it had been made by mistake ). After another 20" we finally got our food, which was mediocre  and our server had her head in the clouds    Could hardly wait to get our boxes and check and get the hell out of there.   Awful experience. All total we were probably there an hour and 20 minutes    Certainly was not a quick bite.  It was  agonizing and we will never return ever !
Channell are server was very good didn't miss a beat thank you we shall be back the gluten free menu is great lots to choose from.

Pretty sure the days are numbered here. Went in right after the parade, which was packed with people, and told a 25 minute wait for a nearly empty restaurant. Hmmm.... that should have been our first clue. Ok....we are slow learners!! The hostess said most of the servers were a no show. Probably because they were not making any money. Anyway, we waited and ate. Food was OK, but would have been better if the food wasn't sitting under a barely working heat lamp, forever, because the service is awful!! And I mean AWFUL!! I did give it an extra star because kids eat free and I love free!! I do like the atmosphere, so I hope another restaurant moves in when this one closes.

We were in the area and decided to give this place a try. That was a mistake. The burger my husband got just average. I ordered a filet medium rare and the first one I got was medium/medium well. Sent it back and the second one was rare. By this time my family was done eating so I didn't want to sit and wait yet again for them to get it right. On top of that I had to saw through both meats and it was quite chewy. I don't where they get their beef from but they need to change suppliers. Filet should melt in your mouth and to be frank...Outback steakhouse does a better job. To top it off it was under-seasoned and the mashed potatoes were overwhelmingly truffled. The fries were pretty much the best thing they had. They offered a free dessert but by then, with our slow waiter, we ready to go home and declined. Overall it was overpriced and under-delivered.

Walking in on Tuesday night and were sat right away. We were seated at high top table by the bar, we were not offered to be sat in the restaurant or the sushi bar. It was our first time here so we really didn't know the restaurant offered. Our server Stephanie was super sweet and knowledgeable. She helped me pick out a popular margarita, I believe the lime and ginger, to start with. They also have a lot  of beers on tap which my friend enjoyed. We started with the crab and artichoke dip and the bread basket. The bread basket it not complimentary but it's only $2.00. I loved put starters, everything was warm, gooey and flavorful. I asked for another popular margarita drink and Stephanie told me about the prickly pear. I decided to go with it. When it came  out and was a very pretty drink but not my style. Stephanie graciously switched it out for the lime and ginger one. We ordered two pastas to share. The lobster linguine and the lamb meatballs. The lobster linguine was great, nice chunks of lobster, the sauce was buttery and light. The goat cheese meatballs were in a Pablano sauce that was just okay. The lamb meatballs oozed goat cheese but the lamb itself was vey under seasoned and need salt. Safe to say we finished the lobster linguine and just picked at the lamb meat ball dish. We got the chai tea Creme brûlée dessert along with, by Stephanie's suggestion, a baileys and coffee with a bit of fransican, I think?  It was a hazelnut liquor from what I understand. Either way it was great. Stephanie also brought us house made marshmallows fluff for the coffee. Oh it was so good! The chai Creme brûlée was very tasty and a nice twist on the classic. We are already planning our trip back to check out their happy hour!

I really wish I could give more stars... our server Josh was so pleasant and he was an awesome server who deserves 5 stars. This review is for the restaurant overall.... the ambiance outside is beautiful. Weather was great and they had umbrellas to protect us from the hot Vegas sun.

However, because of the food, I likely will not be back. I felt as if the menu didn't describe the food very well. I had to ask a lot of questions and even then, the food came out looking and tasting entirely different from what I had expected. I believe if they added more pictures it would be more pleasant. I can't remember if they had any pictures at all.

We ordered two types of pasta.... they were both salty and unflavorful. The chicken caprese was soooo salty. It was not Parmesan crusted at all. Just deep fried chicken to me. Overall the plate was bland and didn't wow me at all. 

The miso soup very salty... I've had many miso soup from Japanese restaurants and this one was very salty. 

The mini tiramisu was actually the best thing I ate today and we only got that because it came free from signing up for the loyalty card. 

We probably won't be back.

This is a strange place and I'm don't want to give it one star because it's gorgeous, friendly service, but has a few odd things going on that I hope they fix.

Went for lunch today, it had like six people at tables, there were three of us.  We all got the same poke bowls.  It took literally about 30 minutes to get our food.

The food was absolutely delicious. But it was too small a portion for the value. For $13, we got a cup of rice and a 1.5 cups of vegetables. How much food cost could be in this dish. We left still hungry.

It was my friend's 4th time here and she warned me that the service would be terrible, not the waitress per se, but the kitchen. She always had to wait a very long time for food and today was no exception.

I would absolutely never return here because of the wait and the small portion.
The entire menu was way overpriced.
I'm not cheap, again, it's about value.
Today's lunch should have been $7.

Our friends made reservations at Crave because it was near our hotel. Beautiful atmosphere, and great service but the food was just ok. I had sushi, good but not great, the fish did not taste super fresh. The Chilean Sea bass was very good. We had to send the French fries back because they were soggy. The chicken stir fry was fair. I'm not sure I would go back for food maybe just drinks. They have some very interesting drinks on the menu. Our waitress was very patient with our group sending her back and forth several times

My family and I went here for my birthday. The atmosphere is almost as wonderful as the food! I ordered the lamb meatballs with a glass of red wine and they were delicious! The service was excellent. We very much enjoyed the company of our server, Jennifer. She was so sweet and attentive. My family and I will be back soon just for her outstanding service.

There are five things that I want to review my opinions upon this restaurant.
1. WELCOME- Hostess was very polite, giving us a 30min. Wait time since this is the only sit down restaurant that's open in downtown summerlin mall.
2. SETTING- Very nice furniture and lighting is amazing. It feels like walking into an Asian infused American restaurant, maroon and red and gold interior, you can tell by it's design that it's been very well thought through.
3. CUSTOMER SERVICE- From the hostess and the waitress, they have been extremely polite, taking our drink orders once we sat and our entree orders as well. Time is a precious matter and no matter how busy they were, they helped us at any chance they get.
4. FOOD- I ordered the aloha sushi roll and it was amazing, it had ginger and a sweet teriyaki sauce that meshed well with the raw tuna, my friend had the "crave burger" and it was cooked just right medium rare, and the French fries had a great seasoning not just plain. 
5. OVERALL REVIEW- Great setting, customer service and food. Definitely coming back.

Disgusting... I'm completely appalled at how they let dogs feast on their plates and let them urinate in the patio. It was my 21st birthday and it was nice up until I was eating and suddenly lost my appetite after smelling this strong urine odor. The dogs had an accident and I told the waiter about it. He brought out the manager and she told us that the patio is pet friendly. If I knew they let pets defecate and urinate on their furniture I wouldn't sit outside... And if I knew they allow the pets to eat off the same plates they serve to customers I wouldn't order anything!!! The manager offered to move us, a party of 9, instead of telling the couple with the two dogs to move since we had the problem with the pets emptying their bowls. After she spoke to us she spoke to the couple with the pets and started to pet their dogs... 

That was just a slap on the face, how dare you have the audacity to tell me to move and then pet the dogs that just pissed under and around one of your tables. 
Bad management. Disgusting place. They try to be upscale but allow URINE. Even if it is outdoor seating it's still a restaurant. I've yet to come across another restaurant that allows the same thing to happen.

We've been here a few times. It's ok. Not bad, but not amazing either. 

We've even been for one of their romantic dinner specials. Plenty of food, but still just ok flavors.

And the place is pricey! Their happy hour "specials"...pricey. 

It is a fun place to bring a group. The service is wonderful and the atmosphere is nice.
Absolutely disgusting! I had a bug in my plate and instead reduce it from my bill I still pay for that, disgusting place. Prison food more appealing than this place
Service is terrible. Had a drink spilled on me by the busser within 20 min.

Betty, one of the managers greeted us at our table after our party had waited a while for a server to come. We waited for around 10+ min to order drinks. Betty made it right by giving us excellent service for the rest of the evening.

I ordered the Mac & Cheese, something simple, and it was fantastic. Betty also brought an order of Lemon Garlic Wings to the table for us, and they were so good. It was such a nice flavor, I will most likely come back again for the wings.

The ratings seem to be ranking this place pretty average, but Crave is one of the better options at Downtown Summerlin. Prices are a pretty penny for what you get, but they offer specials like $50/couple Date Night entrees and wine, discounted sushi days, and such. They do offer an "Under $10" snack section that trends to small and disappointing, but I guess it's the thought that's supposed to count.

LEMON GARLIC WINGS: I'll start with the positive menu items. Hot damn these were good! Fragrant with garlic, flavorful and crispy, and served as the full wing rather than just the drumstick as elsewhere. Even the bleu cheese dipping sauce, while totally unnecessary because the chicken itself was delicious, was good.
CRAB ARTICHOKE DIP: This was tasty, decent amount of meat combined with a "lemony mayo" that gave it a bit more flavor than other versions. Served with thin triangles of flatbread, but we mostly at it with the aforementioned tortilla chips. Though there was crab in this dip, there wasn't much in the way of artichoke, surprisingly. $15 for a small, shareable appetizer portion.
CHIPS & GUAC/PICO: Chips with guac and chips with pico are both listed on the "snacks" section, and they're fine. Portion is small to match the $5 price tag. Guac was fresh, pico was boring and bland. Having a solid house salsa would be a better option.
NEGIHAMA ROLL: Simple maki-style roll with a white fish, seasoned with some green onion and a hint of ponzu. Fresh and tasty, if a bit on the boring side. Can't really argue with the $5 price, kind of hits the spot if you're craving sushi but don't want to do a full meal of it.

Service was lackluster: initially walked in to an unmanned hostess stand, as we debated whether to dine elsewhere, she returned and told us to seat ourselves if we were going to be in the bar area. 15 minutes later, no one had acknowledged us so we went back to the hostess to receive an actual table. She didn't seem surprised or apologetic, so this may be the norm. Server was less than efficient and not particularly personable. 

As other reviews have stated, the menu is all over the place with apps, pastas, burgers, fish dishes, and sushi, leading to a 'jack of all trades, master of none' feeling. Despite sampling a few different types of dishes, I can't honestly say there's one they do best. Will likely be coming back to try their date night or sushi specials. 

NOTE: For those with Celiac disease, they do offer a dedicated GF menu that isn't as sparse or boring as other places.

Updating my review. It really says a lot when management calls to make things right.  

It started right when I received a message on Yelp from my previous post.   Most people just roll their eyes or just ignore a negative comment but these guys didn't.  Leah, thanks for your message and Kevin, thanks for your call. 

I will keep all my positives as mentioned previously. 
Food is consistent. You order the same thing a month later, the taste is the same. It's great

Lots of variety to please everybody's pallet.  Good food and reasonable cost. 

Service from waiters are excellent. I have enjoyed all my waiters and I've been there about a dozen times.  I continue to come back with my clients almost monthly. 

And finally I'm going to give them a 5 Star for their efforts in making things right.  Very much Appreciated. Thanks Crave.

Last night was our first time going here and we came with another couple. We expected this place to be amazing and to our disappointment it wasn't. When we got there we had to wait a few minutes to be seated. Even though you can clearly see many tables open. The service wasn't great but wasn't bad either. The server took a while to refill our drinks. When I clearly saw them just talking and messing with each other. 

The restaurant itself was nice and lively. The decor was simple but vibrant. The staff wasn't very approachable. They were stern and not friendly. 

The food here is over priced for the quality and portion. I ordered the Steak Slider and my friend ordered the Pork Belly Slider both came with 3 sliders each. The size of each slider was probably 2x2 inches. It was not filling unless you went there not hungry. My Steak Slider was slightly tough so I'm guessing they used a flank steak for it. The only thing that was good with my order was the pickled jalapeño. My boyfriend ordered the Grilled Bistro Steak. That was not worth $30. There was like 8 pieces of steak that did not have flavor what so ever. Even steak on it's own has flavor and that did not. My friend's boyfriend got the Bison Burger. That was cooked well but for the kind of restaurant they made the place seem to be they use the cheapest type of lettuce for the burger. Anything else would have been better than what they used with it. 
We for sure will not be coming back here again.

Wow! Loved this place. The drink specials were outstanding (see Becka (sp) the daytime bartender). She makes some of the best (strongest) drinks I've had in a while. They have a good happy hour and bottomless mimosas for 11bucks as well. The food was outstanding! Try the braised short rib hash. A must do. This is now our go to brunch spot. No reason not to give 5 stars.

Just finished lunch here and definitely will not come back. A large party sat 10-15 minutes after us and got served first. When we finally got served, about 30 minutes after we ordered, my husband's burger was luke warm and the fries were almost cold. My salad came out wrong and I had to wait for them to redo it. They didn't offer us anything as an apology and charged us for the full meal. Oh and there was next to nobody in the restaurant so no excuse for how long we waited for our food.

Wow---the crave burger reminds me why I can never be a vegetarian---juicy flavor---perfection!   Clean-excellent service--nice music too--great atmosphere!  Lunch time crowd easier seating than evenings--great choice!

Today we ordered the torrontes white wine and salmon with avocado roll and came out delicious. Our server was Bryan and he was very nice and suggested things to us with a great attitude. He came around very often and would suggest asking for his section when coming. Come on a Saturday do you can enjoy the great music too!

We found this place and saw that they offered free meals to kids on certain days so we instantly got attracted to it. Any kid friendly restaurant and advertises for it is a plus for us. 
When we walked in, the hostess was chatting with other guests, the wait was five mins... My husband had to speak to the bar tender to find out if we can just seat ourselves, we actually almost left. After being seated, the server ( petite with orange hair - Saturday shift at 7:30p ) approached to get our drinks and gave our little one his activity stuff. She looked very tired but still attentive, mediocre - not friendly or entertaining, just there to fill a shift. Food came after about 15mins since we wanted it all together. My miso soup was not even warm so I asked to replace with "hot" miso soup. The server seemed very apologetic, (she was very attentive the entire time) and got another one. Whoever the cook was ( cant call that chef ) seemed to just have poured boiling hot water on the soup. It tasted like hot water with a minuscule hint of miso so I returned it after I asked both my son and hubby if they wanted it ( they both said yuck ). 

The rolls we ordered were alright, nothing I will come back too .. The last roll was loose, the cooks lack pride in making them. 
I have tried better and more artistic seaweed salad before. The only good taste was the steak but my hubby ended up with stomach pains and major bathroom breaks after. They need to be wiser in choosing chefs because it can definitely make or break you.   

Restaurant was clean, bathroom had broken seat cover holders.. Seemed like someone yanked it. I love the chandelier in the bathroom though. Place seemed empty for a Saturday. I don't think this place will last unless it is turned around because location is great and there is potential.

This review is for everything you look for in a restaurant.  We came for dinner.  Seated immediately.  Place is big, clean, decorated trendy.  Not loud.  Friendly server.  Drinks - pear martinis - perfect pour, delicious.  Drinks came out quick.  We each ordered a Poke bowl.  One traditional, one Mexican.  So tasty, light, healthy.  They say these are for a limited time - I hope they keep them on the menu.  Food came out quick.  And we each got a dessert - coconut cake and the french silk mousse.  What I love about this place - nice size portions.  No gluttonous, over sized dishes.  Go the strip and eat like a pig there.  Every restaurant here doesn't have to be VEGAS SIZED.  Perfect size portions. You don't need a doggy bag to go.   It's a great place.  Want to go back and try Happy Hour at the bar next. :)   What more can you ask for at a restaurant?  Service, prices, food, drink.  All A+.

This place should be called "Brave".  You'd need to be to want to go back.

Where to begin? We got to the restaurant Friday evening just after 7:30.  Despite seeing several tables available, I was asked if I had a reservation.  Nope.  So when I was told it would be a 45-60 minute wait because I didn't have one, I hopped on OpenTable and made a rez for 7:45.

"Yes", I said.  "I have a reservation for 7:45."

The hostess got huffy and went and got a manager.  I explained that I went on OpenTable and made my rez after I was told there would be a 45-60 minute wait.  I played by their rules, and the millennial hostess decided to get upset.  "After all, the restaurant is 1/2 empty. A potential hour wait seems a little absurd", I observed.

The manager protested that his place was half empty (it turned out to be more than that). But I remained cool headed and just told him to seat me after he seated everyone else waiting (there was nobody waiting).

My gf and I eventually were seated.  I am 100% certain that the manager decided to mess with me because every single dish came out of the kitchen wrong.  The salad had no goat cheese and was overly slimy.  When I mentioned it, I was given a tiny cup on the side rather than re-making the slimy salad.  The Mac and cheese was under seasoned, my gf's sushi was hastily strewn about the plate, it took 25 minutes for our drinks to arrive, and the first brownie desert we got was so overcooked and burnt it couldn't be cut.

I'm SO glad I ordered the extra spit.  (I'm nearly certain, though have no proof.)

Anyhow, we were there on a $100 gift card and since I will never go back, I tipped the waiter the $25 of change I could have gotten back.  He did fine, it's really too bad his manager and hostess were such clowns.

If I could shut this place down, I would.

Pro tip: Avoid it.

CRAVE SUCKED PERIOD. Service was good, food not so much. I had juicier fish from McDonalds and the steak was dried no where near medium rare and both that and the plain mash was cold and the drinks were horrible. I hate hate hate giving bad reviews and I haven't in a LONNNNNNG TIME but I really have to warn everyone for the money I would've gotten the same quality, taste and maybe more enjoyable food at Denny's for 3 times less. Sorry to be so harsh but I was genuinely disappointed. It was so busy and I can't wrap my brain around why because there was nothing good about the food here. If the food didn't come out as quick as it did I would've been livid! Even my 4 and 2 year old op to avoid their free mac and cheese and pizza (thank god they were free) because I mean they hardly even touched their fries. I normally obsessively research good places to eat and this time I didn't and I truly wished I did. This was a classic case of Looks Good, Sounds Good, Smells Good but the total opposite of Good! Like others I too am a bit confused at where they were going with their concept I mean I get something for everyone's craving but trust me there's nothing here that I'll CRAVE again! 

So needless to it's a never again for me, such a flop. Total pass! 

P.S. Check out the garnish in my old Fashion that's pictured...looks like it was from a chop shop smh casual semi-fine dinning embarrassment if you ask me. I think I've had better Old Fashion all around better looking better tasting at an airport. It was just bad, everything about it was just bad. Also have you hear of a strainer, in the picture my wife got the martini thing which had pepper flakes floating all up in it. The name of the drink wasn't a disaster it was just a complete disaster. 

The sad part is the resturant and the people there are so nice and I've said this before sometimes if the food isn't all that great but the service is, it makes all the difference but the food experience was so ugh at Crave that it trumps the service this time around.
I always get the Scottish salmon and it's very tasty. Good sauce and the carrots are awesome

This place is another sad case of a confused restaurant who, in trying too hard to be innovative and sexy with flavor pairings, and trying to catch all the food trends, has achieved nothing but mediocrity. Not to mention that for the same prices I can get the real gourmet version of what they are trying to do at a strip restaurant. My Mahi Mahi was over cooked , and had a bizzare banana and curry sauce. The sushi roll we had was edible...if you are the type that likes American AYCE places. The best thing was the burger, which was ok, but for $17 I expected better grade beef and more interesting bun. The service was good. I liked the waitress but In the end, I don't think I would come back. Too many other better places to spend $100 on dinner for 2.

It was my first time here and I was very satisfied with my experience. The food was so delicious and the service was outstanding! Our waiters name was Jordan. He did an amazing job. I will definitely recommend this place!

These guys are lost.  Whoever trained this staff needs to be trained themselves.   We stood out front of hostess desk and told three people our name and reservation time.  3 different times they asked who we were.   At 715, 20 minutes later the ask a 4th time and say "ohh we have been waiting on you". I said we have been standing here for 25 minutes.   She replies. "Did u get lost, the place is hard to find".  I looked at her and said her and said ...I just told you we have been here 25  minutes.    OMG.   Ok now at dinner.   Ran out of kids cups crayons.    40 minutes now no salad.    Salads now have come but mine is missing.  I'm not going to say anything cause I want the torture to end    I should also state.   They are not even busy.       It's a thur night   Here is the deal.  I lived here for 20
Years.  If this place near strip it may survive. But up in Summerlin. I give it 18 months and their gone.      Food was average

So we tried out Crave last night, and since it's new, we weren't expecting perfection. We made a reservation, so we didn't have to wait. We were seated and  promptly greeted and our drink order was taken. When we did order, our waiter (Michael B, who was great) did let us know the kitchen was running slow, and yes we did wait about a half hour for our food....but the food was amazing! I got the mac and cheese with chicken apple sausage, that was soooo yummy! My friend got the scallops which he said was great ( I'm not a seafood fan). The best part was dessert. We got the coconut cake and the walnut praline cheesecake. OMG the coconut cake was the best I ever tasted! I'm still craving it lol! So please don't be put off by the bad reviews and the long waits. This place is a winner and a welcomed addition to Summerlin.
Love love love this place. The poke stack yes the salmon yes and thank you The bread pudding hot damn
Meal was really good.  So many things on the menu I wanted to try so I'll be back soon.  All of my dishes were really good.  I tried the popcorn shrimp, yellowtail and Philly roll.

Love the food here, but the service is hit and miss.  It's glacially slow and rude at times, while other times friendly and attentive.  I've come here at all different times, different days, both alone and with friends and keep finding the service to be inconsistent.  
I will give high marks to a waitress named Cassie, as she is always kind and attentive.  However, she's obviously not always there, or there's not always an open spot in her section.
My favorite dishes are the sushi and sashimi, along with the steak frites.  The food and wine specials are always good.  The Hess Shirt Tail is one of the best Sauvignon Blancs I've had anywhere.

Just had lunch here and I must disagree with a lot of the reviews. 

Service was spot-on. Waitress was great and very attentive. Refills for drinks constantly. 

Love the decor, environment, the total vibe. I feel really bad that so many people reviewed based on a brand new establishment and not giving them credit for just opening. 

Food was good: the bbq pork sliders with kimchi was tender and juicy. The chicken apple and brie sandwich was bomb. Such a unique flavor. 

Will definitely be coming back.

From the service, to the food, everything was fantastic!

We started off with the crab cakes for an appetizer along with the Godzilla roll. Crab cakes were fantastic! Sushi roll was 20$ but a fairly larger portion.

 I got the mahi mahi. It was to die for! A burst of flavor! It had hints of pecan and cinnamon on a bed of shrimp rice. My friend got the apple sandwich that came on pita. Very good, great for a tasty lunch. 

We finished off with The tiramisu shooter, and the chocolate cake. 

Everything was excellent! We will definitely be back next time we spend our day in dt summerlin!

REQUEST NICHOLAS as your server! he's amazing. so personable, and provides exceptional customer service. the food was great, the patio was beautiful and more than welcoming of our golden retriever who accompanied us, but it will be Nicholas who makes us come back. :) thanks nick! thanks crave!

Service was great. The location and patio have a great atmosphere. However, the food left a LOT to be desired. We ordered off of the happy hour menu and we were displeased with every item that we ordered. We decided that since it was the happy hour menu it may be sub par. So we ordered a sushi roll off of the regular menu and it was the worst one! Like I said again great service, great location, terrible food and presentation. My fiancé order a glass of wine and the glass was filthy. I don't think this restaurant specializes in sushi. All of the rolls were rolled terribly and falling apart by the time they reached our table. We won't be going again.

Not what I would expect for the prices, but not awful either. Sunday afternoon, not busy. We started with one server and then another showed up and relieved the first. Had to tell the second what our drink order was. Thought she could've asked the first server. Kale salad was pretty good. Bistro grilled steak had garlic butter over it which I thought was different. It was ok. The steak was cooked right but I felt like I spent a lot of time chewing, more than normal! I left two medallions as I just couldn't chew anymore. Pureed potatoes were fine, nothing special. The grilled, burnt brussel sprouts were not the best, though I ate half for the nutritional value. The candied carrot drink was different and ok. Again, ordered that for the carrot juice nutrient.
The server came to the table a few too many times and always when I was chewing. Give it a rest after your first check on the food stop by. Just keep an eye on drinks. I may go back once more for another item. Husband enjoyed his sushi.

I came by Crave for the first time and upon dining here realized it's a chain restaurant. The menu has a lot of enticing options for one which is a plus! This location in Downtown Summerlin in Vegas is very nice from the outside and inside with modern decor and a spacious and nice ambiance. 

I opted for a Half Sandwich of Chicken, Apple & Brie which comes with a salad, cup of soup or fries.. and I opted for fries. The sandwich was delicious, but a little bit messy from the Citrus Vinagrette.. but nonetheless enjoyable with the soft Tandoori Nan Bread along with Arugula and Rosemary Aioli. I also asked for a side of aioli for my fries which was perfect with the yummy fries. The server was great, tasty food, a little pricey for the food though, but I would definitely come back.

Lovely outdoor seating.... But their wasn't any available servers to seat us for the outdoors...area... We agreed to a window seat inside and waited at least 20 minutes for any acknowledgment...very poor service...flatbread pizza was average...chicken tender were above average...lemon garlic wings were Delish...would probably not dine  here again.

We enjoyed a great night at Crave! 
They had a pre-opening night, as their official opening is tonight. 

The place is very pretty with a clean, well designed, modern feel.  Nice little outside seating area overlooking the beautiful downtown Sunmerlin mall landscape. Our bartender Chris was outstanding!  His Cosmos are made just right with a hint of a blush, not too much. We decided to call them Christini's as they are done so perfectly, grouping them in with run of the mill Cosmos seems wrong. Lol. 
We requested our favorite Alien Tequila, & hopefully they will have it very soon. 

The staff and servers were very nice & doing their best to give 5 star service.... getting everything out on time.   The food all tasted great... Medium rare came out perfectly for both the burger and the steak. The chicken was moist and tasty. The pork tenderloin  was very nice and Sea Bass was excellent.  Asian noodles were Flavorful & not too hot.  The Geisha-boat is a large Sushi boat and is stunning & the portion is very generous.  The sushi is a little spicy, but in a good way.  

Deserts were Amazing!  The chocolate cake is not a sweet milk chocolate... It is a dark chocolate lovers desert.  Tiramisu is Fabulous!! Those two deserts were the highlights with our group. 

The General Manager, Ryun Chastain was very nice... He has an impressive resume, including s long stint at Wolfgang Puck & he is very observant & service oriented. He came over to chat & check on everything. 

Great New Reataurant with an upbeat vibe & really nice quality food.

This is the 3rd time we've been here (closer to 10 if you count the times I've been to the one in Cincy), and the service/food just keeps getting worse.

Today, we had the jumbo shrimp for an appetizer. Mike had steak sliders, and I ordered the bison burger. 

First, they didn't even get Mike's coke right. The shrimp was pretty good, but it took a while for a starter. 

The chef spent most of his time chatting with his friends at the next table about a party at Brooklyn Bowl. 

When our entrees (finally) arrived, I took a few bites. The second bite was a mouthful of chewy undercooked pork fat. I was done. I searched for our server, but since the chef was at the next table, I told him to send the server over, because I was done. 

When the server took the burger away, I told him the pork belly was raw. The chef said, "let me see that" under his breath. 

I'm sure he was going to say it was fine. He probably doesn't realize that Crave isn't the only place in Vegas that serves pork belly. 

The manager came over and apologized for the burger, and said she took it off the bill. I told her, "of course you did, I didn't eat it."  

The management, should work on their service standards and service recovery, because there are literally thousands of restaurants in Vegas.

Originally went to Public House, but it was a long wait so we stumbled upon Crave. It wasn't busy at all. The host greeted us (4) and continued finishing up whatever she was doing before we walked in, which kind of bugged me. We waited for about 2 min before she grabbed our menus and escorted us to our booth. Mind you, there was absolutely no one in the restaurant. We were the first guests of the day I assuming. We shouldn't have waited at all. We got seated and immediately our server greeted us and asked if we've been here before which we haven't. And began to give us a quick run down of the restaurant and menu. He was great. As soon as we ordered our food started to come in quick one by one. Also ordered a mimosa which only tasted the Orange juice. The appetizers were great (tuna poke) and the jalapeño poppers were delicious. When we got our entrees my husband ordered the béarnaise burger and I ordered grilled cheese with tomato soup. Mine turned out great (but who can mess up grilled cheese) as soon as my husband was about to take a bite from his burger our server mentioned that it was the wrong burger. He was served the Bison burger instead of the béarnaise. He apologized and offered to get him his original burger but my husband was fine with the bison burger. Which he said was really good. So no complaints. The manager even came to apologize about the mix up. When we got our bill nothing was even deducted for THEIR mistake. I mean the least they could do for their mistake on a slow day was take off a few dollars. But hey that's my opinion. All in all the food was good, the restaurant was nice and our server was great. I probably won't ever come back.
When can a steakhouse be great and great sushi? When it's Crave!  Great filet mignon, delicious tomato basil soup! Husband got sushi and it was delish!!  I recommend this place!

The only thing that could have made the food worse was if there was a hair, nail, or tooth found in it.  1 stars for the service and by that I mean our server who did not prepare or cook our meal. 

Only a few other tables occupied and one person at the bar when we were seated at 5:30. Took 20min+ just to get our waters and beer. Server was pleasant. 

Orders: artichoke dip, seafood paella and scallops and shrimp pasta....oh and the caprese flatbread after I sent my dish back. 

Artichoke dip was so salty and grainy and there were artichoke pieces that we had to pull out of our mouths and put aside because they were not masticate-able. We couldn't chew through them. The pool of oil on top was a nice soaking haven for the bread. 
Focaccia bread was decent, but served cold. 

Scallops and shrimp pasta has 3 tiny, rubbery, frozen scallops in it. Tasted half of one. Didn't even try the shrimp because after tasting the pasta, it would have been a moot point. There was no flavor of "lobster cream sauce", or anything honestly. Even lemon would have come through and I would h ave doused it if I had lemon. It was mushy and cooked poorly and the sauce tasted like nothing more than a pasty roux of flour,salt, and water. They didn't even cook the flour enough to burn of that pasty taste. 

Paella was a joke too...served on a plate at about a cull and a half size mound. Rice and protein included. Was NOT any version of paella I've ever tried. It was a best, an undercooked,  bland version of risotto. The rice in the dish never even saw an iron pan. Mushy on the outside and rock hard grain on the inside. And two pieces each of the assorted seafood that weren't even mentionable enough to remember...shrimp, mussels , frozen scallops? Maybe some fish? 

I sent my shrimp and scallops pasta back and ordered a caprese flatbread. Mozzarella, tomatoes, basil, balsamic vinegar, right? 
NO. No basil and there was arugula instead. Lots of balsamic reduction which was over powering, flavorless tomatoes like little slugs, and it was not any cheese worthy of being served as a caprese style dish. It was low moisture, skim, mozzarella. I wouldn't be surprised it the cheese came to them already shredded in bags. Gross. I had one piece and was done. 

This places touts itself to a much higher standard than it actually delivers while still charging the prices it thinks it can get for the food they claim to serve. 

Oh and I just received a coupon in the bulk mail for buy one get one entree there. If you want it, send me a message and I'll gladly give it to you.

I've been to this place twice now. Seems that the food and service are hit and miss. The dishes are tasty and the menu has a great selection. Ambiance is great. However I went for lunch and the food was just OK - some great some had to be sent back. The restaurant was dirty (especially the floor - looked like it hadn't been swept or vacuumed in a week). Beer was a little pricey for the quality of place. Overall I'd try somewhere else first and use this as a backup. Good concept, not so great execution.

We went here for dinner a few weeks ago with another couple and everything from the time we get their was poor--they sat us 20 minutes late, everything that all of us ordered wasn't good, the atmosphere feels like a chain and there are many other places on DT Summerlin to eat at.

Hi
My wife and I come to your store often on are days off .  We love the food and happy hour pricing .  We lately have been getting loyalty night emails and thought we would stop by .  We didn't RSVP because we have item off your menu we like .  We came in around 320, talked to barmaid that we have seen before .  The store was empty, a couple of duces and 4 to 6 people for the free stuff.  Seemed like there was enough staff to handle far more business then you had but everyone was preoccupied with the set up for the loyalty event .  Food took far to long to come out given business level , I'm sure you had a pantry person and Sous chef setting up for party and my ticket got overlooked .  We decided to leave and paid for the 1 beer we ordered .  The food  then came out , " no thanks ". Barmaid walked up to manager ( guy , late 40 mid 50s) then returned to offer food for free, again "no thanks " she went back to manager spoke to him as we waited for our change .  He never attempted to approach us at all and he was 10 feet away .  

I've been an F+B director as well as manager for many store in strip hotel , owned (;:/-/: cafe for 10 years on the strip My wife is a manager on the strip , her store does 15 million a years .........bottom line you dropped the ball during a locals appreciation night .  Kitchen took to long , staff didn't check ticket time and worst of all the manager did not handle the issue himself , he thought free food was the way to our hearts ......WRONG!!  Tighten up , worst mistakes happen when your slow and not paying attention .

Sent from my iPhone 
Former local customers
We come every Sunday's since it's opened and I never get sick of it, service is great and the food is even better, love Crave

Very nice, clean and welcoming restaurant. Craig was our server and he was awesome. Started off with truffle fries, buffalo wings and a couple pieces of yellow fin. My dad's dynamite role was "the best ever" but my steak was way over cooked. Great beer selection.

While the food was decent overall, and the waitress made sure to check in on is..... That is about where the good remarks end. Our two kids (party of 7) both had chicken fingers. Our daughters came out 5 minutes after the adults food. Our sons took an additional five minutes to come out (he's 2 and not very patient...), and when I cut into one of the fingers, it was raw! We had to send it back and wait an additional 10 minutes (by this time everyone else was done with their meal). My husbands chicken wings (ordered lemon garlic, only 2 of hem were lemon. The remaining were buffalo. Oh, and on holidays.... Kids don't eat free, which should have been disclosed at the beginning of the meal, not after we received the check. Nothing was offered for the mistakes and the raw chicken I almost fed my toddler.

At first we went, everything was perfect. The food was delicious, or so we thought, everything went well. The waitress messed up our orders but it was ok, not a big deal. We had to pay for bread which was kinda strange but again, not a big deal. Dinner went well and everything was alright. It's what's in the food that I question. My boyfriend and I and his parents we to eat there, we all ordered different things but idk something in the food have ALL FOUR of us diarrhea and tummy aches.  Boyfriend and I have been on the toilet for two days now along with his parents. This is really sketchy, I don't know how they did or what they did in the kitchen but I'm definitely never coming back. Awful explosive diarrhea and stomach aches. Spent $170 there just to get sick after. Very disappointed, I had really high expectations.

So far, this is the best burger we've had in Las Vegas. 702 burger or the Crave burger were both top notch. Amazing flavor combinations well presented. Scottish  Salmon was well worth it. Fresh and not fishy tasting. They claim it actually comes from Scottish waters. Our experience was 5 star worthy. Waitstaff was good, attentive and knowledgable. We will be back. I don't say that often in this town. I'm not sure why this place gets only 3 stars on yelp. Our experience was a solid 4.5. Will be back later this month to see if they are consistent.

We ordered the Mother's Day special and everything came out all at once including the salads that they actually forgot. The steaks and potatoes were cold and missing items we requested. The manager never once apologized but actually argued with me. They brought us new plates while we ate poorly made salads and the food was correct this time and tasted good. The server never came back except to clear the dishes and drop off the bill. She also never apologized for the mistakes and after we complained initially, had quite the attitude. When we received the bill, the specials were removed and again neither the manager or server said anything. We paid the remaining and tipped the server off of what the bill should've been even though she didn't deserve a dime. It's a shame because once corrected, the food was good but after that kind of service, never again. I didn't want it free. I wanted it corrected with a genuine apology. I wanted customer service and a good meal. Apparently you can't get those at CRAVE. We won't be returning.

I've been to Crave several times. They have a huge menu with something for everybody. And the food is really great. However, I have had the worst service every time. The servers are a little scatter brained and have messed up my orders/ forgotten to bring the check and the kitchen took forever to get the food out. It's always been a hot mess. Two and a half hours in a restaurant for a salad and some hummus is just too much. Its a bummer because their food really kept me coming back until I realized that their bad service was the norm and not a fluke. I suggest that you skip this place and go to Public School instead.

Visited for lunch two days ago. There were four of us in our party. I had read all the yelp reviews, which were not stellar, so my expectations were not over-the-top! I was totally impressed with the staff. I think most of these bad reviews happened the first week of their grand opening. IMHO they definitely got their act together. The hostess was gracious and welcoming. Our server was very experienced patient and very well-informed about the restaurant's offerings. We sat very near the sushi bar. I am not a sushi fan. I had read some of the reviews that said that the restaurant smelled like sushi. I have a very sensitive nose and could smell nothing adverse. I had my first bison burger; it was moist , had an appealing sauce and the taste was wonderful! Another person had the chopped salad and said that she would have it again (It looked excellent. Another person had their normal burger and she loved it! The fourth person had some sort of chicken pita wrap. I am sorry that I can't remember what was in it, but she loved it. The pita bread basket is to die for! They serve it with oil infused with oregano and other spices. I could not stop eating it!we also had the tomato basil soup. Three out of four of us loved it. The fourth person thought that it had a bit too much lemon in it. I thought that the prices were extremely reasonable. I will be back. We were seated immediately and he had a thoroughly enjoyable time there. I almost forgot: the french fries that come with the burgers are addictive! Fries came with my bison burger, but the server suggested ordering a large order of fries for the table. All four of us love the fries! They were obviously deep fried in very good oil! We were too full for dessert! One thing that impressed me, is that they have gluten-free options on their menu. I will be coming back with my cousin who has gluten issues. I gave the review 4-stars and am thinking of changing it to 5- stars. Again, kudos to the ENTIRE staff. VERY impressed!

While I don't eat sushi, I am always on the hunt  for a delicious burger. I am stoked to say that Crave's 702 burger lived up to it's reputation. The diverse menu is nice and the decor is cool to look at. Their avocado egg rolls blew Cheesecake factories right out of the water. This might be added to list for one of our regular joints to swing by.
Food average & tastless, bartender must not if ever tended bar before didn't know drinks or food and made several immature comments. Prepare to wait for food & service even though place is empty?

Came here for my mother in laws birthday and I am so mad that we did! She deserved to have a better birthday dinner. First of all when we got to the restaurant, the reservation was not in the system that I know we made. Then after they hurried to accommodate our reservation it took them over 20-30mins to come and take our order for DRINKS. Not only did it take them 20-30 mins to come order drinks, right after one waiter came another one came to take our drinks again. Really unorganized. Then it took about another 20-30 mins to come take our food order. My mother in law and her friend both ordered their house salad, and substituted the blue cheese with ranch. When the salad came out it had blue cheese on it, so they kindly asked if they could send it back to the kitchen and have it remade with the ranch how they originally ordered it. It came out after we had already ate our entrees, with ranch dressing with blue cheese crumbles on it still.. you would think if they're subbing the blue cheese for ranch they would take off the blue cheese crumbles as well. At this point we just had them sent back to the kitchen since we had already finished eating everything else. The entrees were very very bland, and over priced. Which was disappointing considering my pasta looked amazing but had no flavor what so ever and my husbands shrimp and lobster mac and cheese was extremely dry. They did give her a free dessert for her birthday, which was a nice gesture. She had got the s'mores brownie for dessert and even the brownie was bland. How do you mess up a BROWNIE???? Really bad experience, and will not be returning to the restaurant.

Well let's just say disappoint across the board . I have eaten there before but decided to give it one more try after attending a happy hour with decent appetizers . We first started out with a few appetizers before dinner , the chicken wings , Korean chicken bites,  pork dumplings and sushi tempura bites . The only thing I woukd order again was the pork dumplings. Lunch , me and my gf ordered the short rib hash , I ordered everything extra crispy with runny eggs on top , my friend ordered the same but hard fried eggs , the order came out completely wrong , my daughter ordered the bison burger , not only did the whole plate come out cold the bun was frozen,  manager came and asked if she wanted another or something else , she then ordered a sushi roll at 16.95 I'm thinking this better be an amazing roll , hardly the case not only did it fall apart it was small and tasteless. My friends daughter ordered the chicken sandwich which she said was ok and was only order that came out right but was cold too. I didn't even mention the service our waitress just seemed irritated the whole time serving us , enough so I mentioned it to the manager , she seemed to care but not really.  I'm not even sure how they stay in business , good is sub par and so is the service , for the prices I would much rather take my business somewhere else.  However they did take 20% off out bill for all the inconvenience.  I still do not wish to return again I wish they could get it together because it's a great location .

Second time was way better than fi.We ate 702 burger is different than regular burger egg on it but worth to try my girlfriend was crazy about that burger.And sushi was fresh and tasty.You should try calamary with parmesan so good.Our server helped us for meals.

I'm not sure if we just hit this place on an off night or what, but I will not be going back.
Once we were seated the waitress came to the table and it was immediately obvious that she had zero interest in being there. She took our drink order, came back with the drinks, took our order and then disappeared. We literally did not see her again. Given the attitude she may have just gone in the back and quit. 

Anyway, we ordered the calamari for our appetizer, considering the place was almost empty it took a completely unreasonable amount of time for it to come out, and when the sous chef finally did bring it to us it was cold. 

I ordered the Surfer roll and the Crunchy Heat roll - Both tasted like the the dishwasher had picked them up at 7 11 on his way into work. My girlfriend ordered the Sea Bass, which was delicious. But she isn't writing this review, I am. 

Considering all of the restaurants in that area, I can't see how you couldn't do better picking any place other than Crave.

Totally agreeing with Debby W.   Despite the usual goings-on with grand openings, you realize pretty quickly that this place is the new hot spot -- And that's just going by the diinner menu alone.  Two sides, equally phenomenal choices depending on your mood.  A larger-than-life Chicken Apple Sausage Flatbread went to the husband last night.  For me, sushi all around.  A new favorite (and everybody was ordering it) -- Yellowtail Jalapeno Sashimi followed excitedly by the Godzilla and Bamboo Bites specialty rolls.  Generous, fresh, delicious portions, adding new twists and flavors.  For dessert -- Crab Cakes!  They came late (kitchen was hustling!) but well worth the wait.  For the Ladies -- Pair this with an Angry Dragon Cocktail, and you're night is set.  Still talking about that drink this morning!  Great staff and great management with a hip but down-to-earth feel.  New place for date nights and after-work gatherings for sure on a regular basis.  Downtown Summerlin hit the mark on this one.

There are some extremely harsh reviews compared to the experience I had.

We chopped up Aloha roll, scallop poppers, chicken sausage mac 'n cheese, a bread basket, & a tiramisu just power it down style.  Everything was above average.  I was amazed at how respectable their sushi was when they are also serving up standard food.  I don't know if I would necessarily come for just the sushi, but if you are "craving" a feastival it makes some sense.  The desserts stood out enough on their own that I could see coming back and firing on the $20 sampler.

My server was spot on the whole time with no delays.  Almost had a "white table cloth" kind of experience combined with your casual bar.  Big comfortable booths and ample outdoor seating.

I would edge to a five before I would click a three, but expect a bit more uniqueness / less of a chain feel to get the full five.  Definitely will be back at some point.

Great experience!!! Service was superb! We loved the layout of the restaurant, there was plenty of space between tables and booths which made it seem more private and spacious. The decor was exquisite and impressive! Beautiful! The menu was really nice, with great choices in each category! The red curry pumpkin ravioli soup was absolutely amazing!!!! From flavor to consistency it was delicious!!! I had the chicken apple brie sandwich, which was really delectable! The combination of all the ingredients made for a really interestingly delicious flavor that I was thoroughly impressed by!!! I definitely want to come here again and try more selections!! 5 stars by far!!!

Overall experience was not memorable. Took over an hour to get seated. After being seated took about 25 minutes to get my drink. Ordered Sweet Peach Ice Tea. Waiter kept coming back to table saying the bar was making it. About 4 trips. Finally after another 16 mins she said that they ran out. This place sells sushi but not that great. Food wait times are horrible. While I must say that the place looks fabulous and upscale, the presentation of food is below par. Sushi wait times are bad for a place that claims that has a sushi bar.
