The only thing I liked was that it was family friendly.

Couldn't get seating outside. Very nice restaurant. Chairs were too high and uncomfortable. Waited 20 minutes to be served but our waiter was very nice. Got the lemon pepper wings they were excellent. Flat bread pizza was also tasty.
Reservation for easter brunch. Limited selection for brunch. No kid breakfast items available. Pancakes were undercooked. Waited over 30 minutes to get check. Disappointing.

I have been to Crave on many occasions. I have never had a bad experience. Whether I was eating dinner at a table or hanging out by the bar for happy hour. Beautiful facility, great food and drinks. Highly recommend.

My Father and I can be very difficult to please, him kinda more so.  I was hoping for a good experience taking him to Crave, and I'm happy to report they killed it!

We were greeted by a lovely young lady and seated promptly. Our server, Becca, was really terrific. Patient, friendly, and knowledgeable, we both order the steak frittes (steak medallions, asparagus spears, and fries.  It was absolutely delicious! Arrived hot and well plated. Generous amount of everything.

If my Father says "I'd come back here, you know it's gotta be good! Thanks Becca!

Barely average and overpriced....two of us ordered the chopped chicken salad for lunch which sounded great on paper---chicken, bacon,  dried cherries, almonds, fontina cheese, avocado, etc.  We were served an exceptionally unappealing small mound of gray, barely seasoned chopped items that all shared an odd flavor that neither of us could figure out. We decided the wet, bland, shredded chicken may have been slightly "off" and left after two bites & paying our bill.  Our fault for deciding the 20 minute wait for a table at another restaurant located right above Crave was too long.  Our first clue that something wasn't right should have been all the empty tables during what should be a busy lunch hour on a Saturday afternoon.  Too bad, too. The interior is lovely and the staff is pleasant.

Two weeks in & the place is still struggling with being new. Still not enough wait staff to support the place, as many tables were still empty on Friday night. The wait is still ridiculous (45 min for 2 people & we got there at 5:15). But it's still the only fancy-ish restaurant open yet. And the place is LOUD, like Red Robin loud. And no toilet seat covers...? What is this Europe? But the service was great, the rib eye was delicious, the potatoes were bland & the brussel sprouts were OK (they could use some bacon). The mini desserts were the best part. I'd go back, maybe months from now when they get their act together. PS. Watch your children people, those cactus out front are real!

I'll admit, based on the reviews, I was apprehensive when my friend suggested Crave before shopping... I was either going to dig it or detest it. Bearing in mind we got there at 11:30, we were ahead of any rush. Nice enough weather to sit outside where they have lots of umbrellas for those who don't enjoy direct sunlight dining. Before moving on, I will say that the hostesses were quite friendly but I hate how they dress! I think there's a red/black dress code- which I'm on board with- but the women (more like girls) looked like they belonged at a club, not a restaurant at a mall in Summerlin in the afternoon. Our waiter was adorable & on his game. We started with the bread assortment with fragrant olive oil... we loved every bite, though they were a tad skimpy on the oil. The tables have salt & pepper grinders but if you're a pepper user, don't use salt because there's a bit in the pepper (we super liked it!). She ordered the chicken breast entree that has a tropical spin (with jasmine rice) & I ordered the steak (with mashed potatoes & heirloom carrots). There was a bit of a panic when the chicken came, because it was on the bone with a wing & skin- my friend doesn't like meat on the bone, chicken wings or skin. Our waiter very apologetically offered to do what he could to make her lunch enjoyable & she settled with a side of the glaze since the glaze was only on the skin she wasn't going to eat. At that point, she liked it but I doubt she'd get it again. My steak was tasty & so were the carrots (either sauteed or lightly roasted). The mashed potatoes had a homemade texture but no butter or sauce/gravy of any sort- I ended up using some of the side of chicken glaze to spruce it up & it worked wonderfully. I'd definitely get my dish again. All in all, I think Crave has potential but a few kinks to work out. I won't rush back but I won't protest if it's suggested.

Very slow service at 3pm even if it was after lunch hours....it took 30 minutes to serve my food, but manager apologized.....can you imagine if it is during lunch or dinner times.....food is mediocre and not worth the money.....
Breanna was great. Food just ok. If you want sushi, not really that great. Expensive. Big place. Calamari was good. Veggie sushi platter good.

Went to Crave @ dt summerlin with a party of 4, All I can say is we will never come back here . Server was not friendly. Food was cold. We sent back fish that was cold , and they brought it back like 20 mins later !!! My whole party was already done with their food . We spoke to the manager and he was very careless !!! Overall a horrible experience !!!! Waste of money .

The only good thing about this restaurant is their service. Their staff is friendly and well trained. The food is below average.  We ordered their Siracha honey wings... too oily and shy in flavors.  Their food presentation is good but the flavors are subdued and bland in many cases. We ordered their chicked farfalle .. just too bland and extremely unhealthy with lots of butter floating at the bottom. My husband ordered another chicken dish in which the potatoes were cooked inconsistently and the whole dish was bland. 
We wanted to try their desserts but did not CRAVE for any after trying their appetizer and entrees. 

I have marked this restaurant off my list of places to revisit.  They need to make some serious improvement in their food flavors.

My very first time here and the food was great and service was great! Why did it take me so long to try this place out? Who knows....but I do know I'll be back! I ordered the wings off of the appetizer menu and didn't realize they were full wings! They we're delicious. And the price? Not bad at all! $41 for 2 orders of wings, 1 glass of wine, 1 order of French fries, chips and guacamole, and 1 strawberry lemonade! Our server was super sweet and attentive! To my military folks don't forget to ask for your military discount!

I have now dined for the 3rd time at Crave and it has yet to disappoint. The first time I was in was with my two small children and we had the pleasure of having Justin as our server. While although this is a kid friendly establishment it is not a likely kid place. He took excellent care of us and convinced me to me to sign up with the rewards program. I have since been back with my boyfriend and have been served by Julie, she was very friendly and accommodating to our very wobbly table! Our last time was with Jordan and once again the standard of service was up held by him and the food, as always, was excellent. I work for one of the largest food service providers in the country and their service does not go unnoticed as well as the entire dining experience itself.
This place has a decent menu. Prices are a little steep. I guess if you go there at happy hour it really isn't that bad. Our server was nice and pretty attentive. I'd give it another try.

Loved the service, dinner and setting. Food was excellent and served quickly on a busy Friday night.  I had the poblano Caesar salad and husband had grilled halibut. Very nice upscale place for a date night. I like their beer and wine selection

I had family visiting from out of town for Spring Break, and we wanted to see a movie at Regal.  Since Crave is one of very few restaurants in Downtown Summerlin that accepts reservations, it was my choice.  It was a beautiful night, and we had a great table on the patio. We were seated promptly at the reserved time, and our service and food were all without a flaw.  I like the varied menu, and the restaurant is very attractive.

Dined here for Mothers Day. Service was fast and amicable. 
I was bummed to hear that there happy hour and kids eat free deals didn't apply on Mothers Day, but I get why. 
My kids chowed down their buttered pasta. 
I throughly enjoyed my 702 sandwich and highly recommend it. 
The only negative was my wife's sushi. It was cooked. Kinda odd for sushi.

Had a great time at Crave two days ago.  Knowing Downtown Summerlin just opened recently and this restaurant is new, we were skeptical of what to expect.  However, Jordan, our waiter, was fantastic.  He suggested some great items, the Black Bean Soup and the Chicken Apple Sausage Flatbread, which were both delicious.  Back staff was always on top of refilling water and clearing plates.  We were there early, so were seated right away.  When we left, the restaurant was full and people were waiting to get in.  The bar was full and lively.

Overall, great experience and looking forward to going back!

Yummy! We have been in twice now. The staff is friendly, the food is good, the prices are reasonable, happy hour is good too. Their wine selection by the glass is certainly lacking but that's ok! Nice place overall we will be back

I have been coming here and enjoying the beautiful Fall Las Vegas weather and dining in the outdoor seating area.  My friend signed me up for the Crave card which will save you lots for your birthday, anniversary and approximately once a month spend $40 get $20 coupons they send you.  The best meal I enjoy here is the delicious Miso salmon with grilled vegetables.  It's a lovely, light dish with just enough sauce to enhance the beautiful salmon.
Food wasn't good, service wasn't good either. Go upstairs to Public School, their food was great!
Rough grand opening but they got their stuff together now. Had a great lunch and the burger was awesome. My appetizer came out cold and the same time as my food but was till happy with the service.

I'm not sure what to make of CRAVE after a couple visits.  The food is okay, but not great.  The restaurant itself seems torn between wanting to be a place anyone would like to come for a bite, and a fancy place for those special nights out.  Everything about the place seems to try and straddle that fence.

So that it's not lost in the review, the restaurant is very clean and the employees are awesome!  It's a fairly quiet place too, making it nice for holding a conversation over a meal.

The decor reflects my observation about the confusion with what this place wants to be:  a pub or wine bar, a restaurant, or a fine dining establishment.  There's nothing bad about any of it, but there's nothing that seems to really define what this restaurant's all about.  In the end it seems management is trying to appeal to everyone (leaning toward the fancy side), instead of standing out a little and making it clear why this is the place you want to come to for a certain kind of afternoon or evening.  This problem stands out even more given the number of restaurants in the immediate area that give you no doubt about what kind of place they are and why you'd want to go there.  The prices are a mix of average and high for what's served.  In the end, not bad but not great.

With an awesome location on the northern side of Downtown Summerlin, it's worth a visit if you're shopping around lunch or dinnertime, find yourself hungry and just don't have anything else specific in mind.

Our family went for lunch today. It was awesome!  The atmosphere, the service, the food... all terrific!!  We ordered the chicken & avocado egg rolls and the #9
Sushi roll for starters. Both excellent. For our entrees, we ordered the citrus chicken chipotle salad, the seafood paella and the blackened fish tacos. All excellent!!  We will definitely make this a regular choice when we dine out!!
CRAVE has really delicious food.  Be aware, the prices are a little expensive, but most places in Downtown Summerlin are on the pricey side.  The food is good and the service was great.

Crave was absolutely amazing. We got seated quickly for a Friday night.  The hostess was very nice. Our waiter was great. He recommended some great appetizers and we chose the calamari with an amazing sauce. We ordered specialty drinks that were unique and very tasty. I ordered the lamb meatballs with peppered fettuccine and my buddy ordered the scallops with corn and asparagus risotto. These dishes were outstanding. The service was great.  The atmosphere was perfect. Overall,  amazing.

Wonderful waiter but we left starving and in our opinion food is extremely overpriced! My hubby ordered poke bowl for $16 and it was so small a child wouldn't have been full. Prior to ordering he asked if was a decent size as he was pretty hungry and the waiter said it came in a pretty good size bowl, which was true but the actual food quantity was minuscule. I ordered one avocado roll and all 6 pieces could have fit in the palm of my hand.  We had a coupon or we would have cried at our $45 bill.  We did order a side of fries, small portion as well and a tempura veggie roll.  The roll was good but again, small.  It's very hard to leave a restaurant with a $45 tab and all you can think of is what can we eat when we get home! Sad to say but won't ever return and we live one mile from here.

I must say, I was looking forward to eating here but what awful reviews!

What is really turning me off is the pets.  I am the owner of the most precious Yorkie, I am not however a fan of dogs/pets in malls, grocery stores, and the most disgusting restaurants.

Robertos doesn't even allow dogs, at least in the eating area. Shame on you Crave! And your supposed to be upscale? And in the heart of Summerlin.
Always kind and fast service! Great atmosphere! 3rd time here and recommend to all! Had the loaded nachos, artichoke and spinach dip and crave wings (buffalo)! The tiramisu was tasty!

Good sandwiches and fries, BUT microscopic sushi rolls and absurdly horrible service.

Came here on a Saturday at 2PM to grab a quick late lunch. The restaurant was mostly empty with at least half the tables empty.  Two parties in front of us and the hostess took about 10 minutes to seat us.  She did not give us a food menu.  She was wearing thigh high boots which looked hard to walk in and a spaghetti strap low-cut tank top, which is consistent with another Yelp review that also pointed out another unprofessional outfit worn by the hostess.

Our server was friendly enough, but very slow.  He never refilled my water and never came back to check on us after our food came.  A different server brought our food.  The food took 20-30 minutes to arrive.

I asked to speak to the manager and he apologized and offered us free dessert.  We declined as we were already in a rush and he gave us a coupon for $10 off or a free entree.  Took some more time for us to get the bill (i.e. the service did not improve after my complaint) and the server told us we couldn't even use the coupon! 

Skip:
- Sushi rolls here are anorexic.  Tempura shrimp roll literally has one shrimp in it and is the smallest sushi roll I have ever seen.  Priced at $10, this is a rip off.

Recommend:
- Lamb piadini sandwich. This was a 5-star sandwich with thinly sliced lamb on flatbread and comes with .

Long story short my iPhone had be be in the Apple store for two hours.  We decided to give Crave a try for dinner but we were still apprehensive.  We ordered the Natchos Wow it was huge and tasty. The chicken wings were fantastic and my husbands favorite dish, the calamari was good.  The manager said the have changed the happy hour menu again so we might give them a go again for a date night.

We started with the jalapeño humus appetizer. It was very good but the flat bread that it came with I felt was too soft. It should be crispy. The little tomatoes on the side was very amazing. My husband had the 702 burger which he said was delicious! The fries were a little under cook but very tasty. I had the Mahi Mahi dish. It was cooked perfect. The salad & smashed potatoes that came with it was bland. The ambiance is elegant & the service was excellent.

I guess this bad experience could be on me for not reading reviews but I am trying to make my own experience and not based on some dude or chick's BS negative review. So here's mine. Came in a Friday night. They were busy. Ordered a bottle of wine, couple sushi items, an app and a kid meal to start. The apps and sushi came out in decent time. The kids meal came out when my wife and I were about done with the bottle of wine... this should've been a tell tale. I watched the kitchen service area and yes they were busy but no busier than any other busy restaurant in town on a Friday. My daughter was able to finish watching Cinderella start to finish before our entrees came out. I thought I order chicken and veggies only but I Guess they thought I needed rice. My wife ordered a salad which featured honeydew and almonds which were both absent... I had a bite of the chicken and I'm pretty forgiving of poultry in general but over cooked chicken breast is the worst... my wife just dealt with her lame salad. 

I ended up order long more sushi items (sushi here is avg at best). Our server wasn't bad and the mgr came by and said they comped our appetizer (the only thing that was ok). So after a worse than bad meal the bill is still $114. 

When I come to a chain restaurant I expect a decent order time. I'm guessing half of the food that comes out of the kitchen is frozen and just heat and serve. But the run time for Cinderella is 1hr 15min and hats what it took for a chicken bowl and a salad to come out... I just have to say EFF this place. My wife has points at this place too. Guess we will never get to use those for the mediocre food here. 


Update:
The owner reached out and offered a gift car for our next visit which seems nice but I don't think I'd come back here especially when there's Wolfgang's next door. Fogo and CPK a few hundred feet away, pub 702 upstairs. Heck there's even the snake river joint at the GK practice facility and a Yard House at Red Rock and a BJ's across Charleston. There's just too many better options at same or better value and quality nearby. So just a warning to every one that cares to read DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE. that's my PSA for this week.

Very good food. Their firecracker shrimp and chicken wings are so delicious and something that everyone should try. Great free desert. The server Richard is very attentive to our needs and has a very good customer service. We will be back soon

I came here last night for a friends birthday dinner and right off the bat the service was terrible. Our waiter was rushed and began by telling us that he's so busy and he's had a terrible day... ok that's great and all, but if you're waiting on tables NO ONE CARES how your day is, just do your job, no need to complain to costumers. He started off with sarcastic "jokes" that weren't at all funny and the whole group of us were just confused honestly. Besides the terrible service the food was not that great either. I had the crispy chicken slider appetizer and the chicken looked and tasted like frozen chicken tenders .. gross. They were also $14 for 3 little sliders. Overall, don't waste your time here... I drove all the way from henderson for a dinner here and was super disappointed. There are many better restaurants in downtown summerlin, I'm sure this place won't stay open for long.

First time visiting this restaurant and will be the last. Had dinner with the family around 5:30pm on a Wednesday.

- Our waitress was horrible. Left the table after taking everyone drink order. She seem like every time we responded to a question she would ask that we were bugging her. After we ordered our food we did not see her again until we had to ask for the check. Other staff members brought our food to us.

- Food lacked flavor.

Loud, Service sucked.  Waiter should have paid more attention to our food than trying to play nice guy. 
I asked for my salad to be served before main course and still have to wait after asking twice.  Of course half way through eating it down comes my dinner.  
Let's talk about that. Had the chefs special steak and while it didn't taste bad it's was one step above cold. The Brussels sprouts were cold and hard, mashed potatoes tasted like they came out of a box
Now let's top of the fact the server while I was still eating plops down to the others sitting at the table this "sign up for points card" DUDE IM STILL FREAKING EATING HERE! Next he was plopping down the check.  AGAIN IM STILL EATING MY DINNER WHY THE HELL ARE YOU RUSHING US.  
Oh wait, now that you closed out the check did you even offer desert? 
I so can't wait for the rest of the mall restaurants to open cause business will drop there with service and food served this way

I am only giving one star because they won't let me put .5 star! I went for lunch and got many items to the out. Started with cucumber and spicy tuna, the rice was disgusting no flavor!!!!!! And there was carrots and micro greens in my roll, who puts that In sushi?!?! Next was chips and guacamole, what we received was stale chips and browning avocados with a small onion piece in it, no seasoning or flavor what so ever! Next was the tater tots which weren't bad just super greasy because the oil wasn't hot enough when frying. Finally we had the Béarnaise burger and beef stroganoff. The burger had no Béarnaise as it states it has, and the mushrooms where barely cooked and tasted so sweet. Burger was gross, oily and again not seasoned. Beef stroganoff was absolutely disgusting. The horseradish cream was disgusting!!!  Over all everything was edible but painful to eat. I was so disappointed. I will never eat here again and urge anyone else to save there money. Our server was okay but not extremely attentive, which I am normally fine with, unless I am the only table in the place, then I feel there is no excuse! You may think this is harsh or rude, but I am in the industry and I know standards. Such a shame, such a beautiful place, could be so great if ran correctly.

I see a lot of mixed reviews on here. All I can say is my wife had a great experience and great meals.  The food was really fresh. Jenna was our server and she was awesome. We had sushi for a starter and it was delicious. My wife had Salmon and I chicken and pasta.  Both were really good!  We had the coconut cake for dessert. It was good but, not great.

Really good food (the sushi always tastes fresh) and the times we have gone, service was good to above average (doesn't hurt that we only live 5 minutes away).  And the outdoor seating area makes everything taste better :)

I got to the point where I only want to write 4-5 star reviews on Yelp. I want to help businesses not hurt them!


Back to my point, my initial thoughts were: What?! Only 3 stars?! What's wrong with everyone!  

First of all the service has been on point everything I've gone in (6 times). Not only has the service been quick, the servers are very kind, considerate, and resourceful! 

Their food is magnificent! I have had their pasta, sushi, burgers, chicken wings, salmon, flat bread, steak, and mahi mahi. However, my favorite dish is the parmesan chicken pasta!

Once again, only 3 stars?! I just don't see it!

Great tomato pesto soup, four cheese grilled cheese sandwich. Premium bento box of spicy tuna.  All very very good. Server Michael was good to us, even came out with a little fruit salad for our grandson who didn't take the time to taste that but did enjoy playing with the lid on his water glass

I didn't have the food here but judging solely based on the drinks. We came for happy hour on a Friday and got a table outside on the patio. Even though it was hot out, it felt cool out there. I got the Ginger Lime Margarita which was really good. For my next drink, I ordered the CRAVE Manhattan. When they brought me the drink, I thought it looked more pink than usual but just shrugged it off. Once I tasted it though, I knew it was definitely not a Manhattan. I told the waitress and she went to check with the bartender. She brought me back an actual Manhattan and told me that he mixed up the order so the other one was free! As you can imagine, I was pretty lit after that haha.. I don't even care that they messed up since I got a free drink! lol.. All in all, it's a cool place and I'd love to try the food sometime.

We ate here for the first time tonight. We had no reservation but were easily accommodated by gracious staff. The interior has sophisticated subdued lighting and is done in rich red and brown tones. The dining area is one large open room with views of the kitchen. We were seated at one of the center tables which are a little too close together for privacy. 

My partner snd I had the turkey burger and steak sandwich. The turkey burger was fine, served with fries that were slightly greasy. The steak sandwich was quite excellent, served on a fresh hoagie with a delicious spiced mayonnaise. The steak was perfectly cooked medium with that wonderful char-broil flavor. The sandwich had green lettuce and some bits of zesty pickled celery, pepper, carrot, and pearl onions that really complimented the flavor of the meat. I rarely take a doggie bag but I brought the rest of the steak home for lunch tomorrow. 

The service is excellent. It was an overall good experience. We'll probably be back again.

I'm kind of at a loss for words.  I mean, it wasn't bad but it wasn't great either.  I can say we definitely won't be going back for any of the sushi dishes, as each dish we tried (Mexican Roll, Bamboo Bite roll, and jalapeno tuna sashimi) reminded me of the "safe" sushi dishes I would try when I first forayed into the sushi world.  The menu made the rolls sound creative and flavorful, but alas that wasn't the case.  It's been years, possibly decades, since I've used soy sauce on any sushi that I was sad I had to resort to it here.  Without the soy sauce, there was no flavor at all, and that's talking about rolls that purported to have special spices and sauces already added to them.  The tuna sashimi was stringy, and not buttery and I could've done without the cucumber slice.  On a positive note, the sushi didn't come off as "fishy" smelling or tasting, so there was that.  After finishing the sushi, again which wasn't great, but wasn't horrible either, my husband and I decided to try the hummus.  On paper, it sounded amazing, served with goat cheese and herbs infused into the hummus, and rainbow cauliflower and toasted baguettes for dipping.  Again, the flavor was "okay" but there was too much of a layer of diced veggies dubbed as "bruschetta" on top of the hummus that we had to push to the side and the hummus itself had too much of an herb flavoring to it.  We had two bites and finally just opted for a slice of chocolate cake to share.  We will definitely go back and give it another try, as the menu boasted pastas, burgers, steaks, and salads that looked good as we saw them go by our table.  The bar area looked like a great place to meet for apps and drinks, and catch a game or two and the outside seating in the arroyo area of DTS also looked inviting.  Props to our server, who was friendly and efficient.  I'm hoping our experience was just a fluke, and we are open to another visit.

I'm gonna give it 3.5 but I don't feel it was good enough to round to 4. My best friend and boyfriend of best friend wanted to try something different. We decided to go to Crave for two reasons. 1. It was in Downtown Summerlin and we wanted to go shopping. 2. They had sushi. We made a reservation and headed over. We sat down in a little table and got some menus and the waiter explained the place to us. They have two kitchens, one regular and also a sushi kitchen. We took a moment to look over the menu and kinda just ordered a little bit of everything. We ordered a couple rolls, truffle fries, guac and chips, edamame, flat bread pizza, and even some mac and cheese. My favorite was probably the crunchy spicy tuna roll. We ordered so much they had to extend out table. HAHA, fatasses. We also ordered drinks. I had the blueberry Lemonade, very delicious if you like mint. It has mint leaves in it so it wasn't very lemony. We also ordered lemon drop shots which were strong. My friends also ordered some beers and ciders. We discussed the meal together and came up with 3.5. The flat bread was a little cold and not super tasty. The fries were probably my second favorite. I mean they are fries, you can't do much to mess them up. The guac was on a pile of lettuce which made it look like there was more than there was, also don't like lettuce in my guac, hopefully i'll remember to order it without the next time. Our server was really nice tho. He gave us as much information as he could and helped us organize our table to fit everything. I want to go back and try more items and hopefully fine something more memorable.

I went the for the second time yesterday, the only reason I returned was because I received 3 free appetizer coupons after finding a hair in my salad my first visit. The place had maybe three people in it. Though I'm visibly pregnant and the place was empty they sat my friend and I at the bar.
The waitress mentioned happy hour was coming up and even though we explained we wouldn't be drinking she failed to mention the food specials (which we found later on after we ordered) We ordered two salads, truffle fries, and the crab and artichoke dip with my coupon. The waitress never came back to check on us to see if we needed anything else and I had to chase her down every time she dashed by without refilling our waters. I wasn't a fan of the aioli for the fries and wanted ranch.. I was able to ask her for some about 10 minutes after we were served. Ten MORE minutes later she comes back and says oh no one brought you ranch? By now the fries are cold and soggy. She offers to take the fries off the menu. We ask for more flat bread crackers for our dip which we were charged extra for... My friend takes a bite with dip and finds A STRING OF PLASTIC in her mouth!!! We stopped a manager and to tell him what happened. He apologizes, leaves, comes back and says "You know what I think it was? A bristle from the brushes they use to clean the kitchen.. You know like a toothbrush." UM WTF!! Yuck!!!!! How did that get in the food?!! He returned with some more free appetizer cards and a $10 off coupon for the next visit buuuut I'm honestly scared to come back. Also hate not being checked on in an empty restaurant. I personally have never worked in the food industry but if I was a manager I think it would be common sense to train your servers to come check on the table 2-3 minutes after being served.

I have been wanting to try this place since they opened!
Went in with my Sister after catching a movie at the new mall.

Our food was really good! Started with the calamari, it was good, but nothing special.
For dinner, I had the lamb meatballs and fettuccine and it was very tasty. 
Over all the food was fine, but not incredible. In the same price point (our dinner was about $100) you could have something really special. 

What was the highlight of the night was our waitress. She was awesome! Fun, friendly and right on the ball! Which is funny, since most of the lesser reviews here talk about the flawed service here. But that was not our experience at all!

My over all take on this place is it is good, but not great. The price point is a bit high, but I suspect that the rent for this new location is insane. I get it.

Would I go back, sure. Would I suggest it. Maybe.

Ordered the steak sliders and the Dirty Flirty cocktail. Must say, the " Dirty Flirty" was pretty intense, the dirty martini had few bits of prosciutto & bleu cheese stuffed olives. The steak sliders were delicious, could of used more of the "juniper mayo'. Definitely would go back to try the sushi.

2nd time going to this restaurant the experience was not what I expected since they've been open for longer than 2 weeks. Waited 30 mins for a table for 2. I noticed a group complain that their buzzer wasn't working and apparently the battery died. The restrooms were again not cleaned and refilled with paper towels. Not sure if this place is going to change anytime soon.

Great service! Server was friendly, bubbly & attentive; also was knowledge of gluten free menu or any related questions I had about menu items. She offered suggestions of what food to order based on variety of preferences. We split the hummus for an appetizer and absolutely loved it; very unique. Then we got the mahi mahi with a shrimp infused rice & steak kale beet salad for our entrees and were both happy with choices. Only thing I would have liked was more emphasis on the beets in the salad, but I still enjoyed what I got. I Will definitely go back and try it again.

We checked this place out on opening weekend and it was inevitably chaotic. Although the wait was rather long and there were alot of open tables (I understand it is they want to pace the flow) we were seated and greeted promptly. Our adorable server Cameron was amazing. He was efficient and thorough in answering all our questions about the menu and accommodating our allergies. Per his recommendations we started out with the Jumbo Shrimp (Mind blowing) and We ordered the Roasted Half chicken and Norwegian Salmon for our entrees. Both were incredible - The chicken was perfectly seasoned - almost had an indian kind of curry taste and the salmon was to die for with it's crispy mustard crust. Cameron seems to be a reader of minds as anything we needed, he got it without us even asking and still made time to chat it up with us amidst the chaos in the restaurant (we probably heard dishes dropped by employees 3 times while we were there). Cameron suggested a coconut cake for dessert which just pushed our meal over the top. We had several managers stop by our table to make sure everything was okay which was a fantastic touch. Amazing, We will be back for sure.

Sushi, cheeseburgers, and pasta all served with the class of a fine dining restaurant. This is like a wealthy stoners paradise. 

I came here with a table of ten on their official opening day during the Downtown Summerlin insanity. Turns out this was the only restaurant that was open for business and you could tell. Crave was bursting at the seams; the bar was overflowing with the Real Housewives of Summerlin, the patio had the aging bros and most likely the ex-husbands of the fore mention housewives, and the dining room was a hodgepodge of suits, children, and hungry looking patrons. The front desk was backed up and a little unorganized, we had reservations for 8:30pm, but weren't sat until about 9:15pm.

The food options at Crave can be confusing, but in a good way. As I read the menu I wanted a little bit of everything and when the waiter took our table's order I noticed everybody must have felt the same way. We ordered sushi, fried chicken, sliders, calamari, and a Margherita flatbread. I only ended up trying the sliders and calamari... 

The slider was very good, a seared piece of pork belly with kimchi, placed on a very soft dinner roll. Full of flavor and the pork belly wasn't too fatty. The calamari was forgettable and it was served with a jalapeño aioli which I though was good, but it didn't quite fit with the flavor of the calamari. This would be better on a sandwich or burger, not with a seafood dish. 

After we finished our appetizers we had about 35 minutes of waiting before our food was finally served. I ordered the Bison Burger with fries and when it finally arrived it was cold and you could tell that the fires had been siting for awhile, they looked wilted and old. I was starving so at this point I really didn't care about the food's temperature, I just wanted to eat. The Bison Burger was very tasty even at a lukewarm temp. This chunk of beef came with a healthy slab of pork belly on top of it and a tasty aioli. I can only imagine was this must taste like straight out of the kitchen. 

There's a lot of things to consider in this review:
- It's their grand opening day. There's going to be hiccups and as a customer and former restaurant worker, I understand this
- They were the only restaurant open at the time. I don't know of any place that can feed about 2,000 people within a few hours and not mess up once or twice
- Our server was solid. We always had fresh water and drinks in front of us
- The manager came over and checked on our table multiple times
- The place was crackin', I mean slammed! So, the fact that we only waited 35 minutes for our meal really isn't that bad. If you have good company, and we did, time will fly. 

This review is really a 2.5 stars, but the service pushed to a 3 star. I will be back in a few months to see if they have worked out the kinks.  

JUST A NOTE - If you give brutal reviews to restaurants on their opening day. You're probably an insanely critical jerk with everything in life. Just sayin'

Don't go hungry. This place is slowwwwwwwww. Party of 5 last night. Watched my daughters COLD sushi sit near a heat lamp for 37 minutes before attempting to be served. Then when they did we refused it. Brought us another. Manager came over. Lady and I don't think she was a manager and just apologized. I felt very sorry for our server. She was working hard but the kitchen staff needs work yet. They opened way too soon. Won't try again until next year!! Save your $$$ on this place until they work the kinks out!

Sunday, May 8, 2016. The online advertised Mothers Day Brunch buffet was NOT what we received upon arrival today. This was a special day resulting in let down and disappointment to say the very least. Shame on Craves management team for enticing return/repeat customers such as ourselves via online advertising to "book reservation for Mother's Day brunch" using LAST YEARS 2015 Mother's Day brunch PHOTOS of their previous brunch buffet layout. The only reason we returned for this years Mother's Day is because of said brunch buffet. Ultimately, their management team should refrain from using BAIT and SWITCH shameless tactics. Word of mouth is what brings business in, not lies. There are many wonderful Restaraunt options in Las Vegas to choose from. Why would anyone choose this establishment for special occasions, when they participate in unsavory deceptive advertising?

Considering going to Downtown Summerlin is like taking a road trip for me, finding a new exciting place to eat was part of the thrill in my journey. 
The menu at Crave was unique and enticing, so, Allison S., myself, and my other half Brent S. decided to give it a try. 
Off top, the service was great. Maybe a bit overstaffed due to the recent opening, but every face was smiling and welcoming from the host, to the chef, to the wait staff. 
Between us, we ordered edamame, a couple sushi rolls, and jumbo shirmp. I also endulged in a martini, because they offer blue cheese stuffed olives and I just can't ever seem to turn those down. We weren't looking for full meals, just something to hold us over.  
So basically, in my own humble opinion, this place has mediocre food, an overpriced menu, and a faux gourmet intention when you are getting nothing of the sort. 
Why should an 8pc. sushi roll with spicy tuna and shrimp be $19?! Because I am in the new mall in Summerlin, eh, NO. 
Why should 4 appetizers and a cocktail cost $80!? Not my style. Was the food decent, sure. I would eat all of it again. But I would never pay that much for it. I could easily go to Ra, or Sushi Roku, for gourmet sushi, AND IT STILL WON'T BE $19 A ROLL!! 
The decor was beautiful, the cocktail was great. (other than the fact that only ONE of my olives was stuffed, LAME!) But remember, Wetzels Pretzels is still 500 feet away, and Crave, you are not good enough to charge the prices you're asking. Rent must be super high at this location. Sitting between MTO (which has GREAT prices) and a Wolfgang establishment, where its worth the price, my final words for Crave, GOOD LUCK.
Awesome food...just enough and the setting is grest!  Our server Adam was very attentive and genuine..he was amazing!   We will be back!

I ordered one of the sushi boats, and the sushi tasted like supermarket sushi. The boat itself was $26. They were probably one of the worst tasting sushi I've had in my entire life..... Fish was far from fresh, and the rice was definitely not sushi rice. My boyfriend liked their ribeye steak though so that was fine. Service was great. Just avoid their sushi at all cost....

This place looked like a  pretty good place to have lunch... Well after ordering we got our dish and it was NOTHING like it said on the the menu... 
First of all the fries were SOGGY and GREASY and the burger was just ok. 
My pasta dish was OILY and GREASY... 
Our iced teas sat there empty for awhile and NO one came to refill it...
TOTALLY BAD SERVICE AND FOOD WAS AWFUL... NEVER AGAIN...

Food was ok, but the service was horrible. The waiter kept on spitting and was rude. They messed the food multiple times. If you can handle incompetent chefs and less than smart waiters I'd say go, but otherwise it's a bust.

I've been here twice with a friend of mine and before my first time going I called to see if they have any vegan selections and they replied saying "many options, they're just spread throughout the menu" I ordered the veggie roll, which has no Suchi in it, just rice sea weed, avocado and veggies. It was pretty good. Only downside was my waiter didn't really take me saying I'm "vegan" seriously. I asked him what I should order and he kept pointing out items with dairy, and even offered me dessert with ice cream! I just thought waiters and waitresses would have better knowledge of what vegan and vegetarian is. Over all. Everyone is very nice. My friend loves Crave and even got a rewards card. I hope more vegan options come on the menu. It's a very nice restaurant but the appetizers are just as much as the entrees . Weird. Probably will be back :)

I can't really figure out why this place is only getting a three star rating... When I loved my dish...I will say a lot of their entree dishes are severely over priced... Which is what I am going to deduct stars for...And my mom was not impressed with her chicken farfalle. It was a 20.95 dinner priced item (it was also a lunch sized portion that they only charge you 13.95 during the day for). Don't order it unless you're there for lunch... Not worth the money and you won't be getting extra food... Or even a dinner salad with the dish.

My dinner was great... Price point was on point. They accommodated me totally, Being vegan and Taking out the sashimi and adding a few extra cucumber and avocado rolls. The veggie roll it came with was delicious and flavorful. The rice was just a tad but dry... And I would always prefer brown over white... I'll ask next time if that's an option. It was 13.95 for a lot of food... Saving them some stars..

The edamame app was severely over priced.  8 dollars for a child sized portion... I'm not sure why I even ordered it or what I was thinking... But it wasn't worth 8 bucks... I could of got 4 large bags of traders joes edamame... For what I spent on one serving there. Never again. Please note they use fish sauce... So order it steamed... With just Lemon and sea salt if you are vegan. 

The server was really accommodating and sweet. She was on top of the table and we never had to ask for anything. She was knowledgable about the menu and accommodating to my life style. I probably will come back for happy hour... Or lunch... But 50 bucks for dinner... For the two of us... For two mediocre dishes is not really my thing... My dish was amazing and so was the service. That's whats earning them three stars. Get your prices together guys! If I'm spending 20 dollars on an entree... I don't want the bottoms of my table to be balanced with napkins on the ends of the legs to keep it from wobbling... Or having a free stoli bright read umbrella over my head... Yes those are free from
The liquor reps... Fix the patio decor and ambiance... Throw a candle on the table... Make me feel like I'm in a 20 dollar entree price point.... You guys can do better than 3 stars!! I'm coming back to give it another chance... And I'll update accordingly... Hopefully your happy hour saves you next time.

I really really enjoyed it. I do have to say the regular menu is pretty pricey but the food was well worth it! We went during happy hour and everything sounded so appetizing.

Our waiter DeAndre was so nice and welcoming. He even gave us a little Japanese history when he gave us hot towels to wipe our hands. I like the atmosphere and I love the location! Overall it's worth it during happy hour!

The grand opening for Downtown Summerlin was crazy and this being a few places for sit down dinning, it was quite the wait. I am impressed with the service from the hostess to the wait staff. Miranda, our host, was wonderful and pleasant, she disclosed the wait time and accommodated us ASAP when our wait time had surpassed. Emily, our waitress was exceptional, she made sure we were taken care of even having worked since 10am, still upbeat and pleasant. 

We ordered the Michelada and it was amazing! The Poké Tacos are delicious. We tried the Black bean soup and Caesar Poblano Salad was delicious. The grass feed beef burger was just tender and scrumptious.

Will be back for sure.

I was attracted to crave because of their menu options, but was quickly disappointed from the first course and all the way through to dessert. There are many choices for dinner but maybe they should narrow it down instead and really focus on quality and taste. I order a CRAVE house salad, which was not bad, but was lacking the walnuts and goat cheese ( the only two ingredients other than the lettuce and dressing). Next I had the lettuce wraps and fish tacos as an entree, both selections from the appetizer menu. The lettuce wraps were served on butter lettuce instead of iceberg, which sounds good at first, but is all wrong due to a lack of crunch or any real texture you are looking for in lettuce wraps. The pulled chicken was also very stringy and soaked, and i mean soaked, in hoisen sauce. Way way too sweet. The fish tacos were the best part of the meal, they had potential to be really good but was lacking fish and had a lot of corn salsa instead. My husband ordered the 702 burger, which sounded great on paper. When it was delivered it looked good too, nice presentation, but the taste was not as good as the look. It was way too greasy, he had to fork and knife it to eat it because it was too greasy to hold itself together. He ordered it medium and it was medium well to well, almost no pink at all. The bacon was really sweet and thick, also making it a dessert burger. The truffle fries were pretty good though he had on the side. For dessert we ordered coconut cake to go. What a let down. Barely any cake in this slice. I am not saying it wasnt large. I am saying it was all frosting, and not good frosting, tasted like right out of the can frosting. Again way too sweet. We had a couple bites eating around the frosting and just threw it away. This place is called crave because if you are craving salt and sugar its perfect. They could use some dusting and detailed cleaning though. Service was not bad either, waitress was kind, but never checked up on us.

Our server, Chyna, was so friendly and personable. She could give lessons on being customer friendly. She was great. Everything we ordered to eat was very good, from burgers to sushi. Only negative would be the balsamic vinegar dressing on the salad was just too too tart to eat. A place we will return to and hopefully Chyna will be our server again.

We decided to come to Crave because my son was having a birthday soon and he wanted Mac N Cheese. Lol. Perfect- mom and dad get real food, kids get spoiled. AND KIDS EAT FREE EVERY DAY WITH THE PURCHASE OF AN ADULT ENTREE. 

Before heading in I stopped at lulu for an exchanged and they had a coupon at the register for a FREE APPETIZER. Score. 

- fish tacos. Free, okay, prob wouldn't order again. 
- chips and guac. Chips were stale and there wasn't more than half a cup of guac, which had def been sitting out a min. 
- Bourbon BBQ chicken sandwich. We ordered this with the idea of ordering more food, dad announced that we were sharing. The sandwich came spit for the two of us! That was an extremely considerate move on the server. Way to go. 
Now the sandwich itself- thick and juicy. Bacon on point 

All and all the place is nothing amazing, but better than average. Good for families and large groups but NOT for date night. 

Birthday boys and girls receive a cupcake compliments of the chef. So sweet.

Sign up for the rewards program for extra perks.
I'll be back to try out the sushi.

The service was slow and the food was disappointing. We went for lunch and from the point of being seated to having our check brought to us was slow. We finished our drinks before our appetizer came out, requested refills, ate our appetizers with empty glasses, finished our appetizers and still had empty glasses. I requested ketchup...it took 8.32 min. Take your timer and have your staff sit in front of a hot plate (mine was not so hot btw) and have them wait 8.32 min. You get my point. Now, had the restaurant been busy this would have been somewhat acceptable. It was not busy, there were several empty tables. I witnessed employees sipping out of a glass, joking with other staff (including my server) and basically taking their time. The food was served cold, it was underwhelming, over salted and on top of that, hard to enjoy due to the not so great service. Frankly, there are plenty of places to spend my money on food. This will not be one of them.
 
I'd like to end this with something positive...our server smiled a lot!

After a full day of shopping at the new Summerlin shopping mall we had a good appetite. There were several new restaurants in the area but Crave caught our attention.  The outside was very attractive and the menu had a good selection to choose from. We walked in and the restaurant was decorated in ultra modern décor. The hostess greeted us and asked if we had reservations.  Never understood why this  question is asked because there were empty tables available. My wife asked the hostess to sit us in a nice area.  She guided us through the restaurant to our table which was a booth in the middle of the restaurant. We had a view of the bar and the outside. The waitress came to our table and greeted us. She immediately asked us for our drink order and asked if we wanted to start off with appetizers. The waitress suggested that my daughter order the raspberry lemonade. My wife and I ordered a bottle of wine.  I knew that I was going to order a big meal so we skipped the appetizers even though they had a good variety.  

The waitress returned with our drinks.  The raspberry lemonade looked delicious and was. Then she presented the wine by displaying the bottle and opening it for us to taste and proceeded by filling our glasses. She left allowing us to review the menu. The menu had a good variety, beef, chicken, pork, seafood, pasta, sushi, sashimi and a section of chef signature dishes.

The waitress return to take our orders, my daughter order the marinara and pasta with french fries from the kids menu.  My wife ordered the sea bass and I ordered the rib eye steak.

Within 15-20 minutes our entrees came to the table which had a nice presentation and looked delicious. We preceded to eat, however I did not have a steak knife and my wife was missing her knife. We stopped our waitress and requested the knifes. The waiter should have notice or asked us if there was anything else we needed. Our waitress brought the knifes to the table and apologized.  

We began eating our entrees.  My wife thought that her sea bass was cooked to  perfection, light and moist with the right amount of seasoning.  The pasta with marinara was a little gummy but the french fries were crisp on the outside and soft in the center. My steak was very good, medium rare with good flavor, charred brussel sprouts and creamy mashed potatoes. 

The waitress checked on us several times and refilled our wine glasses which shows that she was trained properly.  At the end of our meal the waitress returned and asked us if we wanted dessert. Unfortunately, we were stuff.

Overall the experience was average because the restaurant was relatively new and need some refinement.  It would have been nice if they offered complimentary bread at the table and a little more attention to detail. We will be back again to give it another try.

I'm not sure what the terrible reviews really stem from, but I'm sitting here now after a wonderful meal and will definitely be back. We were seated almost immediately, the menu has some very excellent looking meals, the service was spot on, and everything we had: artichoke crab dip, volcano roll, Crave starter salad, the crab topped filet (cooked med rare perfectly), and the Angry Dragon martini were all fabulous. I would say it could possibly be because we were here at a slightly later hour, but it was quite busy since it was the same night Red Rock had their fireworks show for their 10th anniversary. Like I said before, we will definitely be back.

Everything was Amazing! Service, food, value... Autumn was our server, she was excellent. We joined their loyalty club and look forward to coming back soon... FYI, kids eat free all the time (with adult meal purchase.)

The food was okay happy hour was cheap but the portions were so small. Food isn't anything to die for and there sushi is gross. Our server some nice young guy was super nice . But the food was still gooood ... the owner is extremely nice and reached to me to fix the problem I haven't been back since but I'll be back soon to try it again . I'm sure this time around everything will be super dope.

I've been here 3 times so far already and will continue to be a customer, I just crave this place sometimes. They're salmon with miso is my favorite, drinks r delicious, and the chocolate layer cake is just to die for. Glad I decided to try this place!

Yikes! So let me start out by saying that I was extremely excited to try this place out and ended up a tad bit disappointed.. Or maybe that's an understatement.. I was beyond disappointed. I made a reservation through opentable.com for a party of two. Upon arriving I was greeted by a very polite hostess who asked where I would like to dine (inside or outside). I of course wanted to dine outside because the weather was perfect. So here's where the train started to wreck. We waited for our server for approximately 15 minutes. 1 person came up to tell us that she would be right with us and then she didn't come over as soon as we expected. Now don't get me wrong she was a very nice and polite server but that doesn't cut it when it comes to moving quickly and efficiently. The excuse that they may or may have not been busy can be forgotten. In this case they weren't! So for my appetizer I ordered the CRAVE stack sushi roll and my partner ordered the Crunchy Roll. The sushi was just OK..Dragon Fruit martini was good! For dinner I went with the 702 Burger that was recommended by our server which I wasn't impressed at all. Took OVER 20 minutes for two burgers to come out? Really?? And then to comer out not even the right way? When it came out the bacon was BURNT..like burnt to capacity! I showed my server and even she agreed that was unacceptable and that she'd have some more bacon sent out to me. Fries were cold on both of our plates had to have more fries sent out. The problem is that it took about 15 mins for that and I literally was damn near done with the burger by then. My partner had the CRAVE burger and he to was not impressed with the burger so I'm really not sure if we just caught them on a bad night (if they are allowed to have those) but yeah the jury is still out on whether or not I will be returning or not. Management hopefully reads these reviews because clearly the general consensus is that they need to get it together.. I can now see why they are rated an average 3 star! I really wanted to like this place especially because it's so close to my house..

OH MY GOD! 

Yes, yes! I just love this place! I'm gonna try not being bias here as the whole reason of writing a review is to give the readers and idea of the type of experience we had by eating there. So, let's start by talking about their location, service, foods, deals and finally what makes them different from other restaurants.

Located at Downtown Summerlin in Las Vegas, The CRAVE restaurant has a very good location right by the Red Rock and the luxury theater Downtown Summerlin. I have been eating there since they first started and I have to say that I'm still getting impressed with every new dish I try.

What I love about it is their service and deals! I got a royalty card that it's very useful, it's not just a cheap punch card, it's a card made of hard plastic just like a credit card. You can always expect your card to reward you with something every time you eat there. Sometimes it's going to be a simple $10.00 discount, but sometimes it will give you a two for one entree or even a free meal. Keep in mind that their entrees are just out of this world. Their servers are well trained and very happy for working there, which makes the whole experience very enjoyable.

Ask the servers to help you choose something, trust me, they know what's up. But if you are looking for a something specific, you can still dig thru the menu to find it. Their menu is very diverse, from amazing steaks and salads, to poke bows, chicken wings and even flatbreads; everything you order is going to be top quality and presentation.

My only concern is the price, since their food is so delicious that you might end up spending more than you wanted (happens to me all the time at restaurants like this one where everything is damn good). Besides that, make sure you ask for the royalty card and sign up for their email marketing so that you can get to know about their special deals and events.

Finally, I can't finish my reviews without letting you know what's good there right out of my review. You must order their truffle fries, then try their flatbread and their chicken wings. For your main entree, order a File Minion with Crab sauce and vegetables. They have a great list of wines and beers too. They also have sushi, OMG, how can it get better than that? Well, it does when they have deals that allow you to get two entrees for the price of one! Me and my wife got two File Minions with crab sauce for the price of one!!!' Yes, two top meals for one!!! Of course it doesn't happen that often, so that's why you must subscribe to their email marketing list and get the awesome Royalty card!!!!!! Just an awesome place!

Good food, terrible service. The hostess was not friendly at all. She told us we could wait outside for her to seat us. We awkwardly stood among the outdoor tables and waited for her to come out and eventually chose a table ourselves. The table had a teapot on it from a previous diner which nobody bothered to remove, the hostess "cleaned" the table with a paper napkin. The waiter was nice but didn't know a lot about the menu items. When our food was delivered we didn't have any flatware or napkins. We asked the expo for flatware and she returned with fork and knife. When we then said we needed napkins, which was obvious, she was clearly irritated. My boss, who I had brought to lunch, received the wrong item which she ate anyway. The waiter was kind enough to have the correct item prepared so she could take it to go. Coffee, tea or dessert was not offered at the end of the meal. The food was quite good but the poor service overshadowed it. Some of the employees at Crave need to look for a different field because hospitality is clearly not their strength. I will not return or recommend to anyone.

After my 81 year old mother prepared our Thanksgiving meal I decided to take her out last Saturday to relax and enjoy a good dinner. The $5 cup of black bean soup was fine, however after that, things got bad.  We ordered the "steak" sliders as an appetizer.  They were a sad shade of gray, tasteless, tough and luke warm.  Couldn't figure out if it was salisbury steak, or something more sinister.  $15 for 3 of these monstrosities was criminal. The calamari was tasty, but skimpy, and again luke warm.  The caeser salad was bland, with absolutely no flavor, and next to no dressing.  
       Ordering the 'signature' rib eye for the main course was another huge disappointment.  $31 for a steak 3/8ths of an inch thick is absurd.  I don't think they are getting nervous at Del Frisco's.  After all this mediocrity, we decided to skip desert at Crave, and purchase some items from the nearby Trader Joe's.
      The highlight of the meal was the desert from Trader Joe's.  I am not a malicious person, however I need to warn other yelp fans about this $155 fiasco.  For that type of money we could have had an outstanding meal at the nearby Vintner's Grill or Honey Salt.

HORRIBLE!!!! We get there and order our food...we ask for a bread basket and it cost extra. My son had hair in his food..When I told the waiter he said do you want me to take his food back to the kitchen???? I'm like did you really need to ask that question??? Then they bring my salmon and it is under cooked in fact just about raw. I told the waiter and while he's somewhat apologizing he spits on the table and keeps talking. We are like WHAT??.? So they bring my son out his food and a whole 20 minutes later they brought my food and I'm like keep it...we're leaving.  Prices and high. .
Service bad. ..
I WILL NOT BE RETURNING!!!

Went for happy hour last week and we were not impressed. First off, terrible service... We sat for over 15 minutes at our booth before served. Second, the menu is not as impressive as we were hoping. Food was good but the drinks were only okay. Probably will not try again.

EVERYTHING YOU MAY CRAVE

This is a very INTERESTING restaurant.... There is a VARIETY of things going on... They have things from American... Mediterranean... to SUSHI... RANDOM but also... if you can't decide what you want... i guess you can come here for a VARIETY of Choices.

I have been here before when they were fairly new... the food was AMAZING! this time around... i was a bit disappointed... as the selection i made again of what i had eaten before was NOT the SAME as what i was expecting.

Our server was nice, but she seemed like she was having a bit of a rough day... We also ordered a bottle of wine & there was some spilling action due to the capsule not being cut off all the way... which the wine hit & just dripped all over the table =/ 

Came here w/ 2 of the girlfriends so we shared a bunch of different things.

BREAD BASKET $3 - different kinds of bread & probably wouldn't get it again while paying... prefer to get truffle fries as a filler but our server forgot to put our order in for this & we were already too full to tell her.

CRAB ARTICHOKE DIP $13.95 - a mix of crab & artichoke tossed in a lemony mayo served hot w/ flat-bread. This thing was freaken AMAZING & scorching hot which made it even tastier. The crispy flat-bread just perfects the dish!

CRAVE HUMMUS $9.95 - a pesto & goat cheese infused hummus served w/ rainbow cauliflower & fresh veggie bruschetta w/ crostini. This was not my style & we probably made the least dent in this item. It just had a sour taste to each bite... =/

ARGENTINE STYLE RIB-EYE $31.95 - rubbed w/ palm sugar rub & chimichurri served w/ potato puree & rainbow cauliflower. I was hoping to taste some chimichurri but the palm sugar rub was overpowering & it tasted like a sweet piece of meat rather than the melody of sweet & savory....

SAUTEED SCOTTISH SALMON $21.95 - mustard crusted served w/ grain beurre blanc, potato puree, heirloom carrots. PERFECTION on this dish, although i don't like salmon... i had to try it. it was also a HUGE piece of fish! the mustard crust gave it a nice blend in flavor.

SIMPLY GRILLED HALIBUT $MP - typically served w/ coconut jasmine rice & roasted rainbow cauliflower, but i got potato puree & asparagus instead. This was a very DISAPPOINTING dish... the fish was like GOO... i LOVE LOVE halibut & i just couldn't eat it.... every bite, it was like MUSH rather than FLAKEY meaty goodness... also tasted fishy which typically should NOT be the case for HALIBUT!

I had the Poke', Yellow tail , and seaweed salad , all were excellent ! Display, quality of product , and service were perfect. The citrus pot of herbal tea , with lemon and honey, I believe it to be the best served in town, right up there with the four seasons.   My only suggestion is to get a selection of Wheat less Vegan deserts , then you will have me there all the time.  I had No Bad Reaction to any of their food.

I have eaten here several times and service/food always good. I think priced on the high side but has a not so normal menu. It offers twists on classics like the Mac n cheese(can you say yummy) to sushi. I go back because I do like the menu and service always good.

I crave the food at Crave. Their salads and sandwiches and soups are delightful and worth the trek across town. 

It's interesting how we can all have such different dining experiences at the same place. My experience has consistently been a positive one at Crave. The staff is always friendly and on point. They know their ingredients, and have made excellent recommendations upon our asking. 

In comparison to the neighboring restaurant Lazy Dog to which I am not a fan, Crave feels upscale. Everything has been taken into careful consideration from the heavy silverware to the stylish glassware. It's beautiful inside. 

The menu: I LOVE the apple, brie, chicken sandwich on tandoori bread. It topped with peppery arugula and drizzled with balsamic. Just dreamy if you ask me. The cobb salad is a close second. Desserts are always hard to resist at Crave. The standout tome is the apple bread pudding. Lots of porn noises made while devouring this and don't ask me what conversations were had when this was in front of me. I was more interested in the flavors on my spoon. 

Pricing is average for a dinner in Summerlin. Also, prices are posted on the menu. Don't dine here or anywhere for that matter if you don't like the pricing. 

Crave now has a new promotion called Slay, Rose (Rosay). Specials on Rose wine and they will also give you a pitcher of rose to play rose bong with it. Lol. How creative and fun. 

While everyone else in the mall are at the Dog place I can't stand I will be here feeling Queenie and shit.

I tried this restaurant for lunch today. This is a lively, high-energy spot with a diverse menu. My waitress was very nice and attentive. I tried the Bison burger and fries; both were tasty!  I really liked the fact that they offer mini desserts (nice when you just want a little something sweet).  Enjoy!!!

My friends and I this for happy hour on Saturday. We really like the menu and we try the pork potstickers, aloha roll, spicy tuna roll, Parmesan truffle fries, Tempura bite, lettuce wraps and the Kinky Moijito and Madras Martini.  The Kinky Mojitos was really good  and we ended up having several of them :-). When Joy everything that we ordered and the service was phenomenal. Our server was Michael who knew the menu and made some good suggestions and was really great as far as checking on us and bein very attentive.  Michael was fantastic and he even went above and beyond by tracking me down in Summerlin shops when I mistakenly left my eyeglass case in the restaurant. He could've easily left it, but he heard where we were going next, found us and brought it to me.....how great is that!!! We will definitely be going back for one of the girls weekend happy hours.

had a birthday celebration at Crave last night. we were a bigger group of about 12 people, we were promptly greeted and asked if we were celebrating anything special, we replied yes a birthday! server brought waters but never asked if we wanted to order drinks, we of course asked him for drinks. then asked if we were ready to order instead of offering appetizers first, so we all ordered apps n entree at same time. service could have been better! most everyone ordered dessert but they never did anything for the birthday girl, that was pretty rude!
The food here is probably one of the best in downtown summerlin. I have come here for date nate with my girlfriend multiple times and I have always been impressed.

Favorite place to go eat! Everything we've had has been a home run, especially the apple sausage flatbread pizza! Chef Shaun is amazingly talented and we are happy to follow him to whatever restaurant he works at.

Don't get your poke bowl here! The Mexican poke bowl was $18.95. I guarantee you can, get 2 medium bowls at a specialized poke place, with healthy portions of protein, toppings, and avocado. Not. Here.

The chicken apple brie sandwich looks mouth watering; presentation stands out in the food preparation here at Crave. But dry chicken without flavor within it, always tastes better with added sauce and thin sliced apples.

We had a good sized party of 7 adults. Even so, the restaurant did not seem that busy, but our food took a while. It was nice of our server to acknowledge our low on level drinks, he was really pleasant. I hope the tip I left all goes just to him.

The ambience gets a star and a half, our server gets a star. If our food weren't overpriced or actually had a flavor score, I may be more generous with my decision of the rating. At this point, the reason I found to possibly dine here again is for dessert and happy hour. Then again I'm positive there are other places that top the happy hour temptations. You'd have to have a strong sense of influence to have me try another menu item, and make me change my mind on 2.5**

My aunt and I stopped in Crave for some post Christmas shopping lunch. It was a beautiful place to dine and the food was good. My aunt enjoyed a sweet potato soup, while I opted for a sushi roll and chicken wings. Everything came out pretty quick and the staff was nice. There was nothing cosmic about my meal, but it was good. If in the area I wouldn't be opposed to eating there again, but I would probably try another place before opting for a repeat Crave experience.

We tried this establishment when it first opened. We walked into the place it smelled like rotten fish. We ordered our food needless to say it was just terrible. 5 of us no one had a nice thing to say. I will say the manager with kind and, most of the mail which we did not ask for. She encouraged us to try this again. We tried a few weeks ago oh, I'm sorry to say we have to pass.

Fantastic Experience! The staff was attentive, kind, friendly, knowledgeable and professional. Our waiter Andrew was top notch and the manager Kevin was welcoming and passionate about this Resturant! We were greeted with a friendly team and well taken care of. The sushi was AWESOME! Fresh and top shelf! WELL DONE to the entire staff!

Another Fantastic Meal and Experience!
Sat at the sushi bar and the chefs took amazing care of us.....presented us with some new indicative and delirious dishes! Beautifully prepared and served! OITSTANDING

If you want to eat at a sit down location and your in the area, this is an OK spot. I wouldn't drive here to eat here...food is OK, others are better in the area, however, the ambiance is probably better than most in the downtown summerlin.

I would eat here again only if I wanted a sit down spot and was shopping across the street

I work in the area and after work my friend said lets eat at crave. we did restaurant week.
we each had the pork dumplings. i also had the burger and he had the sushi box. 
2 hours later the food poisoning kicked in. I've been a restaurant manager before. so im understanding that things happen. I called to let them know what had happened that both my friend and I got very badly sick and we both had the dumplings. I was simply calling to alert them. i didn't want anything free. the host (like she has any training in this area) said "oh, food poisoning takes 24 hours to kick in." Even though that isn't true i didn't appreciate her fighting me when i was simply trying to help. 

She took down my name and number and said a manger would contact me to check in on me and how i was feeling. 

.......Well its a week later and no one called. 

I used to come here A LOT after work. NOT ANYMORE!

Came here with the mr. for an early week happy hour.  Our server was nice but our food was ready before our drinks.  We had the pork belly sliders, tuna roll, and philly roll.  The food was meh, who puts lettuce in a philly roll?  Good luck keeping customers when all of the resturaunts are open.

Been here a few times. I have to say the new Poke' bowls are awesome. I had the Mexican bowl. It had sharp lime soy glaze flavor and the tuna was bright red, fresh and tasted like it was just reeled in from the ocean.

TRY THE NEW POKE BOWLS. YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED. ; )
This is great food at a fair price in a fun part of town! They did a great job hosting our work party, too.

After having the worst experience at public house upstairs or school whatever it's called we choose this place out of default. But, I am so happy we did! We had a server named Maggie I think which every sweet and full of jokes. We loved her! Gave us recommendations to our foods and drinks. Explained I wanted a mojito but I can't have pineapple (which is what they have on their menu) and she said no problem, I'll substitute it with a splash or raspberry or regular mojito. She made my day. We had about 5-6 mojitos later... Lol we had to cancel our shopping and walk it off a little. The food was delish! Sliders, truffle fries and sushi was A1! Thanks so much for your wonderful service. It was a litttttttle pricey, but I suppose if you want good food with great service ya gotta pay for it. Lol

I tried this place for the first time for a work meeting and I really enjoyed it. The service was pretty much excellent, except toward the end, it slowed down a bit. They have a well rounded menu with lots of appetizer and small plates options. I ordered the beef sliders and a california roll. I was in an appetizer mood. They were both very good. One thing about the sliders was that it had a "juniper mayo" on them. Every now and then I would really taste the juniper and it would kind of throw me off. Just note that you should read the description before ordering because most of the items have an ingredient that sets it apart from it's similar entrees at other restaurants. 

I would definitely like to try this place again. They especially have good happy hour which is worth trying.
Our server ,Kayla, was an awesome bartender and always made sure we were great ! She was great, very attentive, and the reason we would ever come back! The food was amazing as well :)

Good food , great atmosphere and very attentive staff, overall a very pleasant experience.
Cheers
High quality, good food. However, the service is rather lacking and slow. Would come back again

3 letters... O.M.G.

Crave is a new restaurant inside Downtown Summerlin, and actually its the only restaurant open so far! Ive been here 3 days in a row now and every meal gets better then the last. 
The first time we dined here we were lucky enough to be invited for the Soft Opening. We got to try numerous items from their menu. I loved all of them and a few of my favorite items were:
Chicken Apple Sausage Flatbread- Caramelized red onion, balsamic glaze, manchego, roasted red peppers
Pork Belly Sliders- Kimchi, Korean BBQ sauce, cilantro
Jumbo Shrimp- Spice marinade, flash fried, tzatziki sauce
Lemon Garlic Wings- cucumber, bleu cheese dip
Lobster Linguine- Poached lobster, lightly truffled lemon butter sauce
Strauss® Free Raised® Grass Fed Burger- Foie gras butter, caramelized onions
Aloha Sushi Roll- spicy tuna, mango, cilantro, avocado, poké sauce

We also had an arrangement of cocktails, my favorite was the Candied Carrot Martini. It contained a few different vodkas with fresh pressed carrot juice. YUM!
Our server Jennifer was great, we could tell she was very busy but still provided great service. Probably the best server Ive ever had.

The second time we dined here it was the grand opening. There was a 2 hour wait at the door so we tried our luck at the bar. We grabbed a few seats (we got extremely lucky) and started out with a few wines. They have an amazing hour Pinot Grigio and Merlot. We had the Aloha Sushi roll (again) and the calamari. Andy LOVED the calamari. it had a crispy cornmeal crust and came with  jalapeño aioli for dipping. It was a great twist on the classic calamari dish. Although I didn't get any of the bartenders names we again had great service.

And the third time I dined here (this afternoon) Ceasar took great care of us. I came here with a gf and my mother, who has celiac disease. CRAVE has a huge Gluten Free menu! Ceasar even told us that they take celiac so serious that the chef who makes any gluten free item even changes their coat, gloves and apron to keep from cross contamination. We were so impressed by this. 
My gf and I started out with the Margarita Flatbread. So amazing!! Each piece had the perfect amount of fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomato. 
For entrees my mom had the lemon garlic wings, she loved them as much as I did. I had the  Roasted Chicken. It came with coconut jasmine rice, grilled pineapple relish, fried plantains and was glazed with a jalapeño orange glaze. This is probably my favorite item I've tried here. Its amazing. Jen had the Turkey Burger and she loved that as well. 
I had a blueberry Fizz to drink, it was pretty much a non-alcoholic blueberry mojito. 

This is probably my new favorite restaurant in the Summerlin area. We've dined here 3 times in 3 days, and enjoyed each experience. So happy to have a place like Crave right up the street!

My husband and I went to crave for the first time on a Friday night date. The restaurant was full at 6:30 but we had made a reservation so we got right in.  I decided to go to the sushi bar.  I should have known when not one person was at the sushi bar that something was up.  We ordered tuna and a spicy roll of some sort and  It just wasn't fresh or very tasty.  We were so disappointed.  Giving it one more chance, we ordered one order of salmon and another type of tuna sushi and both were just OK.  

On another note, the service was great from the server that brought our wine.  I will return to the restaurant for their regular menu as it does interest me but I will not return for sushi.  

Oh, one more thing, there was no soy sauce at the bar.  After asking for some low sodium, the server came and poured a way too generous amount in our dishes.  He sould know to let the customer do that, as we like to get a certain amount in the dish to get the consistency right with their wasabi.
