First time coming to Crave and I don't know why it's taken me this long to try this place. Cassandra was our server and she was so kind and recommended the best items. The food was fantastic! We ordered a mix of sushi and sliders and everything was delicious. We ordered the wings and calamari for appetizers. The sauce that came with the calamari was not the regular marinara sauce. It was better! Sushi was also great. I don't know why this restaurant doesn't have higher ratings because I have no complaints from our visit. Can't wait to be back!

I heard about this place at the Downtown Summerlin Farmer's Market several weeks ago when these girls under a tented area gave us samples & a flyer. The flyer said there was a "date night" for couples & it was $50. I told my boyfriend we should give it a try sometime.

Fast forward to this past weekend, Saturday night, I called to make sure they still have that dinner date deal & they said its on Friday & Saturday nights, perfect! 

We headed there and were greeted immediately upon arrival. We were seated at a booth and handed menus. We took a look at the date deal and were ready to order. The date deal consists of 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, & 2 mini desserts PLUS a bottle of wine (21+ for the wine though). That was such a good deal! 

We ordered our food and took in our surroundings. Dim lighting, nice ambiance, with a bit of an elegant feel to it. All of the staff that helped us that night were friendly & didn't rush us with the check, which I liked a lot.

Our food was DELICIOUS! We we definitely be coming back again soon!

What can I say about CRAVE?  I can't say that I'll CRAVE it anytime soon.  To me, this will be a go to spot if it were the last option ever.  I was told by family that this was a good place to eat.

The hostess was friendly and sat us a few minutes upon arrival.   Then greeted by our waiter a few min later.  He asked us if we had any questions on the menu and my friend asked about their rice bowls, and he had to go ask someone about the ingredients, one time was okay, but 2nd time he had to go ask, it just felt like he don't know the menu all too well.  Or am I just being too critical?  Okay, let's skip that....

According to the waiter, we came on a "slow" night.  So, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but our food came out FAST!  It didn't even feel like ten minutes before it even came out.  I ordered the Chicken Caprese Pasta.  Flavoring was great in the pasta as well as the flavor in the chicken, but what was bad about all this was the temperature of the pasta.  It was in between cold and luke warm.  How is that possible... it just is.  Some bites that I took was just cold.  The chicken was cooked in a bread crumb/tempura batter and honestly the presentation of the chicken looked burned.  It was a dark brown color, and I was expecting it to be a golden brown color.  My friend order the Thai Curry Shrimp bowl.  It came with three jumbo shrimps.  For the cost of $16 dollars, you would think you'd get a little bit more shrimp.  So if we broke it down, it was around $5 something per shrimp with a side of rice and curry sauce.  Yep, that sums that up.  I honestly would have been better off at an Olive Garden.  At least they served bread with my meal.  

The server that we had, we'd be in the middle of a conversation and he'd reach over and fill our cups with water and MY CUP WAS STILL FULL!!! He did that several times!  Which started to bug me because my cup didn't need any water.  When we were finished eating, we were still talking and when my water was actually empty, he NEVER came back once to fill it up or offered to fill it up!!! WTH!!!! The whole time I DIDN'T need water he was trying to fill my cup and when I NEEDED water, he didn't even bother filling it.  

If you do try this place, I truly hope you all have a better experience than I did.  With that being said... Happy Eating!

A lot of mixed reviews , but me and my husband loved it! First time here , got a coupon 1 entree 2 one free. And it was worth it! Everything was excellent , seated very nicly, waiter was super friendly! Should get a raise ! Very patient , explained everything so clearly, the best way to use the coupon . And which is the best meal of all to the least hahah , very truthful! Had the scallops and husband had steak (forgot the name but was $31)by our waiter recommend and it was amazing !!!! Loved it ! Steak was juicy and soft , scallops with nice flavors. And the waiter was awesome and nice ! Very cool place !  Overall excellent place! :)

I have been to this restaurant twice and enjoyed the food and service both times. I had the same hostess both times I ate there and she was very courteous and respectful. For my first dining experience I had Channelle as my waitress. She was awesome! My drinks never got empty and she knew the menu quiet well. I'm not a sushi fan but she recommened I try it. I ventured out and tried the King Kong sushi and loved it! The pineapple baked chicken was a little dry but it  was very flavorful. However, the water was stale and gritty. I think a high end water filtration system might improve the taste.

My second trip I tried the guacamole and apple sausage flatbread. Both dishes were very good. I also had the bread basket. Although it was only $3 it would have been better if it was free. The pan bread and crispy flatbread were delicious with the homemade garlic butter. However, I was not a fan of the baked bread. I had Michael as my server this time and he was on point! He never let my drink get empty and put the order in so I didn't receive the appetizer with my meal. (I appreciate that).  

All in all this restaurant  has very flavorful food that is not too filling and serves much healthier food than many of the other  places in Vegas. I will continue to go here.
Sushi was ok.... Very fishy taste for some reason.....Serivce however was great.... The drinks served were horrible.... Probably would not recommend..... Next ...

The place was not even half full and it took almost 15 minutes to get a drink from the bar.  Service was very poor in general.  I had the lamb meat balls for twenty some dollars and was less than impressed.  There were only a few and were only an inch or so in diameter. Others had the bison burger which was ok,  but it is hard to mess up a burger. With all the great dinning options in town I doubt I will go back and will not be recommending this place to anyone.  Oh and their largest beers are small and over priced as well.

Giving three stars because the service was fantastic. Otherwise would be a two. Michael was our server. He was honest and had a sense of humor which can be an issue in these parts. 
Ordered the jambalaya. Was forewarned there were better items on the menu, but that's why I we stopped in after viewing menu outside. It was more like a salty tomato base with sausage and shrimp and minimal seasoning, lacking in flavor. Dish came out lukewarm with indications of having had a visit in the microwave from the uneven heat around the plate. Fish tacos were good. Coconut jasmine rice good too. Neither out of this world. Average. Had a ginger vodka drink which was decent.

I'd perhaps return for drinks and apps but the menu has an identity crisis and still manages to have nothing that stands out. Basic Americana fare with a sushi kitchen. Not an original idea, but catchy perhaps to some. Will try the other places in Dtwn Summerlin before heading back.

The service is great, everything from the water being refilled to the taste of the fresh fish, exceptional service from walking in all the way to walking out. Our server was named Craig and he really went above and beyond to make sure we were happy!

We found ourselves in this Downtown Summerlin Mall (because we were staying right next door at the Red Rock Resort) and just picked this place at random. Walking in, I noticed how clean and well-decorated the place was. Very clean lines and appealing.

We sat down and I put my service dog under our table. My girl had the grilled cheese sandwich and I had the chicken & avocado salad with an order of Unagi (sushi). The grilled cheese comes on a rectangular dish with six triangular wedges and a cup of tomato-based soup for dipping. Really tasty. My eel sushi was baked to perfection and quite tasty. My salad was so fresh and delicious. It was SO refreshing in this utterly ridiculous heat and humidity. 

Our server was attentive and friendly. I really have no complaints. The food was unique and quite fresh. I would definitely eat here again.

Our server was Jordan tonight he was AMAZING and was on top of everything. This is our first time here and he checking up on us so often. Food was delicious. Jordan recommended the 702 burger and it was to die for. 
Overall, this visit was worth it. And if you come here ask for JORDAN

This midwest chain recently opened in the new Downtown Summerlin complex. It claims to be chef driven -- and maybe it is -- but the quality and execution is on par with similar chain restaurants. The duck confit flatbread ($15.95) was one of the more interesting sounding dishes, but there wasn't enough duck to balance out the sweetness of all the fig marmalade. The lemon garlic wings ($13.95) were huge, but the heavy lemon flavor made them unappealing. The Crave burger ($13.95) wasn't bad. It's a simple burger made up of an angus patty, smoked cheddar, lettuce, tomato, onion and their signature burger sauce. The undercooked and under seasoned patty were the only thing holding it back from being a decent burger. Desserts fared much better. Although for someone with a sweet tooth like mine it's tough to screw up chocolate cake ($7.95) -- five layers of dense, moist, sweet chocolate cake. It was, however, lacking a sufficient amount of the orange creme anglaise mentioned on the menu. The S'mores brownie ($7.95) had some enticing elements like the chewy brownie and the marshmallow ice cream, but the amount of torched marshmallow topping the brownie was overload.

With so many other places in town to try, I'm not sure I'll return. Sure, they have a large menu, which also includes sushi but the combination of that and American food in the same restaurant is an even bigger deterrent to my return.

2.5 Stars

Great place to come for the variety of foods! This place is a good place to come for large groups because everyone can have what they want. I had the raspberry lemonade cocktail and it was great, not a bad drink menu Crave! The filet with crab meat on top was awesome,  I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys a light surf n turf with a cream sauce.

Decided to give this place a try.  Place was esthetically great, but to bad the food did not look or taste as good!  Very disappointed with the selections had.  Started with a blueberry lemonade which was good, but not the best I ever had. It was more of a mojito and I'm never one to hate in a good drink.  Moving on to the Crab-cakes with jalapeño sauce. They were a bit on the sweet side and the jalapeño was very, very lacking.  The salad with baby greens and tomatoes was good.  Then we ordered the pork belly sliders.  Huge disappoint and maybe I'm just spoiled ( I blame a certain somebody for that) but none the less pork belly was a little to chewy for my taste and the garnish in it has a refrigerator taste.   The Kobe beef tacos were actually one of the better items. If you order this is probably a must just ask for garnish in side as it made the tacos soggy, but the meat was cooked well and very tasty.   And last but not least the Mac and cheese with sausage was good.......yes, here it comes it lacked salt or some sort of a step up to make good and something worth recommending .  The sad part is after i posted I was here then I got comments that this was not the place to eat. To say the least I feel like I spent money for something I didn't enjoy.   Our server was nice and accommodating and that is the reason they get two stars.  This place seems to have potential , but food needs a bit of a rework and the presentation needs to be part of that stepping it up!!

My birthday lunch with friends couldn't be more perfect. Every item ordered was raved about by all. My crabmeat eggs Benedict, Hollandase sauce on the side, was Devine. Thanks to Richard, our Server, we had endless Mimosas and discounts as well. The Manager brought out my birthday cake, making it a perfect celebration. Thank you Richard and CRAVE! Can't wait to return.

We weren't impressed... Definitely not chef quality!!! The calamari was either old, overlooked or both. The lamb meatball/fettuccine dish was heavy, with the pasta all stuck together, plus over spiced.  The salad and desert were very good if that's any consolation.. Ambiance was nice and service was superb, friendly and accommodating. The wait wasn't long, now we know why?

We give it 2 stars, but we will try again. Always give a place a second chance to redeem itself, one can only hope.  For the money we would have expected a lot better...:( :(

I have never had such poor service when sitting at the bar.  I had to ask three times for a glass of water; once when I ordered my drink, once when the bartender gave me my drink, and finally to who appeared to be the assistant bartender.  I even had to sit and wait, with empty plate and glasses in front of me, and finally ask for my check even though I had told the bartender I was done when he asked if I wanted another drink after I finished my food.  Besides those times I, along with the other three ladies at the bar, was mostly ignored.

The kicker is they weren't all that busy with it being past the lunch rush and before dinner.  Hell, while I was sitting there waiting with my wallet in front of me the assistant went and started to chop lemons instead of asking if I needed anything. The food and drink were good which is why they get two stars and why I'll probably give them a second chance sometime.  But it won't be soon.

I stopped in for a Sunday dinner with a friend a couple of weeks ago. I am trying not to eat a lot of carbs so I ordered a salmon dish with vegetables and it was really good. They've got Michelob Ultra on tap and great happy hour specials. 

My one complaint was the hostess stand. We waited for about 5 minutes for someone to acknowledge us and get us seated and when she did she did not comment on the lengthy delay. If this had not happened I would have given them four stars.

I would definitely go back for the cocktail menu alone. Some of them looked amazing. Very creative. It's a casual place with TVs in the bar area, but it's nice. I think that it would be a good place to meet for a drink or a full meal.

1) Front desk girls are TERRIBLE! 40 min wait at lunch with tables open. 

2) The servers are COMPLETELY CLUELESS! 

3) The managers look LOST! 

4) The bar is a constant mess and totally unorganized! 

5) The food is better at Olive Garden! 

DONT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!!! 

I promise you will regret it!!! 

They will be out of business by this time next year!



LOL....I received a "compliment badge" by someone from CRAVE and they tried to get rude because I left a negative review!!! Lmao!!! How about you educate your staff, instead of arguing with your customers! You asked me if, "I knew how to run a restaurant" in your rant....I'm a JWU graduate...and I clearly know more than you! I had one of the worst dining experience in your establishment! You can look at my record here on YELP...I rarely complain! So please stop harassing customers Shawn and focus your time on improving your Yelp rating! 

Thanks  lol

The setting is nice, waitress, Erica, was really nice. We ordered the sweet peach tea, wasn't impressed. The crab artichoke dip was ok. The roasted chicken breast was very dry and flavorless, I couldn't even finish it. The mahi mahi was flavorless and was not finished. Will never go back or recommend. Worst place I have eaten at in a long time. Wasted $70.

Walking around Downtown Summerlin we decided to have some lunch. So many good options in the area we decided to try Crave after looking out their menu.

A place that is bigger on the inside than it appears from outside, we were seated right away at a table just off of the bar. Our server who was also the bartender was very attentive to our needs and others in the area, she worked the area very well.

I had the Caprese flatbread and the calamari. The calamari was nice and not over battered and accompanied by a jalapeno aioli that was perfectly spiced, not overbearing. The flatbread was thin, crispy with original caprese ingredients with some avocado as a bonus.

Very pretty environment. Food is secondary to a cool vibe of a restaurant in downtown Summerlin. It does try to do too many things, and be all things to all people. It would go up in stars with a bit more focus. It is hard to be an "American kitchen" and a "sushi bar," too. It's as if you started a "Soul Food" restaurant that also did Chinese food. Not impossible. But you would not be surprised if it were a bit...odd. As this place is. But if you end up here, or find yourself here, you will not be unhappy if you keep a perspective. Also, the buffet is not bad at all. I came to their buffet with my mother and mother-in-law (as it was too late to get reservations anywhere because we did so spontaneously) and we had a BALL!

Damn....What can I say. Bad service. (45 mins) for a drink. No acknowledgement. Yea not good. We gave this place a 3rd shot....As they say. 1, 2, 3 Strikes your OUT!! Never again. Sorry not sorry. Shake Shack it is!!

I've wanted to try this place for quite sometime. However, with poor Yelp reviews and a discouraging word from my parents that it wasn't good and over priced I had mixed feelings. When a meetup group scheduled a lunch here I thought I'd give it a try before planning to go with my husband and having a bigger tab.  Meh, nothing special about their Sushi Lunch Combo and service was poor. For 13.95 it came with miso soup, a skimpy spicy salmon roll and 5 nigiri. We were a group of 9 in the corner and server never came around to refill beverages and the restaurant had barely any guests. My glass of water was low and I slurped the remains of melting ice when we left. Sometimes with larger groups I wonder if servers feel more relaxed about providing excellent service because they know there is a high likelihood the total tip is going to be pretty good. I am usually a very generous tipper (18-25%) but not today. No one at our table raved about their selection. If you want sushi, this isn't the place to get your "fix"!

Went to Crave for dinner. Nice gluten free menu. Also free kids meal with an adult meal. Very nice option. My mean was wonderful and my son had chicken fingers. He said they were not good. Maybe the free is the reason. Otherwise would have been a 5 star. I'd rather pay for his meal and Amy e reduce main entree slightly in cost and get better quality kids food. My son is not picky. 

Service was wonderful and the environment is wonderful.

Located in downtown summerlin catering to both American cuisine and sushi lovers alike is Crave. We had a wonderful dinner here on Friday night. The service was good despite some minor things like not cleaning up our plates before our entrees so we just pushed our appetizers and dishes over to the other side of the table where they say for the rest of the meal. The food was delicious and filled a sushi craving. 

Mom Rating 4/5 
It's a spacious enough so I didn't feel like I was a burden with my infant and stroller in tow. The tables were far apart enough that he was able to take a nap without nearby tables waking him up. We would come here again for sure.
If you know ANYTHING about food, don't eat here. The food is mediocre at best. Service is great though.

Great addition to the neighborhood. Good service. Interiors are a dressed up yard house vibe. Mahi mahi and the chicken were fantastic. Bision burger and the sirloin sliders are some of the best around.

They have a good selection for lunch during the weekday. However, their service was just okay. They weren't busy since it was lunch on a Wednesday, but our server took a while to complete our order (he had to go back & forth to the kitchen to clarify a few things regarding the menu).

He might've been new, but my coworkers & I needed our order ASAP since we were there during our lunch break.

Despite this, I ordered the Crave Sliders & they were pretty good. The burger was juicy & buns were similar to a sweet Hawaiian roll. They were quite stingy on the fries though, but they were good. $12.95 for 3 sliders & fries.

Not sure if I'd go here again by choice, but, I'll try to give it another shot.
Drinks and appetizers were great, but the Mac and Cheese with Andouille Sausage was horrible, no flavor or cheese taste. But will try again but something else.

Went here for dinner with friends and family visiting from out of town. The food was good. Our service was just okay though; didn't spill one drink, but two drinks at different times, and we never received any refills on water.

We really like this place!  The truffle parmesan fries, delicious, the Korean chicken bites, delicious, the pulled pork nachos, yesssss.  The server was excellent and quick.  The cocktails were very good.  The ambiance is nice, inside and outside seating, large spacious place.  None of us eat sushi, so have no idea how that is, but the cooked food was awesome.  We are definitely coming back here.

Wait staff was really nice, but the whole place was really disorganized. We were brought to our table which already had people seated at it, then, it was right by the kitchen which was very crowded and the wait staff was clearly didn't know the layout of the restaurant yet. The beer they brought me was warm from the tap and the food I ordered was way too spicy and the lamb meatballs were overly dry. It will be a long time before I go back.

Totally Average the waiter was really slow and our waters weren't getting filled up. The waiter said that the water person was all over the place. I order a salad and I found a hair. No one even came to a apologize not even a manager no one. If you are reading this that works here please get your act together. Everything was really ok. The only thing that was the best was the blueberry cheesecake. I would totally suggest that. I would totally not come back only for the desert.

we had reservations sunday night showed up and no one waited on us or even acknowledged us. 

we had never tried this place even though we live across the street. we had only heard so so things from friends and after we waited for five minutes we walked out. 

the place was empty and not one person acknowledged our presence. 

what a joke and there was one person who walked out ahead of us obviously with the same issue. 

well now we know never to go back. don't bother going to this place it's a chain and obviously they just don't care. first time we have had to walk out of a restaurant in down town summerlin. 

not one person bothered to even acknowledge our presence. management has a real problem here. 

this is not even a one star rating i had to give something to continue. it's a zero!


updated review 

we went back to try crave after being contacted by someone after previous review. we were met amd sat right away by a very pleasant hostess. place was packed and waitress came right over and took drink orders. 

we had the chicken wings which have to say were excellent some of the best i have ever had. also tried the tuna tataki as i was intrigued that they had so much sushi on their menu. it was good fish was fresh and the sauce was different from what ive had in the past butnit was good. we both had the mac and cheese and it was excellent as well. 

throughout service was good waitress was very friendly and did a good job and managers were active and walking table to table. 

our experience was very good and by reading reviews it would seem maybe some managers are better than others that is the only explanation i can figure for the wide discrepancies in reviews. 

im going back for the wings they were that good! 

i really appreciate the quick response from the restaurant after my first review and their attempt to fix the problems. that was impressive and shows that they do care about their business.

We were here on Saturday night, it was fairly busy but the wait wasn't long and the hostess was very nice (they even opened the door for us). I had the mustard salmon and my husband had sushi both were amazing! The wine selection was also good. The only complaint is it was kind of chilly in the restaurant.,other than that the food and service was excellent.

We went here during the week for lunch and it was great. 

Despite having a bit of a wait to be seated, even with a restaurant full of empty tables, the food was exceptional (we ordered a variety of sushi rolls) and this has by far become my favorite spot for mid-day sushi.

Great service and great food. Had the tiniest issue with a cold dish and the staff fell over themselves to resolve it. The manager and the server were extremely attentive. Great great service I would recommend any day of the week.

The food was hit and miss the last time I ventured here.  The service was terrible and the reception was as bad as it can get.  3 minimum wage females with attitude.   I was at a movie and thought I would give it another try.   Hostesses are clueless. ..  the only reason they are busy is the other sit down dining are not open yet.  I walked out as they just don't know how to treat a customer.  No hello, no I will be with you in just a moment,  nothing but attitude.   They were too busy with their chit chat than doing their job.

I predict closure if they don't fix the lack of service as MTO,  California Pizza, Wolfgang Puck and Grape Street will pull 90% of their current business.    

Owner and Management,  make changes before you loose your investment.
The all day Sunday happy hour is awesome! The lemon garlic wings are finger licking good! The Bartender's, Kayla, friendliness and smile truly made my visit!

Earlier this week, I was taken to this place with a friend while visiting over the Thanksgiving holiday. The food was good, and I wanted to see if they could handle GF since my wife has celiac disease and since the food was good I thought it might be something she could enjoy. Talked with our waitress and she advised that it wouldn't be a problem, great.

Tonight my wife and her friend, were out Christmas shopping, and they decided that they would meet us there. By the time we arrived, my wife and her friend were already seated, and the look on my wife's face wasn't pleasant. She advised that not only wouldn't they be able to serve her a specialty burger on a GF bun, but that even the fries are all cooked in the same oil.  The waitress seemed to do everything possible to talk us out of eating there, she didn't want to be bothered.

So, coupled with the fact that she couldn't enjoy a burger ON a GF bun, they would be having difficulty in handling a dairy allergy. Instead of fries, my wife optioned for the cole slaw, only to be advised that their cole slaw contained dairy as well, meaning that their mayo used to make the cole slaw contained dairy.

I'm not a chef, but I am an experienced cook and in all my 63 years have I never heard of any dairy product used to make cole slaw. I have heard of buttermilk, but that is a rarity. When initially made, the cole slaw is thick, but within a few hours it loosens up.

So if you have celiac disease or dairy allergies, avoid this place like the plague!
Unfortunately can't speak too much to the food. We waited awhile after being seated. Lots of waiters and no service.

Was taken here by my family for Mother's Day. I was hesitant, because I thought it was going to be geared more for sushi lovers, but my husband assured me it wasn't. We get there, and after our bizarre waitress swings by to state "I 'll be back", we review the menus only for me to see that I was right. They have food that isn't sushi, but I don't eat fish or hot, spicy food so that narrowed the choices down a lot. I went with the stir fry that came out cold. I'm not talking warm, it was cold like someone had put it in the refrigerator to cool it off. I was absolutely done at that point. I just wanted the check. We had already discussed where we should've gone. The next evening we DID and had good food, good service, and a great time, so we were able to salvage Mother's Day!

Great service , excellent food and always open tables .
Would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting downtown summerlin
Love this place!! Awesome food, great outdoor seating, service is good. Many different food options...

Always slow service. Waited about 20 minutes to take our drink order. Not even an apology, I asked for a manager and was told one was not available. Since it's a holiday they don't honor specials, but their signs out front say EVERY Sunday. Food is okay, not worth the price.

No Bueno! The food is super expensive and not eatable, the service is mediocre.

Came to Downtown Summerlin to check out what everyone is raving about and decided to eat here because this is the only restaurant without a giant wait and on a friday night it was rather empty. Should have known that there's a reason for that! 

I ordered the salmon Spinach salad was no good. The fish was cooked rare, just the way I like it, but the the spinach was drenched in a pool of salad dressing and soggy. It was a puddle of green mud, and the dressing was sticky and too sugary. Also ordered 4 of the Kogi tacos and they were ok in flavor but Kogi beef is suppose to be big pieces of beef marinated with Korean BBQ sauce, not a puddle of shredded dry beef strings. 

Service was ok, bathrooms clean, parking was not easy.

This would have been a 4 star but we had some service issues. We ordered salads to start, after appetizers, a few drinks then our meal came, I asked about our salads. Said she never put them in...hmmm, kinda of a drag. Was looking forward to a salad. At least she was honest. Also our steaks came with a different veggie than advertised. When asked, she said she didn't know why and brought us the correct veggie (which was cauliflower and was utterly tasteless), so we were glad it came with asparagus instead. The steak medallions were good, as were the roasted new potatoes. That saved the meal, otherwise would've been totally disappointing. To start we had the fried calamari which was actually really good, so that was a plus as well.

CRAVE... I tried to enjoy this place...
We came in to Crave to kill some time before our movie.
This review has nothing to do with wait time...lucky for us there were two seats open  at their bar. The restaurant has a nice vibe...very comfortable. 

Ordered the Kogi beef tacos...
The food runner came out with the tacos and another entree looking a bit lost as to where to deliver it to. After realizing that it was our order, I told him we never ordered the second item so he hands it to the bartender who then passes it around the bar asking if it belongs to anyone. It ended up sitting behind the bar for the rest of the time that we were there. 
Very unorganized system they have going on...

The Kogi beef tacos itself was very bad. I took one bite and passed it off to my friend who eats anything and everything but even admitted that it was pretty terrible. The meat tasted as if it was marinated in butter rather than cooked with it. The bite left a very unpleasant greasy film like taste in my mouth. 
I will not be coming back to try anything else on their food menu.

When I walked in thought it was going to be a bit better then I thought. Service was excellent! But the menu was kinda busy too much fusion food for my particular taste on the menu, kinda got turned away from some of the food on the menu. The menu prices to me were kinda pricey for the type of food. I wouldn't come back too quickly, there is better food in downtown summerlin then this place

UPDATE: I finally got a chance to try Crave again a few weeks ago for their dinner service thanks to Melissa T. My experience was so much better the second time around! The food was good & the service was excellent. I changed my star review to reflect my second visit; I'm glad I gave them a second chance!


****
We came here on Sunday (5/21) for their all day happy hour only to be told they didn't do that any more. Maybe their menus on the website should be updated then. 

We should have taken that as a sign to leave but we stayed. 

My friend ordered the Crunchy roll & I got the Shrimp & Crab Cake Benedict & we both ordered Bottomless Mimosas. My meal was just ok; I'm not sure how you can replace the english muffin with tomato slices & still call it a benedict but it's whatever. My friend's sushi order was completely wrong; there was no avocado or spicy mayo in it as advertised & it looked like they had added sprouts to it. When my friend told the server she thought the order was wrong, the server tried to argue with her! After consulting the menu, the server took the food back & brought back the right order. We got no apology. We each had two mimosas before we were told they were out of orange juice. It was only a little after 1:45 pm by this time. We also received no refills on our water. 

This experience left a lot to be desired; with so many other, better choices, I won't be coming back.

The chicken lettuce wraps were delicious. But what was really impressive is the service we got at the bar. Donnie was all smiles all evening, so was the other lovely blonde lady who was working at the bar. It had been years since I had seen so much good energy and happiness and awesome customer service in action. It made my night. Thank you guys!
The worst food I've ever tried. Very bad experience. I won't go back. The waiter was great by the way.

Came here for happy hour for the first time, really nice ambience inside and calm vibe for the day. I tried out a the Angus Beef sliders, Truffle parmesan fries, Shrimp tempura roll and the Prosciutto & Fig flatbread. 

The food was good but not amazing, the flatbread and the sushi seemed a bit too dry for my tasting. We asked for a side of spicy mayo to add to the sushi and that was a great fix, tasted much better. I think for the flatbread it could've used some olive oil or some sauce for it. The truffle fries could've used more truffle and parmesan but the portion of it was really large and ended up finishing the whole thing anyway. 

Not sure if I would come out of my way to eat here again, perhaps for some cocktails!
Also thanks to Tasha for the great service!

Had a great experience today at their Mother's Day brunch. Service and food was great, all staff was welcoming, and they even went the extra mile and gave roses out to all the moms. Nice touch! First time at Crave, but will not be the last. Will definitely be back again soon.

To be honest, I was looking forward to trying this place out when it first opened. However, I decided to hold off after reading reviews from fellow Yelpers. Then last month for some odd reason my parents recieved a good amount of gift cards from family and friends. 

The family and I decided to try this place out. Upon arrival we were greeted by the hostess and was seated immediately. Water glasses were provided and drinks were serve accordingly. The highlight of our visit was our amazing server, Chyna. Overall, she made our visit a pleasant and memorable one. Everything she reccomended was spot on. A few of the items we enjoyed were the loaded Nachos. This was really consistent with flavor and had an even amount of toppings with the chips. The stellar item was the Lemon Garlic Chicken Wings. Flavor was delicious and wasn't dried out. I would come back for this particular item. We got a few Sushi rolls and they were meh. Nothing to spectacular just average with a nice presentation. Actually presentation is what set this place apart. 

This easily would've been a 3 star rating for me but our server really made a big difference. I would personally come back for half of the Menu and wouldn't come for any of their Asian offering. However, it is a good option when dinning with a group needing a variety of dishes. 

2017 Yelp Review #23

Went for lunch with my girlfriends today...we all thought it was AMAZING!!  From the crab artichoke dip all the way to the end!  Betty took great care of us and suggested the angry dragon for our cocktail.  Talk about hitting the nail on the head!!  It was perfect with our meals.  I had the grilled chicken salad which was presented very well along with everything else we had.  Ended the meal with the individual salty caramel mousse.  YUM!!!  The only thing that made the meal from being perfect is that the website says happy hour is on Saturday from 11 to 5.  We were informed by the hostess that they weren't doing it for opening weekend!!  Bummer!!  We'll still be back!!!  Go quick!!!

Awful food. We had a party of seven and no one liked what they ordered. The spicy sushi rolls were bland. The beet garnish on the kale and beet salad had a black spot through every slice and the dressing was much too sweet. The pizza was served on a tortilla. The grilled cheese sandwich was without cheese. I do not recommend this restaurant and will not return.

Went for lunch. Had loaded nachos appetizer & the crispy chicken sliders. Nachos were pretty big. The description said pulled pork so I had to try! They were pretty good. But honestly, very little pork & could have used more if the nacho topping goodies on it. My friend loves the sliders so she really wanted to share them. Unfortunately, they were a bit dry. The Siracha sauce was sparse & not one one of three at all. Real bummer! The chicken itself was good, but I wouldn't order again. Lunch pricing was also too high. I was told the happy hour is a great deal & variety. I'll give it another try for that.

This place was such a bad first time experience that I just HAD to write my first review!!! 

First off when you walk in there's a wait just to put your name on the list. They put your first and last name in the system then give you a waiting pager. They seemed so unorganized like they didn't know what they were doing. The wait was an hour long so we decided to walk around downtown summerlin and check it out.. About 40 minutes passed by so we checked to see how much longer. They said about 4 more people were in front of us still so we waited some more.... About 15 more minutes passes by so we check how much longer again and she said 2 more people were still ahead of us but since we were in there she'll just seat us. I don't know if that was a good or bad thing because if she let us cut in front of people imagine how many people she let cut in front of us?! 

So now that we're seated let me say... She gave my boyfriend and I the WORST table. It was so tiny right in between the bar and the bigger tables. We were so close to the family sitting on the side of us. The space was so tight the servers were having a hard time squeezing through to drop off and pick up food. 

Now for drinks I ordered a white sangria. Our server bragged about how delicious and popular that drink was and how I'm gonna love it...... Then he comes back and says they're all out!!! Really?! Got my hopes up! So I went with the blueberry lemonade.. It was good-- super minty from the mint leaves. My boyfriend just got a Stella.. Nothing to mess up there. 

As for food.. The menu was on the pricier side. Their pastas ranged from 20-30$... 18$ for some Mac n cheese!!! They have a sushi side of the menu too but I didn't order any sushi. My boyfriend got the crave burger and the fries tasted over-cooked. The food was just okay. 

Mainly went to check out the new mall and decided we'll stop by and eat there and it was just bad. They are the only restaurant open right now so I understand that's why they were so busy but they just seemed  so unorganized. Probably will give them another shot again like later later once they figure themselves out.

A bit overpriced, but for being part of the new downtown summerlin, I can see how they want to cater for a certain crowd.

Came here for an office lunch, we made reservations for 10. Even though we had a reservation and made it on time, we still had to wait 20mins. Not too bad, but you would think they have the table ready for a reservation beforehand. 

The sushi was OK, I had better. I feel it was somewhat plain with the menu only showing the 'standard' specials. Like spicy crunch tuna...etc. nothing too fancy that can be seen as signature. 

As for the entrees, we had a bunch of sandwiches, standard BLT, burgers, etc. the the Kobe burger was the most fancy one. I personally had the sautéed Norwegian salmon. The fish was tender, flavorful, but not dry. The sauce was creamy and perfectly paired with the veggies and fish. I recommend this 100%. For this fish alone, I would come back, my husband likes classic burgers so he is good with that.

The ambiance is nice, very modern, suiting the overall setting of the mall. Only visited during lunch, so we'll see how dinner will be. Perhaps I'll update the review when we have done so with my dinner experience.

Staff was friendly, didn't know the specials, again, went here opening week, so I'm sure everything was new.

Went there to check out happy hour with some friends.. Drinks were good with $4 beers and their ginger beer drink for $7 was tasty. Customer service was great but the rating is based on the food.. Or lack of. The crispy chicken that was $6 looked like someone already ate half of it and it was like a sliver of chicken with bunch of breading.. The sliders came out and there were only 2 and light ingredients. Sushi was also ok, Philadelphia was quite fishy.. Used to salmon having a more buttery taste. We tried out this place during their grand opening but it was a madhouse so don't want to rate on that day. Only reason I would come back is because of their awesome patio seating and to have a few beers.. Other than that, not too crazy about it.

The food in this restaurant sucks had the sushi roll that was bland. Also had some cooked fish dish was was ok at best. The burger was cooked incorrectly and I had to return it. This place is nicely decorated. It was real noisy when we were there. The menu has too many food options they should concentrate on one type and keep the menu simple! $80.00 for  two people dinner and left disappointed!!! I'll take my money elsewhere next time!!!

Definitely won't be back to this place!
Good Food, Great Service,  FRESH seafood, great Mac n cheese

We wanted to check out the new Downtown Sunmerlin with a very hungry appetite for much-needed food. We were told the wait at Crave was a 25 minute wait for a table. We put our names down. Granted, Crave was the only sit-down food place open. We waited 30 minutes and went back 2x thinking they forgot about us. Now, it was creeping up to an hour. We waited inside next to the over occupied hostess stations. There were a lot of tables open but, clearly not enough wait staff. After we complained again about our wait time, we FINALLY got seated. By now, it was well over the hour mark. Our waiter was prompt but then dropped a BOMB on us by telling us that the kitchen is backed up and that it will take 45 minutes to AN HOUR to get food!!!!!!! 40 minutes for appetizers!!!! We have literally never stormed out of a restaurant! You would think the 5-6 hostesses they had huddled around the one hostess stand would've warned customers about the kitchen wait time on top of making people wait for their tables!!! So, even if you had a reservation, you would've had to have waited a least an hour for your food, and this includes their sushi menu!!!! Unbelievable. Note to this establishment--make sure to either have enough employees to cater to the influx of curious people coming to check out the grand opening or, don't serve people at all, especially if you make them wait from lunch to dinner time! Unfortunately, I didn't get the chance to sample the food so, I can't comment on the menu items.

This place is pass you don't need to try. 

The waitress was odd with little knowledge of the menu & was actively eating while she took our order. 

The queso looked and tasted like water. Fish tacos were bland. The worst of the worst was the Negihama Roll, it was rancid ... like rotten fish from a can that I wouldn't serve a cat.

2 stars instead of 1 because the sliders were decent.

Simply not worth the excessive time or the calories. Despite three separate reassurances from our waitress and two managers that a computer glitch was the issue, it took 2 hours for three people to receive some bland sushi (that was not what was ordered - and the spicy tuna roll contained lettuce?!) and the salmon plate. Chopsticks took another 10 minutes.  Each dish finally arrived - in separate 15 minute blocks - and was unremarkable, however, they comped the meal.

Crave is great. We went for dinner early before a movie, so we were one of only a few tables.  Our server was a delight, made great recommendations, and checked in often. All the food was delicious, and I was especially excited about the veggie sushi platter, which was really impressive. Portions are good and not overwhelming.  It is a little on the pricey side, but there are many reasonable options. We'll definitely go back.

We decided to do a late dinner last night.  I had been wanting to come here since it opened and they offer reverse happy hour which is a plus.   For our food my husband ordered the Crave burger with fries.  I ordered the baked mac and cheese with grilled chicken added to it.  We also ordered appetizers.  Now initially our service started out great.  Our server checked on us and brought us the apps in a timely manner.  When he brought our food, mine came out and, my husband only received his burger.  Our server told him that he asked the kitchen to make a fresh batch of fries and that it will be out shortly.  That was great, but why wasn't this done when the order was taken initially?  Ten minutes or so goes by and our server comes back saying he was off, but another server was taking his place.   He introduced her and they both left.  Five minutes or so passed and when our new server comes by she looks at my husband and says, "Sir, can I get you anything?". I think to myself, I'm100% sure she see's me here with him, so why not address us both?  My husband mentions his fries never came out so she goes to get them and by now I'm just annoyed that she didn't address us both, nor did she look at me.  I don't know what her deal was, but honestly I was looking forward to going back with friends for happy hour.  Now, not so much. 

Besides the lack of good customer service, the food for okay.  Again, I don't know if we'll go back for a second try or not.  It's a shame too, I thought this would be a good hang out for us aside from Public School.

Crave just makes it to three stars by the grace of a person who walked by and gave me a $10 gift card as he and his party were leaving.  Otherwise, it would be two stars.

I made a reservation for 7:30 and arrived on time.  I accidentally came in the back door via the patio and was shown to the hostess podium by a nice woman hereafter referred to as NW.  After checking in at the podium, and asking to be seated on the patio, NW took me outside and said that all the booths were filled but I could have any table.  I chose a table that was set for only two people to minimize removing place settings.  NW left menus with me and said that my server would be with me shortly.

The server brought the menus and took my drink order.  He seemed a bit overwhelmed with the number of tables he was covering but he eventually came back with my iced tea and took my order.  I asked his advice on the entrée and I took it.

Quite some time went by and NW had come by and said, "Didn't *server* get here yet.  I told NW that he had taken my order.  After another wait, the server came out with two drinks for another table and my cup of tomato soup.  He first stopped to give the drinks to that table and before he got to me, NW said, "Didn't he bring your soup?  I thought I saw him with it."  I told her it was on his tray and she was happy.

I had just started my soup when NW came out with my entrée.  She apologized for how soon things were appearing.  I was very close to telling her to take it back, but I thought it would sit under a heat lamp and then be brought back out.  I made a split second decision to let her leave the dish with me.

The tomato soup was very good but I wish I had more time to enjoy it but I hurriedly finished it to get to the lamb meatball pasta.  When I tasted the pasta, it was still hot so I cut a little break for that.  Perhaps if the place was busier things wouldn't have been so quick.

The menu describes the pasta this way--poblano cream sauce, red pepper, goat cheese, black pepper fettuccine.  The poblano cream had a nice zing to it and the small amount of goat cheese could be used to cut the heat if you wanted.  The meatballs were kind of dry.  The poblano cream sauce and the pepper fettuccine made the dish, flavor wise.  The fettuccine had become stuck together and I was given no spoon to twirl the pasta on.  Since the soup dish had not yet been cleared, I used the soup spoon to twirl the pasta but it came in very long lengths because of this sticking together.

For dessert, I got their S'mores brownie, a long brownie topped with marshmallow that was brûléed and had three thin ginger snap cookies placed in the marshmallow.  There was also a dip of marshmallow ice cream.  As it turned out, dessert was the best part of the meal.

NW came by a few times to see how things were and my server was around more often as the patio emptied of all patrons except for two dog hugging young women who took up a lot of my server's time.  

For the experience, the food would have been better if it had been timed better.  There's no excuse for NW to bring my entrée when she already knew I had just gotten my soup.  What was she thinking?  

The place is Downtown Summerlin priced (this may become the local version of "Strip prices) and without the $10 discount card, the place wouldn't merit the 3 stars.  Too bad, because for the most part, the food was good.  They've been open about 6 months and they still don't have their act together.  That's sad.  It's also the only time I'll dine there.

I came to this place after walking around downtown Summerlin. My friend mentioned to me last week that Crave started their Happy Hour. 

At first I was not sure since I had read so many negative reviews about how disgusting this place because this place are pets friendly. As a person who love dogs myself I think it's nice to have place like that around town. 
I also suspected all 8-9 negative reviews might be friends and I think it's not fair for group of friends speaking about business in all negative thought. People should yelp but let's be fair. So that's why I am trying out this place. 

My message to CRAVE employees is... Don't panic guys.... I didn't take my dog with me today! So I have nothing to complain about pet friendly. 

Our server was very nice. Listening to the server from table behind us also told me that everyone are on point for their customer services. I also noticed floor manager were running the food by himself helping out his employees. 

It's a 4 stars since my server forgot my ketchup for my fries but it's not a big deal! I will bring my own package myself next time lol. 

Happy hour.. A nice selections of food and drinks. I started with drink and how fantastic their serve my favorite Bluemoon for $4! during HH. My friend went for Kinky cocktails drink which I think it's great value for $4 as well. 

Fat!!! Chicken wings, Veggie Bruschetta, Tuna roll and Truffle fries are all tasty. 
Will be back again hopefully for date night special dining with a bottle of wine.

Service was absolutely terrible and rude. The restaurant wasn't all that busy and we waited over 40 minutes to be seated after being told it would be 20 minutes. Once we were finally seated after complaining, the waiter made a rude remark stating "are you ready to order, since you were such a rush to sit down?" Once we did order it took over over an hour to receive our food. Let me remind you the restaurant was almost empty by the time we put our order. Throughout the waiting process there was no apologies for the wait time or any asking if we wanted anything while we waiting for our food. You can get great food anywhere, but the service is what keeps me coming back. I will NOT be coming back.

Wednesday night we went crave restaurant for dinner after work. In my research they close at 11. We got there around 9pm. Hostess show happy hour just started.food came quickly but 30 min later wireless ask us anything else for last call.... They close at 10pm so we ask box and left ... All food was very salty,sushi rice was hard ... Sea Bass was very good !

I was excited to try CRAVE on my recent business trip to Las Vegas due to some great reviews I had read of it. I'll have to say that it generally lived up to the hype. With that said, I would not leave the Strip to experience CRAVE -- but if you're in the suburban area around it, it's a wonderful choice for a delicious dinner in a trendy casual place with friendly service. 

The menu is varied with many options including a sushi menu. To some extent, for better and for worse, it feels like a Cheesecake Factory type menu with lots of variety in the cuisine types but at a high degree of quality. I chose the fried calamari at the server's suggestion, and accompanied it with hot marinara. I love any calamari that is freshly battered and not too greasy, and this more than met the test. I really liked the crunchy corn meal batter. I also had the steak sliders for my dinner since I was not too hungry, and I enjoyed them a lot. I wasn't a big fan of the sauce on them, but the steak itself was juicy, tender and came in large chunks on the Hawaiian sweet bread. My friend had the sushi roll and enjoyed it.

Jordan was our server, and our whole table loved him. He was sweet, sincere, and made great recommendations that demonstrated his knowledge and experience of the menu.

Great food and service!!! Loved the pulled park and chicken with angel hair pasta!! Get the chicken avocado egg roll appetizer if you're a guac fan. Busser Felix never let my water go low and Sydnee was a friendly server who helped us out!

Since my last visit, this place is getting worst food quality sucks! Thd flatbreads seems like it had been waiting for someone to bring it to us, not hot anymore, salad was very soggy. We were just so hungry ... Although our waiter was nice, service is very slow.  I don't think I will return.  Nothing exciting about the sushi, I cud have gone somewhere else. Get rid of the sushi chef, you can do better.

We had a big group of eight at Crave... appetizers, drinks, and entrees. As far as appetizers, the firecracker shrimp was my favorite. The sauce on the shrimp was creamy and super flavorful. The tuna flat bread was a close second... the jalapeños really made the dish. The lettuce wrap appetizers were okay, a little more chewy then I prefer. 
I ordered the raspberry daiquiri made with their homemade raspberry purée. The drink was surprisingly tart. I tried someone else's ginger pear martini which I wish I would have ordered... that was delicious! 
For entrees I ordered the caprese flat bread... the description makes it sound like the whole thing is loaded with tomatoes which it's not. It's tastes good, but I was expecting from the description a pile of tomatoes and it was really just a couple of tiny pieces... kinda like pico de gallo. 
My boyfriend got the miso salmon * salmon anything is usually my favorite... maybe we're spoiled from being from the Pacific Northwest, but the salmon didn't have a lot of flavor and the veggies were kind of transparent and oily.  Order the flat bread stay away from the salmon.

Amazing service and excellent quality food.  The menu variety is also a huge plus.  Our server was very friendly and made great recommendations.  The management is very customer focused and the entire experience from host to check was superior in every way.  A truly premium experience with an incredibly warm and friendly approach.  I would highly recommend you skip the chain brands nearby and give Crave a chance.  You won't regret this experience!

Crave is not bad, but I'm not craving Crave

Crave is located on the northern part of downtown Summerlin. The decor is modern and trendy with bar high stools, booth and table seating for groups.

We ordered up a few beers on tap, Kona Brewing is always a good choice. The sushi menu was good, but really nothing that jumped off the plate to make it stand out over your local sushi hole in the wall. The calamari starter was a decent serving and something I would recommend.

The service was great, our server ran through the menu lighting fast and offered up some really interesting choices from the sushi menu.

Downtown Summerlin has some great options to choose from either for lunch or dinner. With no disrespect to Crave but i believe it falls in the middle of the locations you can choose from. If you have not been, Go try it out 

Overall:
Food: 3-5
Drink: 3-5
Service: 4-5
Coming back: sure

They were so busy at the bar we didn't want to order food as it would probably took forever, as it took a long time for us to finally place drink and appetizer order, however i tried their food couple times in the past and it was ok, we got some appetizers and the lavender & champagne cocktail which is super amazing. Nice place to spend friday night

Me and my wife on search for new restaurant so we found this place and for sure we'll planning to come back! 
Good food and health too and fast service  
Nice and quiet so it's a good recommendations for anyone
Tried the hot hot hot burger and loved it! The quinoa salad was amazing!!! The pickled peppers they add on the side are a perfect touch and also delicious. I can't wait to go again.

First time here and I'm very impressed.  Great atmosphere great sushi.  Had the aloha roll (it was awesome).  Very diverse menu so the no -sushi crowd can be happy while we dig in.  Sake menu limited but great  drink menu.  Fresh, quality, size of the nigiri.  I will be back!!!

I ate lunch here today.  I was disappointed there was no more outdoor seating (not their fault at all it was a pretty day!)  My girlfriend and I started with the duck confit flatbread.  It had arugala, pistachios, halved grapes, and a fig spread along with duck.  The flatbread was actually good.  It had a very thin crust that was not over-cooked.  Then I had the kobe tacos.  I wasn't too impressed with it, though the spicy-type Caesar that came on the side was very good.  Something with the tacos- idk, needed less meat (I can't believe I am saying this,) and more vegetables in it for a crunch.  It just was a very runny taco I guess.  I didn't think the meat was too fantastic so I guess that's why I would have liked more vegetables in it.  Our service was OK.  I don't know that I'd come here again.  The price compared to the food isn't exactly spot on though it is a very pretty place.  Too many other places in Summerlin I would rather spend money at and could get a better meal for the same price.  If you eat here note that half the menu is Mediterannean inspired and the other half is sushi- a weird combination but you definitely get more choices.

Had another visit for Fathers Day dinner and was somewhat disappointed.  Service left a lot to be desired when you have to ask 4 times for water... The prime rib special was the poorest cut of meat possible and not worth the money. 
The pesto chicken was very good and baked mac n cheese ok.

Not so impressed.  The place has an identity problem.  Burgers to tacos to sushi to pasta, and you're not really good at any of them.  That's the problem.  Waited 25 minutes for our food.  Wife ordered pulled beef tacos and I got the chicken caprese pasta.  Pasta was over cooked so a little mush (angel hair).  Hair tacos were nothing special.  The flour tortilla was dry and a little hard.  Our tempura appetizer was mushy and, again, not great.

Good place to get a drink maybe, but not so much for dinner.

What a disappointment Monday's 1/2 price sushi night was. I visited this location twice and on my first visit I had great service, beer, sushi (California roll) & wings.

Today, on 1/2 price sushi night there is a specialty menu with different sushi items to choose from. To name a few there is spicy tuna roll, crunchy roll & veterinarian options. I tried the crunchy roll and it was okay, nothing spectacular. 
The have a nice selection of tap beers and wines and the servers are nice and helpful. 

My fiancé had the spicy tuna roll, & the 702 burger and he loved it. I ordered wings but sadly they were all out. :( 
I'm not sure how you can be all out of wings on a Monday but they were.  Nothing on the menu really stood out for me to try except the crab artichoke dip, but it's to big of a portion for myself alone. 

I'm not sure if I would want to return to crave. I'm gonna do some searching around or other sushi restaurants. I would have rather had the buffet at red rock than my food tonight.

I've enjoyed a few lunches and a happy hour here with the girls but last weekend my boyfriend and I came here for a wonderful dinner.  5 stars for the atmosphere, service, bottled wine menu, crab and artichoke dip (with chunks of crab!), sea bass, and pork tenderloin dinner.  The only thing I would not repeat is the caesars salad.  The only thing it had in common with a traditional caesars salad was the lettuce.

Randomly chose to try this place after visiting downtown Summerlin and viewing the menu.
The ambiance of the place is fun but without making into a 'club restaurant' and the front end staff was very friendly.  (You can leave your phone number and they'll text you when your table is ready if you want to walk around the shops)

We ordered the truffle fries, the chicken-apple & brie sandwich and baked penne.  The food came out fast and we were happy with how everything came out.  Our waitress was friendly and checked on us a few times to make sure we had everything we needed

Food was 3 stars. I got the lemon garlic chicken and it was ok. Service here is terrible. Who hires these waiters. All they do is hang out and chat with eachother. Took me 25 minutes to get my check. Never coming back, thanks to the idiots that work here.

My party of 4 was told there would be a 30 minute wait for a table. Since it was opening weekend that didn't seem so bad. The whole front desk situation was pretty disorganized and chaotic.
While waiting, I asked to use the restroom and walked through a half empty restaurant which we were told was due to a "shift change".
We were finally seated right next to the open kitchen and placed our orders. Plates that were out when we first sat down were waiting for a least 30 minutes before they were finally thrown away. In fact, by my estimation, at least (and probably more) than half of the food put out was thrown away because it sat too long. This didn't make much sense because there were tons of wait staff standing around waiting for plates that were never passed to them. 
I can't speak about the quality of the food because after an hour we never received our food. I had a hard time sitting any longer watching food get thrown away while we waited. 
Crave is the only restaurant open at Downtown Summerlin which seems like it would put them in a great position. If they don't get their act together then I don't see them still being open in 6 weeks when all the other restaurants open.

We ordered widmer hefeweizen beer- this is awesome, slightly sweet. 
Lamb meatballs on peppercorn linguini.
Mac & Cheese w/ French fries 
Dessert Sampler- tiramisu, butter scotch pudding, blueberry cheesecake, French silk, rum butter cake, salted caramel pudding. Our favorite was the cheesecake- the rest were cloyingly sweet. 

Good service, and pretty good prices too. The creamy pasta sauce was rich, which went well with the gaminess of the lamb meatballs. The French fries were well-seasoned, but a tad bit salty. The Mac & cheese was a bit 'gabby' (according to my daughter) but overall pretty good

I came here for a salad and it fed my craving. Next time I'll try the sushi. Ambiance is nice, staff is friendly and food quality was good. I appreciate it was in the shopping center. I would come back again!

I came here for Mother's Day with family. I give it a one star because of the service. I ordered the 702 burger and it was good but the service wasn't to par. Seating was fast our waiter was horrible. Pretty much didn't see him. We ordered our drinks and they came. I didn't have a problem going to the bar and getting lemon wedges that we had asked for... But when I got to the bar to ask the guy if they had bloody Marries along with my wedges he said yes and needed to see our ids witch I didn't have a problem with but when I turned to get my mom and dads ids he told me the server would help me with that... I didn't want to order from our server because he wasn't tentative as it was... So I said forget it no bloody marries I figured their lose... Also my dad ordered a salad and his burger came before his salad.like I said the food was good, the atmosphere is nice but the service is terrible... I don't know if I will be coming back... Pretty much killed my vibe...

This was a really good place to go for dinner. My wife and I went yesterday and ordered Bourbon NY Steak, dynamite and Tuna 2 times sushi, firecracker shrimp, cheese curds and fig and prosciutto flatbread. 

We walked in and there was two other groups in front of us. The hostesses seamed to take for ever to seat us but not a big deal we finally got to sit down. The waiter was nice and ordered our drinks really quick along with bringing them to us. Perfect start so far. They have a happy hour menu that is amazing. Normally it seams that happy hour menus are lacking good food but this one killed it. Happy hour starts at 5 on Sunday until close. 

The biggest disappointment was it took about 45 mins for our appetizers to come out. We had the cheese curds and firecracker shrimp for the appetizer. Once we got the food it was really good. 

The main course took another 30 mins after that to come out. I got the NY steak and a sushi roll and my wife got a flatbread and sushi roll. The server walked back by after dropping the food off and asked how it was before we even had a chance to try it. Then he was never seen again after that until it was bill time. The steak was over cooked for my liking.  There were burnt sides of the steak. This was a $30 steak and wasn't worth it at all. The glaze on the steak was really good. The other food was great!  

We will more than like go back and try it again but will stay away from the over priced, disappointing steak this time.

I stopped by for a happy hour meetup. I ordered some sushi. I love sushi, but it is not so fresh here. I am not sure why I expected it to be good. I did really like the brownie desert. I can't remember the exact name. I shared it with some friends, but we also found a piece of hair in the ice cream. Buzz kill. ha. I am not sure I would go back.

We frequent here quite a bit since we live down the street, and always sit at the bar. All the bar staff is fantastic, but today Cassie was awesome. Great recommendations and she even offered us a 'jumbo' shot. Which is like a double but only $2.50 more.  We've been coming here for over 2 years and never even knew about it. Great job at upselling! :) Truffle fries are great, we also had a special lamb meatball appetizer with tzatziki that was really good. Love this place!

Horrible service. Went for Happy Hour. 5 tables around us got seated after us and got their food and we had to ASK our server where ours was. Food came out and was clearly sitting under heat lamps for a while. Never had refills on drinks. As we left multiple tables weren't even bussed. Only giving 2 stars because HH prices were reasonable.

Couple weeks ago, my wife and I had a bad experience at the hostess stand and after alerting management to our concern they went a above and beyond to apologize and took our concern seriously. We returned today for happy hour and it was awesome!  From the bartender to management to the HH specials =  5 stars. Can't wait to come back for dinner.

We had a buy 1 entree, get 1 free coupon and it was well worth it. Girlfriend had the Sea Bass and I had the Beef Tournedos (filet medallions). Both meals were excellent. I think they may have been a little understaffed on this night but our waitress was moving as fast as possible. The Tournedos were served with mashed potatoes and asparagus with a peppercorn sauce for the meat. Meat was tender and tasted great. The sea bass was served over rice with a pesto sauce. I had a bite--flaky and excellent flavor. The place was hopping this night. We were very pleased with the meal. Couldn't beat the 2 for 1 deal either.

Pretentious restaurant serving mediocre food. The burger was good, but nothing spectacular.  Charging for a bread bowl of focaccia, pita, and a small shot glass of olive oil.    Friend had the Mac and cheese.   Was bland and needed spice.   Other friend ordered bison burger.  Was told 5 minutes later they were out of it. At 2 pm?????  You've only been open 3 hours and already out if your signature???   Poor planning.   Restaurant was noisy.

Fried ordered desserts to go.  Desserts took over 15 minutes to come out.   Slice of chocolate cake and a slice of cheesecake.

Thank you, CRAVE for making our Valentine's Day perfect! The restaurant's appearance was very upscale, clean and classy. The whole atmosphere was sophisticated. Beautiful hostesses waiting to greet you, awesome waiters, and delicious food! My husband and I had the Valentine's Pre Fixe Menu for two. All I can say is,"Mmmm"... Completely satisfied with everything from the appetizers down to the dessert! My daughter ordered the bamboo bites (sushi) and crab cakes, both exceeded our expectations. We were really impressed to see how well the whole staff seemed to operate on such a busy night. Shout out, to our waiter Victor, for the excellent service!

After a bad experience at Grape Street Café my husband and I walked to Crave Restaurant in the Downtown Summerlin Mall. Im so glad we didn't settle for rudeness at the other place. At CRAVE we were met by courteous smiling hostesses Chelsa and Kayla who in tandem took our requests and sat us outside under the stars.
 Crave has a menu called "DATE NIGHT". We loved the food choices and the bottle of wine that was included in the rate. And then much to our surprise we were greeted with a 5 star server. Her name was Maggie T. and right from the beginning she seemed delighted to serve us. Her 5 star demeanor lasted throughout our meal. By the way, not only was the service great for a mall restaurant the food was delicious! We had the pleasure to be served by Jennifer Lapadu; a Manager at Crave. I shared my delight with the service and asked if she could share their names. As much as I share honest and truthful negative experiences it is much more important to shed light on servers who do their jobs so well..it even makes the food taste better!
One of my favorite spots in Downtown Summerlin.  I have not been a big sushi fan but I am turning around with the help of CRAVE and it's wait staff.  Wonderful atmosphere.

Servers were friendly and decently good with drink service. Food took forever and the portions were small. Ordered off the happy hour menu and it looked like a half portion for half price. Food was below average. The happy hour beer prices were decent. The mixed drinks were watered down and  came in like a 8 oz cup mainly ice. 

Outdoor patio was nice

Came here the night before Christmas while in town, and it was amazing. We ordered sushi, and the bison burger among other things and everything was amazing! The service was amazing and for Wednesday night it was half off bottles of wine which we didn't know till the End! Will definitely come back when in town! My family loved it!

This place is exceptional. It is an outstanding experience to eat and enjoy this place. You should only rate if you know what you are talking about and not be a whinny little bitch worried about the petty little crap. Good place to take anyone on a crazy yummy meal.

Just checking up on my yelps and a follower asked me where I've been and I remembered a yelp I forgot to do so for all my fellow yelpers out there that want a great place to dine and amazing service crave is a great spot to check out. I'm actually surprised and shocked on the amount of good places to eat in this downtown Summerlin but wow crave is definitely a shoe in to take first place. Everything about the place is 5 stars even the bathrooms. I usually hate waiting but when Miranda is on I have someone to talk to that'll make time fly by and somehow she can deal with all my questions and still take care and give other guest 5 star service she's an excellent person to have for when you first walk in. The shoe in for greatest sever alive and the most personable server I ever met is Mikey D. Not only does he remind me of home but he makes me feel like I have a great friend every time I step in to the place and I have been here plenty of times happy hour wings is something I live for some days. There a lot of great servers on but when I come and he's on that's who we will request. For the days we come in and we want the bar there's only one person we want back there and that's Andrea she has the most amazing wonderful personality and her smile can move mountains. The fact that she can keep up with all of these different conversations and still have positive input and feel like she's just part of your group makes me salute her. Crave you definitely have an all star cast and as long as you keep on with your 5 star employees which everyone is you'll stay on top of my list. Thanks for being a great place to be

Located in Downtown Summerlin. Sushi and burgers on the same menu!?! Why? You may be asking! Why Not! Is my reply. There is something for everyone here. Everything was fresh, the service was very good. So what else are you asking for? Reasonable prices? You got it. So take a break from shopping, stop in and enjoy yourself. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

This place is okay. Wasn't amazing, I ordered the Mexican sushi roll and didn't like it. There was no flavor in it at all. Then I got the lettuce wraps as an appetizer. Those are definitely better at P.F. Chang's. Personally I don't think I'd be returning. Service was good but the food wasn't. Not worth the price.

First time here...has a Yard House feel to it but different twist...

Ordered the bread basket and it was delish but wished it was unlimited...

The sushi menu is eclectic and overpriced (way better sushi places in town) so definitely don't recommend that side of the menu to splurge on.

Now the ribeye and scallops were delicious...especially the ribeye prepared with the chili molasses glaze...2 thumbs up!

Would come back here again to enjoy and hang out with friends in such a nice atmosphere! :-)

Sat at the bar for at least ten minutes with no service. 
Finally got a beer. Ten more minutes pass and no contact with the happy hour bartender. Finally had to leave. Very disappointed. First time and probably last time.

Lunched here on a Thursday. Quite busy, but seating was very efficient and took less time than estimated (about 10 minutes). Service was superior (Craig rocks!), and food was very tasty. I had the premium bento box with dynamite roll while the wife had the Chicken Apple Brie sandwich. They even brought a complimentary cup of fresh fruit for our daughter!  Can't wait to try this place for grownup night out with drinks as the bar and wine selection looked quite impressive.  The manager made his rounds while we ate which is somewhat rare nowadays. Will definitely come back!

Wow....had the sushi boat with friends. Hiroki is the man that created this masterpiece. There are lots of other goods things to eat too. This place is beautiful.i also had the lettuce wraps. You gotta try this place. The desert and drink menu is top notch.

Great experience. Had a group of 15 family and friends. They treated us wonderfully, the menu offering had something for everyone from Sushi, to Steaks, Seafood, Salads, and many more options. Allergy and Gluten issues were catered to, and the service was excellent. Marco the waiter was awesome. Very informative and patient and appreciative. We will be back!

If you are going to offer a gluten-free or "gluten-sensitive" menu then make sure that the items on it are actually so. After ordering I was informed that both of the options for sides to my burger (a spinach salad or fries) are both not gluten-free. Why were they even listed as options on the specifically gluten-free menu?

We were seated immediately! No wait time on a Saturday night. Our waitress was very friendly and efficient. It has a trendy atmosphere with a center bar, so you could just go for drinks or a full meal. The music is a little loud  if you're sitting across the table from someone it's hard to hear. The food came out fast and was delicious.

Ugh hate having to leave a bad review. Went in and ordered a chicken sandwich on the gluten free menu. Specified that I needed it gluten free again during ordering. Food took almost 30 minutes to come out and I was starving. I took a couple of bites and realized the chicken was totally raw. I sent the meal back and 20 minutes out came a chicken breast with no bun and a different side. The server said, "by the way, we messed up your last one that came out wasn't gluten free." ?! So you just let me eat a gluten filled bun? So three hours goes by and I start getting a stomach ache (assuming it's the gluten I was fed) and long behold- it's from the undercooked chicken. I spend 3 1/2 days glued to a toilet, rolling fevers, in and out of a doctors office and please let me add to top this off I had JUST found out I was pregnant (we told our family at Crave, that day!) so needless to say it was horrible timing. I was too stressed to call the restaurant and tell them about this disaster but had previously loved crave and thought this was truly unfortunate. The whole family is a little scared of it now.

I went to check out Downtown Summerlin yesterday with a few of my girlfriends for the first time. After an hour or so of exploring the new shopping area, we wanted to find a place to enjoy drinks and share a few appetizers. 

We looked up happy hour specials nearby and found that we could still make it to Crave's happy hour. 

I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant - very modern and attractive in decor. We sat at a hightop by the bar so we could partake in the happy hour discounted specials. 

For drinks, I ordered a glass of Chardonnay and one of my friends got the Kinky Mojito. I tried her drink; it tasted sour and I couldn't taste the alcohol. She didn't enjoy it either so she ordered wine for her second drink.
