We all ordered our separate happy hour menu items and shared a Caprese Pizza. I ordered the Pork Belly Sliders and a Philly Roll. My friends ordered fries, Crispy Chicken Bites, a Futomaki Roll, and the Kogi Tacos.

The food wasn't bad... it was pretty average. The sliders had a unique taste - the pork belly was grilled in a Korean BBQ marinade and topped with a Kimchi relish. They were good, but nothing to rave about. The sushi rolls were rather large but I've had much better. I would not recommend this restaurant if you wanted to splurge on sushi. I enjoyed the fries my friend ordered, they were seasoned perfectly and came with a Peppercorn Avocado Ranch dipping sauce. You can never go wrong with fries!

Our server's name was Joelle and she was very sweet. Attentive to our needs and checked up on us throughout our meal. Nothing negative to say about her.

I would give Crave a 3/5 for the food and a 5/5 for the service. I would recommend Crave only for happy hour drink specials. I think I recall Blue Moons (my favorite beer) being only $4 during happy hour!

I've been to Happy Hour at Crave a few times, but I'm updating my review because this is the first time we've had dinner there.  

We settled in to a comfortable booth, but I had to keep my jacket on the whole time, because it was very cold.  I ordered the house chardonnay.  I never order chardonnay unless I'm forced to.  And it's only recently, with my newfound ability to tolerate it, that it hasn't had me worshiping the porcelain god after just one glass.  It was chardonnay or bust, since I had no intention of paying $11 for a Washington State Riesling that was probably going to be dryer than a... Okay, I'm not going to finish that sentence the way I want to.  The Yelp gods wouldn't like it.  There was a white sangria, but it, too, was $11.  At most other restaurants, sangria is what you order if you're on a strict budget.  Can I afford it?  Yes, but that doesn't mean I'm going to do it.  

So on to the main event.  Hubby ordered Pad Thai, with chicken.  (It's always chicken.  He even clucks in his sleep). Adding that chicken made it nearly 40% more expensive than your typical Thai restaurant, but it was 40% not as good.  The dish was not a large portion and the chicken, what little there was of it, was as dry as that Riesling would have been.    

My dish was the Grilled Salmon salad.  I asked for romaine instead of the spring mix, and it also included spinach, onion, couscous, feta and spiced pecans.  The salmon, which I ordered medium, was a rather small piece, and was cooked medium on half of it, and well done on the other.  When I flipped it over, I saw why:  it was burned on the well-done half.  The romaine was chopped into little pieces.  I know a lot of people like chopped salad, but I'm not one of them.  The pearl couscous was tasteless, the pecans almost non-existent, same as the feta and spinach.  The dressing, which I had on the side, was supposed to be a cranberry vinaigrette, but was a thick and gloppy mixture of unidentifiable ancestry.  No taste of cranberry, or any other fruit, anywhere.  I could have sent my salmon back, but it would have been the same woeful dish, only with (maybe) less incinerated salmon.  There was nothing else I wanted to order, it was late, and I didn't want to wait.

But what really pushed my buttons is that this poor excuse of a salad cried out for bread, both to fill me up and to act as a pusher for those tiny bits of lettuce.  Apparently, that's a dirty word here.  Our waitperson said that many people ask for it and they, too, have conveyed that to the management, but it falls on deaf ears.  I couldn't get it and, knowing that they have it for sandwiches, made me even more pissed off.  I guess the motto here is "Let them eat cake."  I bumped it up one star because at least the service was good.

It's really a shame that this place, with its upscale and beautiful decor, can't produce a decent meal, at least in our case.  And the stinginess of the ingredients, as well as the unwillingness to satisfy a simple request for something that should be provided at the very least with a salad, leads us to say "¡No más!
The 702 burger is in the top 5 burgers of Las Vegas.  Plus, Dogfish 90 on tap, perfect combination!

One of the most annoying dining experiences I've had here in Las Vegas. EVERYTHING has an ingredient my wife can't tolerate in food and they couldn't make ANYTHING that didn't have it. To boot, it was really pricey and the service was very slow. I won't be back.

First the Pros...really the only Pros are the staff, who is warm, friendly and attentive... and the view of the water if you sit on the patio. 

So,  as mentioned previously, we asked to sit on the patio.  The problem here is that they have cranked up their own music outside, which conflicts with the music played by the mall.  It's unpleasant, to say the least. It makes it hard to think, let alone chat.

I ordered the chicken with lemon and garlic sauce for $22.95.  Sadly, it tasted neither like lemon, nor garlic.  It was really bland.  It tasted most like plain grilled chicken sans salt and pepper.  My husband ordered the chicken stir-fry, which was also bland.  It lacked seasoning and the vegetables were over cooked. This was not anything either of us would come back for, let alone "Crave". 

We hope they improve the taste of their food so they can live up to their name.

This was my first time here after hearing about it countless times and I have to say I was more impressed with the decor than the food and service...

Definitely interesting ingredients and twists in classic dishes if you're into that sort of thing. The service was beyond slow, the restaurant wasn't too filled, there were more than enough servers and somehow we still ended up being there about 2 hours. Not terrible but not worth a second shot for lunch at least.

This place needs some serious help. First off the girls at the front were quoting waits despite that tons of tables were open all over the restaurant. They informed us that we could sit at the sushi bar with no wait so we sat immediately. Our server was quick with greeting and very friendly so she was absolutely not the issue with this train wreck. So here it goes first off the wine glasses weren't polished so they had water spots all over, balsamic chicken salad was mediocre and full of leaves with huge hard stems, servers seemed to be standing around hanging out and not one moved aside to give me the right away when I walked through, they had an entire section being used to polish silverware out in the dining room, managers seemed to not care about what was going on, oh and there was no seat covers in the bathroom. 
So disappointed, I should've just grabbed a pretzel.

CRAVE - We won a $100.00 Happy Hour Party for up to 10 people. 
We booked the party to celebrate a birthday.   We had outstanding service, the food was great and it just kept coming for over an hour they delivered a huge variety of food samplings. Pizzas,sliders,sushi, 
Pot stickers, lettuce wraps, amazing variety. Jeff and Joe  accommodated our need to be out of the bar area as a member of our party was not yet 21. Hayley our waitress was pleasant, helpful and provided excellent service throughout the evening.  They even allowed us to bring in a birthday cake for our celebration. Their Happy Hour prices are very reasonable. We loved the decor and we will return soon. Thanks CRAVE !

Been here a few times and usually pretty good experience. Service is hit or miss. Nice ambiance and great menu selection. They have a separate sushi menu which I appreciate. 

3/26/16 I met my friend for a Saturday lunch. Not too busy. We were seated in booths in the bar area and were waited on by Jordan. He was a great server! Very attentive, funny, knowledgeable about the menu, refilled our waters often without being asked. We really liked his personality. 

I really like the menu selection. They also have a special menu (at least they did on 3/26) where they donated a portion of the meal price to a charity.

I was really wanting some seared ahi tuna but I wanted a tuna steak and a side of rice. So I looked at the menu and the closest thing I could find to what I was craving was the sesame seared ahi tuna salad. I asked the waiter to order just the seared ahi on a plate, and a side of jasmine rice. I was rather disappointed in the serving size of the tuna, very very thinly sliced ahi. Ah well.. it *IS* what I requested... I can't get upset about my bad choices, right? I will give the chef credit, it was definitely a very beautiful presentation, and the tuna was super delicious. I just wish there was more than 2 ounces of it! It actually melted in my mouth, it was quality sashimi. 

My friend and I also ordered the hummus appetizer, which was amazing!!!! I love the cucumbers served with the crispy pita bread, something about a really fresh cucumber and hummus that is so refreshing. The hummus was slightly spicy and had jalapeno in it. SO good. 

Everything is reasonably priced, with the tuna only costing $15. Great service and food, and an awesome location in the middle of downtown summerlin mall. Great place to stop before or after a movie, or to take a break from shopping.

Here to try their happy hour. A very beautiful restaurant in the new downtown summerlin. Had the Sushi Tuna Roll, very good. The Lettuce Wraps are individually prepared and they were tasty. We also had the crispy pork dumplings, they were the only disappointment, they were pre made and not very good. Everything else was so unique and presented so nicely. I would recommend this place, very nice.

No. No no no. I am so disappointed!! I don't know what I'm more disappointed with! The service- 15min waiting to be acknowledged after we sat down... Or the fact that my jambalaya tasted like someone poured an entire bottle of tabasco in the sauce!! I love spicy food... But give me a break!! I was expecting Cajun seasonings. The smell of the sauce literally was burning the inside of my nose. 4 bites in and I thought I was gonna be sick. I pushed my food away because the smell of vinegar was too much.

When our server finally decided to take out plates away, he noticed that I barely touched my food. I proceeded to tell him that the smell and taste of Tabasco was just way too much and really gross and make me sick to my stomach. His only response to me was "maybe you would like to order some desserts to get the taste out of your mouth" ARE YOU SERIOUS!?!  No apology.. No getting the manager. I tried to wave a manager down, but I was ignored. 

Don't waste your time. Don't waste your money. If you value your precious daily calorie intake.. Go to shake shack

Went to celebrate a dear friend's birthday last Thursday at 12:30 PM; restaurant was practically empty.  Service was terribly slow, restaurant had fewer than 20 people in it.  Food finally arrived at 1:30 PM.  Ordered a brownie dessert; that took another 45 minutes.  Manager was summoned, said we should have been told they had to make the Marshmallow topping that goes on the brownie?  Really?  Gave us the dessert for free, but by that time we were over it.  Needless to say we'll be looking for another place to celebrate in the future...

This is one of our favorite spots in the northwest. We chose it for New Years Eve dinner and was not disappointed.  Our waitress, Haylee with the ginger hair offered superb service during our complete dining experience. We enjoyed the edamame appetizer with our blackberry themed cocktails, then great salads before our entree of pasta with lamb meatballs...superb and worth the wait!  We ended the night with chocolate martinis for dessert.  Can't wait to visit again!

I have been here several times, mostly because of the variety of the menu and we have never had to wait for a table. The food is pretty good but I think overpriced. The service is usually slow and I am always confused about the decor. Not too sure what they are going for with the applebee's style tables/chairs, carpeting, and curtains in all the corners. Feels very dated. I would expect a little bit nicer atmosphere for the cost to dine there. Overall we will probably keep coming back because it's an easy place with lots of choices for everyone.

5 stars! Dakota was very prompt in seating me at a great booth and she was so kind. For once a hostess who actually seemed like she genuinely wanted us there! Our server Jordan was very informative and had excellent recommendations. I had a lunch combination with the crave salad and a half BLT. So good! My friend had the bison burger. We shared the Mexican roll and were absolutely blown away. We will be back again very soon!

Horrible horrible service. I could not believe how slow they were. Took over 10 minutes just to get four glasses of water to the table. We sat outside in the patio area, only three other tables sat and 1 server. Didn't even bother to ask how we were doing, we had to hunt her down to ask for everything.

Only reason they received 2 stars was their food was somewhat decent but the service left such a bad taste that was just wanted to get out of there. Food was average, nothing special, decent enough if your hungry and don't care about service.

The food is so yummy! The wings are insanely good. It's also a super fun environment with a really unique and original menu. The food is delicious and the staff is extremely friendly. Will definitely be back!

This is one of the few cool bars/restaurants in downtown Summerlin. They have some drinks and food on happy hour but most of the items are very small. Their signature drinks are really good, I tried the Michelada (which is great if you like spicy items), Raspberry Ginger Gimlet (was super good, very refreshing, somewhat sweet and with a great flavor) and the Angry Dragon (also a very tasty and flavorful drink) if you are not into prepared drinks they also have a large selection of beer. 
The atmosphere of the restaurant is very inviting. The decor is fresh and modern but somewhat relaxed at the same time. 
We tried the mini chicken apple sauce flat bread which was good, but nothing that I would be craving. The crispy chicken bites were just ok, but again the size portions were small. We ordered a few rolls and they were no big deal, I'm sure I can get the same quality at Smiths. Overall a good place for drinks, but there are probably better options out there.

The atmosphere was nice and very warm. Great food. I had some artichoke dip with flat bread. Then I had 9th Roll sushi roll...it had tempura shrimp with avocado and raw salmon on top and rolled in rice and cucumber. Then went out of their way to serve my friend a bday cake and ice cream for her birthday.

Came to Crave at 1:30pm on Sunday 2/19 only to wait for 15 minutes before a random waiter (not our waiter) greeted us/brought us waters and told us our waiter would be with us shortly. So we waited another 10 mins and still nobody came. We finished our waters and left. 

Pretty ridiculous as the place was not busy to be ignored for any timeframe like that. I tried to call to speak with a manager after we left only to be told they were to busy to speak with me.  

I couldn't recommended this place or not for their food because I wasn't able to try it but the service obviously sucks.

I've eaten at Crave at lunch several times and thought the food was good. Went there tonight and I have to say... the California roll was DeeeLicious!  I also got the Chicken Avocado rolls and some regular French fries. French fries were not great. They seem to have a problem with their salt shakers working, and they come with no flavor or seasoning. Just a deep fried chunk of potato. Speaking of deep fried... they put hardly any chicken in the chicken avocado rolls so they pretty much tasted like rolls of deep fried guacamole.  

The servers never seem to have enough time. You are lucky to see them once every ten minutes so catch them while you can if you need something for your meal, or you are ready to pay. 

I think I will stick with lunch from now on. And stay away from the fried guacamole!!!

Pretty disappointed. Went on a Sat night for happy hour around 5pm-  was told on the phone and at the front door they had happy hour 3-6pm. Then when I ask for HH specials, I'm told they don't have HH Sat until 9pm. Should've walked away then. Was on a work budget of $30 for dinner, which gets you nowhere on normal pricing in Vegas. The bartender was nice and poured my first drink strong- had 2 well rum and diets $7 each. Ordered a spicy tuna roll- nothing special for $9. Not worth it for 6 pieces. Has decent bar to watch games at but wouldn't go again during normal dining hours.

After receiving a free appetiser offer from POSARE' Salon, I stopped by. Listen, I'm an Elite Yelper so I always check with Yelp even with a free offer. And although I don't usually patron a 3 star business because I truly think the system works, I thought what a creative way for "Crave" to promote their business and hopefully increase their star power. Not to mention, I needed a drink! Lol
So, walking in... very cool vibe. I decided to sit at the bar and watch the action. I immediately decided, I liked this place. The staff were all very friendly... a guy walking around spinning pizza a dough... fun! My free Firecracker Shrimp appetiser was enough for 3 people as a starter and it was very good. Ordered an entree to go for a late night dinner... enough for 2 or 3 meals and really is delicious... even reheated. Only negative... I'm a big craft beer drinker and sadly, their draft system was down but they did have a few bottled choices and they were very cold so brownie points for that. 
Would I go back without the coupon... YES! Would I recommend "Crave"... YES! No explanation for the 3 star rating but love that they have stepped up and it must be working.

Eh. I had high expectations for this place and was really excited because it's just down the street from my house. Everything we ordered was...just OK. We tried if you appies and a few entrées and everything was pretty mediocre. Everything we had was great in concept...but the execution just wasn't there. The sushi dish (yellowtail carpaccio I think?) was missing something. The sliders too - sounded really good and all the ingredients should have worked...but they just didn't stand out. 

The prices were on par for Downtown Summerlin, not cheap, but not strip prices either. 

I'll go back and try it again, if only for the location and the ambience. It has a good atmosphere and I'd go back to check out the date night menu. 

I think with a little tweaking and attention to detail, this place could be a lot better.

IF I COULD GIVE THIS RESTAURANT NO STARS I WOULD... NOT SO MUCH FOR THE FOOD BUT FOR THE MANAGEMENT IN PARTICULAR KEVIN KELLEY THE GENERAL MANAGER, WHO IS A VERY NASTY, ARROGANT PERSON.  We were invited for Customer Appreciation Day on Thursday and everyone was lined up ready to bring the little bites they put out to their table and Kevin chose to announce only 2 items were allowed????  You invite people to a appreciation day and then put a limit on what they can bring to the table??? This doesn't make sense, people were taking 4 plates of sushi, hamburgers, pizza and rightfully so as it was supposed to be customer appreciation day.... However Kevin must have wanted to economize so he was going to limit the food you were allowed to take. On the invite it says nothing about their being limit on the food.  I didn't find the sushi to be too great as the seaweed was very difficult to chew... The burger was OK and of course with the limit on everything who knows what else I would have like to taste if he didn't stand their like a prison guard watching the food and what you put on your plate..... This restaurant has had problems in the past so they brought in Kevin Kelley the new GM who is supposed to turn Crave around and bring in business.... well if he continues with the attitude he had, the fake smile and the annoyance in his voice and patrolling every table to see what you have taken from the FREE appreciation items I don't think he is going to bring in many customers.  You have to serve quality food and have a great staff and your management and especially the GM should bend over backward to make their customers feel comfortable, welcome and wanted,  Not so with Kevin, he's find when you are spending money in the restaurant, but as soon as they are giving away free food he become an entirely different person..... Nope, not my kind of restaurant, I like to feel appreciated, not by what I spend but because I patronize the restaurant.... Not so here.... if the review isn't good, you are not welcome.......ALSO AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, THE PRICES OF THE ENTREES ARE MUCH TOO HIGH FOR WHAT IS IN THE DISH.  VERY SMALL PORTIONS BUT HIGHER PRICED THAT THE SURROUNDING RESTAURANTS...  maybe that is why they are always empty, people may go in once or twice but when you see what you get for the price you are paying you don't return.

The menu was very appealing. The ambiance was perfect. Our waitress made the experience very pleasurable. ..I ordered the ribeye which was cooked to perfection along with asparagus, very nicely paired.

I had a wonderful experience! I sat at bar, bartender was very friendly and really helpful with menu. In fact she practically ordered for me. She also enrolled me in loyalty program and they have been sending me lots of coupons. I will return for the vast menu and great ambiance. Try the Lemon chicken wings!! Thumbs up!
This place has definitely redeemed itself since it first opened. Sean, was an amazing chef. Michael was a great server. They took care of us and me and my best friend had a great night here!

I've been to CRAVE three times now (one dinner, one lunch, one happy hour), and I've enjoyed the food each time. I can tell that it's been freshly prepared utilizing high quality ingredients. To me, that's a huge plus for any restaurant.

My experience with the service has been positive all 3 times. Note that the lunch and, obviously, happy hour were both in the bar.

While I haven't tried their sushi yet, I did enjoy their mahi mahi dinner. The fish was fresh and the preparation tasty and unique.

I would agree that the menu is a bit overpriced, but I'm willing to pay for quality.

CRAVE is worth checking out if you're in the area.

Friendly and attentive staff. I never saw the bottom of my glass. Our server was very attentive and nice. We order the Sushi Boat. The food was good. Presentation was nice. Sushi was great. I gave them three star because of the desert. We had the triple chocolate cake. Although it tasted alright it was dry and stale. I would still come back on this place and suggest it to some of my friends who would like to try it.

Atmosphere: What a benefit to Crave that they are one of the only restaurants open during the opening of DTS. Crave feels like it's menu of Sushi/Burgers... Identity confused. The sushi smell will likely knock you over when you walk in the door.The hostess could use some classes on cordiality, and possibly look at you when speaking, let alone a smile. My family and I waited for 30min, to be set at the bar when there were open booths available, not the most comfortable. The hiring manager likes blondes with tattoos, that's clearly evident by the very attractive tattooed waitresses.

Food: I was surprised that I had to pay for the bread basket (usually complimentary), but ok. The burger, well it had a patty. Now the flatbread apple sausage was totally worth all the BS that I had to deal with. Also, the crab cake (with salad) was pretty darn good. For desert, the smores brownie... Or the snores browie... 


Not really for the fam, Ironic since Summerlin (the target demo) is mostly families. I hope this place gets it together before any competition opens up.

Geesh people give them a minute! I saw amount of stars and almost didn't go but if you read them everyone is complaining about the girls at the front. My gosh they've been there like a week let them settle in. 

The food here is really amazing. The sushi roll I had was amazing I can't wait to go back and try literally everything on the menu. "I" actually messed up and ordered my sushi wrong and they fixed it even though it was my fault. (Mexican roll...YUM!)

Our waiter was super friendly and prompt. I hope people read reviews because the stars are a bad reflection of the food. I'm super snobby when it come to food and this place was GREAT!

Check it out yourself and leave a review if you love it. Yelpers shouldn't leave reviews on service of a brand new restaurant at least give them 30 days come on people!

Loved it! 

Beautiful space, excellent service and great food. The chicken strips appetizer was spicy and delicious. For my entree I had the jicama and grapefruit salad. It was fantastic. Impressive wine list and I had a cocktail I wasn't overly impressed with but it was pretty good too.

The food is amazing here. We ordered a Duck Confit Flatbread, which had jam spread, greens, cheese. The Scallops were nicely seasoned and browned, over a bed of butternut squash rissotto. The scallop poppers were from the sushi menu, its a ball of rice, wrapped in raw salmon, and topped with scallop chunks in the middle. 

They have happy hour during the week only. We ordered a White Sangria and a Sparkling Cranberry. They were both very delicious but i felt disappointed because i think they drink sizes were too small. 

There is indoor and outdoor seating, the outdoor seating has both tables and lounge chairs and couches.

I felt that our server was not very knowledgeable. She would admit she hasn't tasted all the menu items, and then she would recommend drinks, we'd how that drink tasted and then she'd say again she's never tried it.

For sure one of the best dining experiences I've had in a while. Hostess was awesome, sweet and welcoming and our server Isaiah was on his game. I had the chicken, Brie, and apple sammy that was   pretty damn yum. Best part they brought us out goodies for our anniversary!

Went to happy hour with a couple friends today. Food was good. Especially liked the Parmesan truffle fries and pork dumplings. The Aloha roll, on the regular menu, was delicious also! Our favorite drink was the Kinky Mojito!!!! 

Of special note...our server ended up being one of the bartenders named Michael. He was very courteous and provided professional service. In addition, he went above and beyond the call of duty...my friend left her glasses on the table when we left, we had told him we were going for gelato (why we didn't order dessert there). He walked all the way to the gelato place just to bring her glasses! Michael deserves recognition for his extra effort in exceptional customer service! Thanks for taking such good care of us!

Sorry , but when we spend $100 on a lunch for 4 people , I get super offended when I'm charged .75cents for an iced tea refill.   I don't appreciate being nickel & dimed in an already overpriced restaurant and we won't be back.

First of all great environment inside and out. I ordered a Bento box sushi whatever their premium box was called. The sushi roll that came with it was crap. I asked the waiter if I got the right role since he recommended it. As it turned out, he never had it. Just recommending things on the menu that he has no clue about. Learn the f**kn menu and what's on the menu. Could've done better with a hamburger or something else that looks OK on their menu. Definitely stay away from sushi at this place. I also ordered the wings which were gigantic, but in the end average. I would probably give it a second chance if someone wanted to go there however I wouldn't go there myself again.

I didn't like this place at all!!!! Service is awful!!!! Went here today sit at the bar... I was starving and ordered right away, menu was just handed to me and have no idea how the portions  are, the salmon salad was decent and I had some crab cakes for appetizer which came out together with my salad... The bartender didn't even ask how my food was, the guy next to me ask me "how was the crab cakes" bartender was In front of me when I response "it's really salty" and he didn't say a word!  Bad bad service....

We stopped in on the opening weekend. It was predictably packed, but we were seated promptly for our reservation. We were incredibly fortunate to have Emily as our server. It was obvious she was very busy, but she never seemed rushed or flustered. She even managed to find the time to chat us up about my iPhone. 

I ordered a Paloma. Excellent. I had the bison burger which was the best burger that I've had. Ever. The only real drawbacks were the uncomfortable bistro-style stools and that it was ridiculously loud to the point that it was hard to carry a conversation. Other than that, a pretty good experience all the way around.
Great food.  Service was amazing!  Our Waiter was Jake.  Best service I have had in a long time!  Nicole the Hostess is a sweetheart!  Definitely recommend!

We walked in and asked for outside seating, got it right away.

We ordered drinks and our food after about ten minutes, I feel like that is a normal wait time. Our waitress was running around I could overhear other tables being quite needy (as in can you move my umbrella I wanted to sit outside but not deal with the sun or the heat or the birds ha) 

I asked for a recommendation on which fish dish was better in her opinion and she recommended the salmon but warned me about the mustard flavor. Honestly it was delicious so kudos. 

I think people need to give the place a chance it's just opened give it awhile to work out the kinks.

Really wanted to like the place -- but the overall experience disappointed really ..  My martini "Crave Martini" wasn't even near full .. at $10.25 each they could at least find a way to fill the not really large glass.  it was a tasty combination tho so yes, ordered another which came slightly more full.
Husbands pinot noir wine pour was pretty scrimpy - kind of gave me the impression they are 'quietly' trying to squeeze every possible dollar out of every customer - not a good impression.
Food - was ok - nothing to exclaim "cant wait to go back for ___" Had wedge salads which arrived 20 mins after ordering .. the place was not very busy so it couldn't be due to that.  Surfer roll (real crab was the reason we ordered it) arrived on a rather long rectangular plate, and sat dwarfed on it - it was an 8 piece itty bitty teeny tiny roll - again for $10.95 I thought it would at least be something good to share so we could taste a few menu items.  We opted for a Lobster/Shrimp flatbread - this arrived on a long wooden platter - I think they spent too much on their dinnerware and serveware for what they provide food-wise.  It reminded me of matzoh - dry at that - the somehow managed to miss applying the pesto to most of the flatbread - it was 'dotted' with pieces of bay shrimp and cut up langostino - which isn't lobster and for which chain restaurants Rubios and Red Lobster have been sued for using when saying Lobster.  if you are not a foodie, or really pay much attention, it is ok, but ...
Service was ok - Justin did his best so he was rewarded tip-wise but the overall experience left me wondering how long this place will last.  We may or may not be back.

I was impressed by the food and by the service! We came in with a group of six and our waiter, Nicholas, was amazing! He knew the food inside and out. He also never let us have to ask for anything, he was two steps ahead the whole time!
The food was really good! Everyone got something different and everyone cleaned their plate! The prices were fantastic as well! We will be back for sure!

I have been there a several times. It is always pretty good. 
Service was a little slow, but really no complaints.

I got the scallops, they are really good.

***I decided to Edit my review. My family and I keep going back to Crave and it seems to be getting better. My 11 year old requests going there.

Costco sells gift cards to Crave. For $80 you can purchase a $100 gift card. Getting a 20% discount before you even walk in the door. :)

Great place to enjoy lunch or dinner. We both enjoyed the Chicken Pasta Rosa. I would like to recognize our server Cassie who provided outstanding service. Five Stars to you Cassie. I highly recommend you try The Crave for either lunch or dinner.

Went for dinner on Tuesday with 5 people and it was a great experience.  The waitress was fantastic; refills flowed and all our needs were addressed.  We had several apps: nachos, short rib tacos, scallops, California roll, and tuna tataki.  All were very tasty and fresh, although the portion size was a bit small on all but the nachos.  Main courses included 2 of the steak dishes (outstanding) and mac & cheese bowls (very good).  The only complaint is that the prices are a bit high for an eatery of this caliber, but if you don't mind that, the food is fantastic.

First timer.  I came in with my friend today during happy hour.  We always walk by here but never stopped in.  I'm happy we did.  We sat at the bar.  Cassy was the bartender.  She was wonderful and attentive.  Very friendly and gave us great suggestion on drinks and food.  We weren't so hungry, we ordered: truffle parmesan fries, tuna roll, and margherita flatbread.  Delicious three appetizers, I really liked the margherita flatbread best!  We got some drinks too, glass of chardonnay and mojito.  Both drinks were great.

We came here because Crave sponsors O'Roarke Elementary's Pep Squad.  We had no real expectations and were pleasantly surprised by delicious food, great service and a great location.  The Honey Sriracha wings were delicious, sushi is fresh and reasonably priced.  Good kids menu selections (with healthy choices!) Overall great experience.  We will be back.

Our first trip was a 3 star, food was OK. We were in area and decided to stop in again after seeing sign showing new menu items. The sign brought us in but we did not try the great looking shrimp dish in the picture!
The food was much better this time around. Pork dumplings were very good. Chips and guacamole was very good, and they actually give you enough for two. I shared a burger with my husband and we both enjoyed it. Try the truffle fries!
The interior is very nice and our service was good. 
We were also able to catch the end of the Broncos game when Manning came in to rescue them over the Chargers. Nice bonus.

It's okay.  I've tried a few different menu items and they were all good.  The s'more brownie desert is delicious!  The menu selection is nice, but very little interests me.  Lots of sushi selections; the raw selections are not of interest to me.  I've been here a few times and go only when my friends want to eat there.  Did I mention the s'more brownie is delicious!

Update:
Was communicated to by Crave personnel regarding their seriously horrific service.  Gave them a final try today, and I must say- even them taking care of basically the bill still will not make me go back again.
My rating of 1 star stands, while it was better- this establishment is extremely over priced, and service still just is not to the level that this establishment makes itself look like it should be.  For being high priced and in DTS- it should have a 4-5 star rating,  but management and staff have made this place just terrible and the lack of pride in service has now begun to come through in their food quality.  

So as of now- this place literally can't pay me to come and eat here.




Don't know where my first review went-  posted it because we had absolutely atrocious service and ended up leaving before ordering because the staff was so rude.

My wife gave them another try with her friend and that was ok- so I have them a try and it was great,

But went in today for my wife's birthday.............
After sitting waiting for nearly 10 minutes for any of the wait staff to even acknowledge our presence,,,,,even though they walked by several times and even gave drink orders to the table LITERALLY RIHT NEXT TO US-, we finally left.  Very nice of the lady whom looked like a manager that had looked at us several times and not bothered to help us though as we got up to leave come running over and talk to us finally-

Simply put,  this place can jog

When we arrived there was no one at the hostess stand.  Once we we're finally seated it took about 10 minutes before anyone came to our table.  We decided to order off the happy hour menu.  The food was just okay.  Nothing that would make us want to come back though.  Our waitress China was bubbly and provided fantastic customer service and we did enjoy the patio dining.

De-li-cious. To have ate here 3 times and the food has been fantastic. Esp the chicken sausage Flatbread. They're also dog friendly on their patio and provide us a bowl of water. The HH is at the bar or patio and they have an evening HH as well as a reverse one

HORRIBLE!!!!  And not fair to the two previous times we have been there.   Was  there for weekday lunch and Mon eve sushi.  Was fab!   They told us about brunch and have been so excited to go.   Omg.   Horrible.   Got there and one other group of 4 at the bar.   Not even an acknowledged.   We continued to order brunch.    Mgr -Tory - walked by us a dozen times without saying a word.  Left half of a flat bread.  Was just ok.  Never asked if anything was wrong.  Had to ask bartender  Chelsea for water, setup, salt n pepper in addition to many refills. Also was a problem w/amt paid. After we paid and expressed dissatisfaction, then Mgr stopped by.  Equally horrible as sever.  We are in the hospitality/service industry.    This was absolutely horrible.  If they were working for my establishment, they would be gone.  Locals are here to stay.  Not at this place.  Go upstairs to public house.  They treat you way better.!!!   Remember.   Customer service oriented is the key....

Horrible horrible horrible its our first time here and the server is like rushing us and he said we need to to get pur order in at 10:00 and I was like I cant decide coz the menu looks fade away, I cant even read the ingredients esp on the sushi side. While I was looking at the menu trying to decide what to get he was just standing there like the fuck I need space smh.. Then its 10:02 he came and ask us again but thought the order needed to be at 10 smh so we just left.
Just average.  Great sushi specials if you like that sort of thing.

There aren't many food options at the Summerlin mall just yet. On a recent trip Dyanna L, her man Brent S. and I all decided to check out Crave. I'd also seen lots of fellow Yelpers check in here and wanted to know what all the fuss was about. 

Upon walking in we were greeted by at least 4 hostesses. We were quickly walked around what felt like the whole restaurant to our seats. The hostess pulled out our chairs (fancy) and handed us menus. Our glasses were filled with ice cold water. They do have a vast menu and they even have a full sushi bar. The prices are high so be prepared. Since we had intentions of eating someplace else later I was checking out the appetizers, but could not resist their huge sushi menu. Since I was watching my budget I just went with the Spicy Salmon Roll ($8). Dyanna got another specialty sushi roll and a martini and Brent got edamame, soup and some jumbo shrimp. Everything was just ok. Nothing that special and definitely not worth the price. 

Fancy atmosphere and only meh food doesn't mean your can charge outrageous prices. With Wolfgang right around the corner we might as well have gone there and had amazing food or I guess we just should have stuck to Wetzels Pretzels. Save your money and hit up another restaurant in this ever growing mall.

I was very hesitant to try Crave due to the reviews on Yelp. However, I was pleasantly surprised! I ordered the aloha roll and the King Kong. Both were delicious and I've tried a lot of sushi places in Vegas. The aloha roll was spicy but really well prepared. My boyfriend ordered the Mac and cheese. He said he really enjoyed it but was expecting it to be spicier with the addition of the sauce. We had pineapple mojitos which were also very good! I would definitely come back. They have a really big menu with a variety of choices.

I give the extra star for friendliness of staff.  That being said, they seemed understaffed when we dined there.  understandable considering how new it still is.  The food was tasty and somewhat prompt with above average execution.  The quality that seemed to be missing from everything overall was conception.  It comes off as if they are trying to execute multiple concepts at once, like a casual mid to upscale sushi bar/yardhouse that is part intimate - part sports bar-ish.  This creates a confusing vibe as it is not pulled together in its paradoxical ways, and IMHO they do not capitalize on such a mish mash of concepts with their menu items.  The other reason I give them four stars, is because despite these and more shortcomings, it is clear that they are putting time and effort into making it all work in a genuine way.  Whether or not they continue to develop it into a more refined version of itself, I applaud the effort they are clearly putting into it.

I went to crave with my family yesterday for the first time. And let me tell you I was blown away. The employees were so nice, and our server was very good at his job. He knew every question we asked him, my father had a handful of questions about the beers, and the server knew just what to say, as he was very helpful. The atmosphere was very enjoyable, the restaurant was themed so beautifully. I ordered the firecracker shrimp, I thought it would be too spicy, but it was just right. They had one of my favorite sodas, PIBB, I was surprised they had it, not a lot places do. The prices were reasonable for the food. I had a great time visiting Crave, I got to enjoy a really good lunch. I also recognized one of the female African American servers working there from high school, she was a senior when I was a freshman. She was very nice to me and seemed to have remembered who I was. Crave is the ideal place to eat if you want to go out with friends or family, enjoy a nice casual lunch or dinner at a nicer restaurant, compared to a quick sit down place.

Went during happy hour, when there are certain appetizers for half off. Buffalo wings were among as well as crispy chicken sliders. They are also in the process of revamping their menu. I also got this cheesecake/ came. It was very light and had a lemon like flavor. I forgot what it was called, here is a picture below.

Crave! Such. A beautiful restaurant indeed. The service was fantastic except for the rude hostess. The food was incredible, I had a margherita flatbread which was phenomenal and ordered the turkey burger! It was absolutely delicious except for the fact when I picked it up a pool of oil/grease fell all over my hand in large amounts.... I couldn't eat the bun cause there was literally too much compared to the patty, and it was soggy!! but it was amazing! For fries, I recommend the gluten free and not the normal ones... Mine were stale and dry:(

AMBIANCE: 4 - Really nice, really clean. Probably looks more upscale than it probably should.

SERVICE: 4 - Pretty awesome service. Our server was just really cool and helpful. He was always coming to check on us and see if we wanted anything more before happy hour ended. 

FOOD: 3 - It was okay. It wasn't the best, but one dish is worth mentioning: Sriracha Wings. I thought they were pretty good. A bit too pricey for happy hour, but pretty good. I also selected the Caprese Chicken Sandwich, which was pretty weird, by the way--otherwise okay tasting. 

Also, the happy hour drink section just wasn't worth it. My friend ordered one drink and I had to finish it because she didn't like it. All I have to say about it is that..that drink was not worthy. 

I see that they have sushi, but I think I'll pass. I have to give this place an overall 2 because of the menu. Honestly, Crave has potential, it could be a good American restaurant. But, their menu is so out there and weird that people are just not craving Crave.

We came here on a Monday evening. It was a while before we got noticed, greeted,and seated. The restaurant was nearly empty but we still needed to wait for a specific table in a specific section to be cleaned. (the logistics) hostess never smiled at all...
Pros:
1- restaurant is absolutely gorgeous
2- steak was very tender. Portions are sufficient 
3- waitress was very nice and courteous
4- large selection and menu variety

Cons:
1- the long time it took to get noticed and greeted
2- there were discrepancies in pricing between the menu posted outside and the menu delivered to the tables
3- unfriendly hostess

You guys have so much potential to be the best restaurant in your area. I think the points you missed are stupid and fixable. We like you and we will try to come once more before making up our mind.

I went to a wine dinner last night with 4 others.  The food and wine were excellent but the service was outstanding.  Our servers were fabulous.  Attentive and responsive.  Our whole table was impressed with the service.  We look forward to attending the next wine dinner.

I'm back and this time disappointed. I'm having dinner and my sea bass was bland, salmon sushi roll was blah, my wife's pesto chicken was undercooked, my bro's filet mignon was supposed to be medium rare but turned out well(overcooked), which couldve been a very bad health concern, and they forgot my kids apple juice. The place was about a 3/4 empty of people, so for the food to be cooked like that means the staff was full of unprofessional undereducated rookies! Too bad, because this is a total opposite from first experience as you can read in my review. My wife didn't even have anymore time to eat the dish they replaced and by then you can't give back the missed experience of eating w/the rest of your party!
Workers were so polite and helpful. My food and my friend's food came out really fast despite the place being busy. Definitely going back here soon~
Sushi was pretty good but nothing spectacular. Liked the Mexican roll. The décor and environment was somewhat strange, felt very institutional.

This place just can't get their stuff together. I work in the mall and every time I give this place a shot I end up regretting it. Last time about 3 months ago the service was horrible and the food was mediocre at best. Today I ordered the couscous protein bowl. I'm allergic to onions and the description did not state that onions were included in the dish. Aside from peanuts - onions is one of the most allergic food types in the American diet. You would think that the menu would mention it ? The bowl had 5 little strips of chicken. Two of them were 90 percent fat. Just another poor experience at place that I will no longer visit, even with all the free food coupons they give away this place is just no good. Period

A new favorite!!

This was an impromptu dinner and we were not disappointed! Our server Maggie was so helpful, down to earth, & made us smile every time she stopped by our table. 

The food was AMAZING. We even got to enjoy the outdoor seating since the weather was great. 

Also, Maggie mentioned how new creative dishes are always being added to the menu. Who doesn't like new things, right?

Keep up the great work!

Inside is nice, very modern. Our waiter was very nice and attentive... The lettuce wraps were gross. Every bite I was getting pieces of chicken grizzle.. I ordered the margarita flatbread.. There were chunks of rock salt on it that made it inedible, how do you screw up a margarita flatbread? My bf ordered a burger the meat was delicious but the bun was burnt to shit.. He had to rip half of the bun off... It was fast food quality at a high end restaurant price.. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

We arrived Sunday around 5 PM, and waited in the front for a good ten minutes prior to anyone acknowledging that we were there. The restaurant was not very busy so we were surprised that we had to wait so long to be seated. 

Happy hour is available all day Sundays, and found that CRAVE had quite a few items offered between $3 and $6. We ordered 3 dishes, the pesto chicken flatbread, the Korean nuggets, and the bacon cheddar tater tots.

The Korean nuggets had a good flavor, however the breading was falling apart and quite mushy. It definitely needed to be cooked to a crispier finish. 

The bacon cheddar tots are not what you may expect. I was thinking it would be a crispy tot with bacon and cheddar melted on top, however, the bacon and cheddar were actually inside the tots. The tots had mashed potato consistency on the inside. The flavor was good, however it was served on such a large plate, that it looked rather unappealing. 

In  contrast, the flatbread was larger than the plate it was served on. It had an okay flavor, however it is not something I would actually ever CRAVE. 

Overall, the happy hour food and drinks are cheap, but so is the quality. I would say you get what you pay for, however, I still think I overpaid.

Food is good but the wait sometimes for the food to come to the table can be really long. Don't come here if you need to make it to a movie or don't have time to wait. Otherwise the food and drinks are good and they offer lots of nice deals. Happy hours is nice. I love their sushi menu!

Don't bother....seriously. Decided to go to "crave" on a Sunday night for a quick dinner with my fiancé. Did I say quick? Because it wasn't, service is extremely slow and not professional. But that's only the beginning, we first ordered crab artichoke dip and it tasted old. For entree I had a ribeye steak medium rare, came out medium with Luke warm mashed potatoes and barley edible Brussels sprouts. The "lobster linguine" is a joke, and tasted like death. Overall don't bother going.

I ate here on a Monday for lunch.  We sat in the bar and the service was excellent.  The food was fine.  I ordered the prosciutto and fig flatbread and the crave side salad.  It was good but didn't blow my mind.  I would go back again and order something else.  My friend ordered the chipotle salad and that looked amazing.  Our server was friendly and prompt.

This place is sort of a hit or miss...  my 10 year old daughter and I went together.  It was not particularly a kid friendly restaurant. Upper scale atmosphere with overpriced, undersized meals... my daughter had an $18  (very SMALL portion) of fried rice with chicken.  It was yummy but the flavor (including kimchi) was a bit mature for kids..we weren't given a kids menu so I don't know if one was even available.   I ordered the cioppino.  $27 for what seemed like a few tablespoons of broth, 2 nice sized shrimp, 4 over- cooked mussels and a few tiny scallops.  I'm quite aware that I live in the land of buffets and oversized portions but this was a bit extreme in the opposite direction.  I sent back the cioppino and ordered the bison burger.  Yes it was filling and delicious, but again...$$$ plus extra for the fries. Drinks ...also pricy.  All in all not a great experience for me and my girl.   Perhaps better for a romantic date if you are not concerned with price.
The sea bass plate was overpriced and not worth it, the burger was OK.

Hello and welcome to Crave. We were greeted and seated promptly, hostess was very friendly. We were early for our reservation but they were able to work with us and provide us a seat. We came the day before Valentines day for a Prix Fix dinner for two. Price was 89.00 before taxes and drinks. Our waiter Jake came right away and gave us water and requested a drink order. We had not seen beverage list and asked him to return. He came back soon after took drink order.( was very impressed with his service considering how busy he was). I want very hard to describe Crave. Its not upscale, or bistro. Has a bar in front open restaurant with open kitchen. It was loud and hard to talk over the din at times. They were quite busy and despite that they did have great service. The Prix Fix Menu had choice 4 items for starter and 4 items for entree and the desert was a duo that came together. Starters were for us Bronzed Scallops and Coffee and Pepper Crusted Petite Tender in Chocolate Port Sauce. The Scallops were perfectly cooked however had a fishy smell that I am not used to with Scallops. They did taste good and were rightly cooked. The Petite Tenders were cooked mid rare and the Chocolate Port sauce was very interesting. When added with the Coffee pepper rub on the meat it gave it a sweet mocha taste. Not bad just different.
Entree....Salmon and shrimp Duo and New York strip. Jake did not ask how I wanted my steak cooked. When I told him Mid Rare he stated "is there any other way". So be warned if you want a more cooked piece of meat (and why would you) you must ask. Mid rare is their way. (Yay). Steak was actually bigger than I expected for a Prix Fix dinner. Had great flavor, the red wine reduction was quite nice also. Garlic mashed and Asparagus. Asparagus was nicely cooked on the grill and properly flavored. Josie had The Salmon and Shrimp. Both cooked perfectly. The shrimp had a crispy skin that added perfectly to each bite. There was a carrot Ginger puree' under the Salmon. The flavor of the puree' is hard to describe. Almost like a pumpkin spice but not as bitter. I kept wanting to eat off of Josie's plate. 
Dessert....Duo of Chocolate cake and a Passion Fruit Creme Brulee. The cake was okay, the Brule was grainy and flavor was more Lemon than passion fruit. 
All in all it was a good meal and experience. Service was excellent and food was quite filling. Again very impressed with the portion size for Prix Fix meal. We will return again. If you are shopping or going to a movie in Downtown Summerlin it's a good eating spot.

The ambiance was nice, the service was excellent, but the food I'm sad to say was disappointing. My girlfriend and I ordered the lettuce wraps which were the best of everything although the meat was tough and surprisingly hard to chew. We ordered a burger which was lacking flavor on every level, she ordered scallops she wasn't impressed with, and then we shared S'more brownies which I was most excited about, but the brownie was dry and crumbly, the graham crackers made the dryness worse, and the ice cream flavor didn't help matters. If the place wasn't as pricey as it is, it would be easy to say we got what we paid for. But it's been a while since I've been to a place where each dish that came out was more disappointing than the last. Definitely a bummer.

We have had two great experiences at Crave.  The service is excellent and especially our last time there with our server Cassandra.  She was very engaged and quick to help us with any issue.  We had the filet and the chicken stir fry and there was quite a bit of chicken in the dish.  Excellent.  It might be our favorite of the new Downtown Summerlin restaurants.

It's a beautiful Sunday we were so happy to sit on the patio have a couple of drinks and eat some food.  We waited 10 min for water 20 min for our drinks,  when I picked up my beer I looked at my hand and I had blood on my fingers I first checked myself to make sure I wasn't bleeding then when I realized it wasn't my blood I was immediately very disturbed the lady said she would speak to get manager who never came out. Finally I asked to speak to the manager who said none of her staff were bleeding. It was a horrible customer service experience I would definitely recommend for your health and well being don't eat at this restaurant. If this is how they treat this situation what is happening behind the scenes.

My wife and I frequent the Downtown Summerlin mall all the time with out dogs but this time we went out on a date night. We wanted to try something different and settled on Crave. The restaurant was a little busy but there was no wait for at table outside, which was nice because the weather was beautiful. We looked at the menu, which seemed to be a bit all over the place but we eventually settled on a few different items. My wife had a ginger martini, which was really good and I had a boring iced tea, which I actually thought was pretty good for just plain iced tea.

My wife ordered a Calimari appetizer and a seared tuna salad of some sort. I started off with a spicy tuna roll and then a Traditional Poke Bowl. 

While our server was very friendly, she was also absent a lot and things took a very long time to come out. We were thirsty so we downed our drinks fast and had to ask for refills constantly. One time someone brought me an iced tea with no ice in it. The server caught it and got me a replacement. Again, she was VERY nice, but considering how many staff members were running around, I was a bit surprised how un-attentive everyone was. After a while, our calamari and tuna roll came out.  The Calamari was breaded nicely and was tasty. The roll though, was so small I almost needed a microscope just to find it on the plate. While it did taste good and the tuna had some good heat to it, I was a bit shocked at how minuscule the portion was. It was as if someone cut a tootsie roll into six pieces. 

After another 15 minutes, our other dishes came out...the salad and the poke bowl. It seemed as though my wife's order was pretty good all around but mine, not so much. Her salad looked OK and she seemed generally "meh" about it but my poke bowl, coming in at a 15 dollar price tag, was laughable. There was maybe 2 tablespoons of sushi plopped on top of some salad greens. The tuna was cut so small I almost had to eat this with a spoon. I've never seen a poke bowl served this poorly. I eat at poke bowl places all the time where, for 1/2 the price, you get 3X the portion. 

We ate, and then waited around another 10 minutes after for our check, which we had to ask for. While dessert would have probably been an option, we didn't want to wait until the end of the season for it to arrive so we figured we'd have that elsewhere in the mall. All in all, an $85 dinner and when we left, we were still hungry. I'm embarrassed to admit this but for the price, we could have gone to Olive Garden and had a much nicer dinner for less money, and that is pretty sad. Our consensus is that we would never return to this restaurant.

I was a little worried about going here after seeing all the bad reviews, but hubby and I got a coupon in the mail for a free entree and figured we'd check it out. So glad we did! The staff were friendly, the food was delicious, and the chef even subbed out mashed potatoes for a risotto that sounded amazing at no charge. I had salmon and hubby had jambalaya. Could not be happier with our meals!  

Service was great until the place got busy, and then slowed down quite a bit as other people stated. So yes, do not go there if it's busy and you are in a hurry. The staff is great, just overwhelmed when tables fill up. Be patient. Order another glass of wine. You'll be fine.

My husband and I had dinner here for the first time, on Saturday night, 2/11. The hostess was friendly & our waiter was helpful & knowledgeable. The food & wine were very good! We ordered sushi rolls & cucumber salad. I usually find that sushi is too big for one bite, but these were just right & they even had rolls I'd never had before. So yummy & nice presentation!

Really sad about writing this review because I was excited to try this place out. The food was not flavorful at all. We ordered different sushi rolls, the mac and cheese and steak. The steak was so bland. It was like they just threw it on the grill and plated it. The only good sushi roll was the dynamite roll. The service was horrible. They did not check on us or bother to give us one of our missing sushi rolls. All in all, I would rather drive to Chinatown to eat sushi. If you're a big sushi fan, don't come here. You will be disappointed. It's over priced for low quality.

Ugh. This review is long overdue. I purchased a Livingsocial voucher for Crave. The deal was $58 for a three course dinner for two that included an appetizer, entree, and a dessert from a select menu. My husband and I came to Crave to celebrate our 10-year anniversary together. 

CRAVE STARTER SALAD ($7.95): The ingredients sounded exciting but the salad tasted pretty average. Nothing special here. 3/5
POBLANO CAESAR SALAD ($7.95): The polenta croutons were an interesting touch and the mister approved of the salad. 3.5/5

GRILLED MAHI MAHI ($26.95): He thought it was alright but complained that the shrimp was really rubbery. 3/5
LOBSTER LINGUINE ($28.95): Got it without the lobster, of course. The truffled butter sauce was extremely rich and got old real quick. After the third bite I was not feeling this entree at all. 2/5

COCONUT CAKE ($7.95): The cake looks beautiful but tastes like a store bought cake. I was really disappointed. 2/5

VIBE: Crave is a nicer restaurant with a fancy bar and a proper staff. The bathrooms are gorgeous. On a Tuesday evening, the place was nearly empty. I found it interesting that upon getting seated, our server handed us warm moist towels to clean our hands. That's a first. 4/5 

SERVICE: Started off with a bang but faded off into obscurity. Our waiter disappeared and it took a while to get refills and get the check. 2.5/5

Worth a Return Visit?
After all was said and done, me and my husband agreed that even with the Livingsocial deal, our meal wasn't worth what we paid for. Nah, we won't come back. The highlight of the meal for me was the salad. Nuff said.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #136

Honestly I don't know why there so many bad reviews but I had a great experience. We sat at the bar for happy hour and the bartender was super friendly and helpful. Everything we ordered off the happy hour menu was delicious. I definitely will be back and try the full menu next time.

Very poor service. The waiter was extremely slow and inattentive. When our food finally came it was cold and we sent it back. Not very pleased with management ( I can only assume they had a manager, but I never actually saw one). We certainly will never go back. There are too many good restaurants in Las Vegas to waste our time and money on this one.

Second visit, they're heading downhill. Service was still pretty good, but the food quality is slipping. Sushi was warm, should be room temp or preferably a little chilled. Paella had a strong vinegar taste. I've made paella and I don't recall adding any vinegar. If it's supposed to contain vinegar, then it has way too much.

Very expensive for bland low quality food. We had the lamb meatballs(very dry) and the sea bass (lacking flavor) and also the street tacos( fatty meat). Didn't meet my expectations for the price we paid

This place is always delicious with excellent customer service! It's mine and my fiance's go to spot, for great quality dinner at a very reasonable price! Everyone always seems happy to be there serving us! We've gone multiple times and bring others with us and will continue to... I spent my birthday there last night and requested the booth with the curtains, it was a great night with superb service! I had the best birthday. We love CRAVE! Make sure to try the bamboo bites..

Crave - a strong desire/ yearning for something (usually food, experience). 

This was one of the first few restaurants that opened in Downtown Summerlin and I remember this place being so busy it was so hard to get in. My sister made a reservation for lunch. A few friends of mine warned me about the taste of the food but it was too late and I'm pretty stubborn.

I just had a great shopping trip at my favorite store nearby. I was happy. We walked in and the host took us through a maze of high tables and high chairs. Did you not see my big shopping bags and yoga mat I was knocking things on the tables with? Why would you seat us at cramped tables when you have booths available? Lack of perception and care. Woosah!

CRAVE Grilled Chicken Salad:
Candied walnuts, goat cheese, field greens, grilled chicken breast with balsamic vinaigrette. I was leaning towards the Baby Kale and Steak Salad but this had the place's name in it so, it must be a must-have item, right? Not really. Everything that does not require cooking was ok but the chicken was dry. 2/5

Norwegian Salmon Salad:
Couscous, salmon, quinoa, pomegranate, pickled grapes and wilted spinach. The chef must not be good at checking for meat temperature and doneness. The outside of the fish was cooked but a big portion of the core was not. The manager got involved and offered another piece of cooked salmon. Why can't you just get it right the first time? 1/5

Nigiri:
My sister got salmon and escolar (super white). I didn't have any. The cuts looked good and the fish seemed fresh. I won't ever touch escolar due to its natural laxative properties - I don't need that!

I normally would try to be understanding of things. Mistake after mistake...after we were done, I was yearning for my bathroom. I had plans to continue shopping with my sister but I had to go. I guess it didn't matter if I ate escolar or not, the food here has the same effect. I don't CRAVE for pain and suffering that's for sure. Holy borborygmus, I gotta go!

Love this place, food was really good, service excellent. Beautiful atmosphere with the wait staff always attentive. If u are a person who loves sushi try this restaurant out, not a large menu but a subtle dining experience.
Food was great, interior is very nice and clean, server was fast and friendly, I definitely will return for the appetizer pizza!

The service was pretty good and I would've called it perfect if the server would have mentioned that the crab cakes came with a side salad.  We probably wouldn't have ordered the house salad if we'd known. We tried the margarita flatbread, the crab cakes, the house salad and the butterscotch pudding. I guess being in the business myself has made me a bit of a picky diner. I wouldn't go back to Crave because the meal we ordered was not worth the $43 bill. The only thing I really liked was the crab cakes and I didn't think they were worth 15 or 16 dollars. They tried to put their own spin on butterscotch pudding. I didn't care for it at all. It was served with an oatmeal cookie than looked and tasted like it came out of a box. I didn't like the margarita flatbread either. The sauce tasted really strange and not pleasant. There's too many dining choices in that area to go back and give them a second chance. We were there on a Friday night and the place was dead so I'm thinking that I'm not the only one thinking the place is not worth the money.

The service was fine but the food was on a fast food level.  The sushi looked and tasted old.  Fries were soggy. There are just way too many great restaurants in Vegas to even think about ever going back. Disappointing.

Front desk seemed a little confused and unorganized. We walked in at lunch time and left my name and number and was told that the table should be ready in about 20 minutes and that I will be receiving a text from them. We took a stroll around the area and went into a couple of the stores nearby to kill some time. 50 minutes had passed by and still no text. My boyfriend and I remembered that there was a BJ's across the street. We went there instead. No regrets (:

I know that this place had just opened up. So hopefully they get it together.
Didn't disappoint!!..Crave is a must but grab a manhattan to chase down that burger!!...

Great place for the couple where 1 person loves sushi and the other not so much, they can get anything from pasta to a burger and I can get my sushi fix! Rolls aren't too bad def recommend the aloha roll and tuna poke. Tuna is super fresh and was great. Service is great and white sangria was delicious and not too sweet. My only complaint is that it's a tad pricey, but I'm ok with as long as service stays decent.

I had the bison burger with pork belly. The pork belly was under cooked and I got severe food poisoning, which worked out great since it was Christmas eve. I had the worst holiday ever on the toilet.

Besides the food poisoning, the menu is all over the place, the ambience is nothing special, and the food is a bit over priced. I hope this place goes out of business ASAP. Oh, the server took 15 minutes to get my beer as well and they weren't even packed.

This place is GARBAGE.

Our food took so long to come out. On top of that, it comes out and the order was wrong but I was too hungry and exhausted to complain. We paid $15 a plate. The service was very slow even though there weren't very many people in there. Definitely not worth it.

I have been to CRAVE about a half dozen times.  The ambiance is upscale yet comfortable.  The service is always impeccable and the menu has a wide variety for all tastes.  The sushi is very fresh and well done but the offerings are limited. Most of the items either have a deep fried component or spicy mayo, so you might choose another option if those aren't your taste.  The steaks are excellent.  I tried the beef stroganoff most recently and it was good but not great.

It was okay.  Seated quickly...a plus since it was Friday night.  First time here.  Really needed more guidance on specialty entrees  and menu.  Other then specials for charities really didn't get any--note to wait staff.  Drink was Strong!  Appetizers good.  But needed to leave before entrees arrived - because drink was Strong.  They we're packed for take out.  Ate them for lunch, but found them to be nothing special. 
Have to admit it is a large beautiful place.  Wish the food would match.

Update on the update. 
Social media person keeps letting me know that management will contact me.  Because they don't. It's only making me more upset.  Total disregard for their customers
Update almost a year later.
I received a message last week via FB asking for my contact info from Crave.
The message asked for my contact info so new management could contact me regarding our horrible experience.  Well as expected. No one has contacted me.
I had almost forgotten about Crave which was a good thing. Then Crave opens the old can of worms.  The worst customer service I've experienced in years
Fathers Day Dinner
Priceless
We Ordered wine
20 minutes later told there was no wine glasses.
Our Salads sat over 10 minutes at the pass.
We Had to get server to bring them to the table. 
the server Never brought steak knifes nor horseradish. We were supposed to cut our meat with a dull regular knife.
Our granddaughters order sat at the pass for over 10 minutes prior to getting our meal. We had to go up and get it ourself after everyone else had their meals. 
Server was pretty much non existent
Friend Asked for 2nds on prime rib & never received it. Mind you it was all you can eat and there was so much fat she only had a couple of bites from the first piece.
Childs is meal advertised as free on Sunday's. They charged us for it.
We Ordered 2 desserts 5 minutes later we were told the creme brûlée was sold out
We Never received 2nd dessert. 
They didn't deduct anything from the bill.
Food presentation was pathetic.
The diners next to us were so pissed that the gentleman told manager that Crave ruined his life. 
Seriously. 
This has to be one of the worst meals ever.
Happy Fathers Day my A** 
Sent from my iPad

Not worth the hype :( me and my friends desiderate to eat here...well food quality was good, I order there burger I give it a 8/10 services was 2/10 we couldn't even order deserts because  it was taking forever to serve us the place was nice, I decided to park valet, well I had to run to get my car because they close at 9pm kind of dumb when the restaurant close at 10pm kind of  expensive for the experience, will not be back again.

This place is an upscale American/Asian diner. 

The service was friendly and attentive. The meals was delicious. Our party had the chicken wings (yum), sushi (fresh), and the restaurants signature cocktails.

Food was  good , service was HORRIBLE .... waitress only had 4 tables in the whole place as it wasn't busy !! 

and we still waited 15 minutes for water / soda refill..while she walked by the table numerous times.

Watched her talk to other staff and have something to eat with the hostess ... unfortunate !!

The spinach dip for appetizer was so dry, and same with the sushi and burger we ordered. Didn't bother ordering dessert anymore, and definitely also did not bother signing up for the loyalty rewards because I know I will not come back.

This was my second visit to CRAVE. Both times I had the pesto goat cheese hummus and it is by far the best hummus I have ever had. Do yourself a favor and order it! I also had the tempura veggie roll with cream cheese and it was excellent. My husband ordered a burger and requested no cheese. Our waitress told him it doesn't come with cheese, but unfortunately, when he got it, it had cheese on it. The waitress apologized profusely, got him another burger, and gave us a $10 off coupon for our next visit which will hopefully be soon!

Everyone has the same idea about this place--3 Stars. We went over to crave after looking at the menu because Wolf Gang was closed. Upon entering, the restaurant looks pretty nice. It's interesting because craves menu has a bunch of diff options: tacos, sushi, Korean BBQ, burgers...we thought, what the hell? 

As an appetizer, we ordered jalapeño citrus yellowtail. Prob the best thing we ordered. The fish and mandarin orange sat on top of thinly sliced cucumber. It was so refreshing! 5 TINY pieces for like $12-$13? Also ordered the tomato soup, good but not memorable.

My husband ordered the 702 burger. He said "it was good." It had egg, candied bacon, red onions, spinach, tomato jam. It was really large, he had to cut and eat it with a fork lol.

I ordered Blackened mahi tacos. First off, it wasn't blackened, it was good, nothing exceptional. It had like a corn/jalapeño salsa...good but definitely lacked flavor. 

Our son had the quesadilla with fries. He didn't like either but that's just because he's picky and tired. 

There is an advertisement on every table that says like half price bottled wine on certain days, kids eat free Sun-Tues 11am-close etc. When we got our bill, our sons food was on the ticket which was fine but we asked the waitress do they not do this on holidays? She came back and said management would honor it even though they do not usually do this for holidays. So that was nice.

There are better options. I probably would only come back if every other restaurant was packed and I couldn't wait for a seat. Not bad, just nothing special.

I ordered the wedge salad and a 702-burger. The wedge salad was average at best-nothing special. The $17 burger was excellent! The sushi was ok but way overpriced.

Like many reviewers commented, the service is very poor. The food takes FOREVER to come out - even on a Tuesday, early evening with very few customers. This poor service is going to be their downfall.

Went here with a group from work. Food was okay, although not as good as I expected. Service was fair. I'll try then again but I'm not overly impressed. The restaurant wad comfortable with a nice decor.

I'm not impressed with this place. The food is way overpriced and the flavor & taste is mediocre. Service was slow & lack of attention to detail. We had to ask our server for more water. They brought the dessert out way before we were done with our meal.

While it appears to be of something awesome by its outer and inner appearance, sadly, it wasn't for me with the food. BUT!

But here goes to my fair judgment. First impression, 5 stars! From the time we entered, to the hostess seating us and so forth...wonderful! I was excited to stare at the menu. The menu wasn't overwhelming nor was it needing more. Remember, tis all an opinion! 

I was tossing between a bison burger which has pork belly, cilantro, and a couple more add-ons that I can't recall. I just kept reading pork belly, pork belly, pork belly. Lol. Not one to eat pork too often, although, I do enjoy some good home fried or bbq pork belly a few times in a year. So, passed on the bison burger. I ended up ordering the chicken caprese sandwich which is basically chicken, mozzarella, arugula, tomatoes, a drizzle of the balsamic glaze, and placed in tandoori bread. Which is pretty much a pita bread.

How boring I know. But I love caprese anything! Simple ingredients but it could easily be messed up! Plus, it was 7 something at night and i didnt really have the stomach for a burger even though deep down inside i was longing for one. 

When I received my order I thought, aww....this looks deelish. I took a bite and thought damn, I need more of that balsamic glaze because there were droplets of it in my sandwich and I needed more since I could barely taste the balsamic. Waved our waiter down and he happily gave me more. Which by the way our waiter was always in sight!  Alright, so more glaze to drench this sandwich in. 

I didn't really care for this type of sandwich with the tandoori bread. It felt sloppy. It was like eating this giant taco with each bite I had to ensure I gripped that sucker or else it'd fall apart. Annnnd if you didn't bite into it methodically it could get messy. But, probably because I added a little more glaze? Not sure. But it was a little uncomfortable biting into considering it is labeled as a sandwich.

The fries were crispy with a mush. I don't even know how that happens, but I liked it. Didn't get the parmesan fries for a 2.5 dollar upgrade...so regular fries it was. 

I can only offer 2 stars because of the staff and ambiance. My food wasn't something that blew me away or thought, hell yes I'll be back for THAT caprese sandwich. The husband ordered the sandwich that had the apples, brie, and grapes? He usually likes that combo but he too thought twas pretty basic. It truely felt it lacked effort. I mean, how exciting can you make a caprese sandwich. Believe me, I've had perfectly executed caprese whether twas a salad, slider, flatbread, bruschetta, etc....you get it. This really was pretty blunt.

Will I be back? Ummm....maybe just to try the other things in hopes to up my review. How soon? Probably not that soon because there are so much more other eateries there for me to experience first. Will I recommend it? Ummm...probably wouldn't be a place during a convo where I'd even mention it! Nothing memorable. But I wouldn't count them out only because it was my first time there and I only tried 1
 food off their item. 

I do love, though, how they serve each child a bowl of complimentary fruit as all the adults read through the menu. They were very quick to bring that out. That's the way to shut these gremlins up so us adults can focus. Lol.

You try for yourself kind of place.

Definitely kid and stroller friendly! Oh, and a highchair with an actual working buckle!

We received a coupon in the mail & decided to give this place a shot. Made reservations for a Saturday night date night. We showed up & waited for our table for about 10 minutes, with reservations but it was a Saturday night so I guess we let that slide. Our waitress was overly stressed out. We ordered drinks and chips & guac. My margarita came in a tumbler, no salt, very little tequila. Our guac was served with shredded lettuce which I found to be odd.
