Honey ordered steak, I got steak medallions with asparagus. Food was barely warm when we finally got it, but they were nice cuts of meat. Didn't do dessert because the wait times for even water were just too long. We won't be going back anytime soon.
What a disappointment. Slow service, boneless chicken wings on happy hour taste like McDonald's. What happened to this place. Soooo sad.

Overall
   My first and second time dining here were both amazing experiences! During my first visit, my coworker and I had just finished shopping around and were looking for a place to eat and we decided to give Crave a try. Having a wonderful experience there the first time, I told my parents about it and they ate there for lunch for a meeting and soon called me over as well; ending again with a wonderful experience. I definitely recommend this restaurant, but just watch out a bit for the pricing. 

Wait Time & Customer Service
   Hostesses are alright in my opinion, and the wait for us wasn't as long as some other reviewers (do note that it was only the two of us) had experienced; I waited around 10 minutes for an indoor seat my first visit, which isn't bad. The indoors looked pretty classy. Our waitress was absolutely amazing, she was friendly, knowledgable and very attentive. 
   We received exemplary customer service; During our first visit with my coworker the manager paid for one of our desserts just because we couldn't decide between two of their desserts. He (the manager) did initially think that my coworker and I were on a date though, so I believe this would be a great place for a date knowing that the manager's trying to make your date run as smoothly as it can. I don't know if the manager does this 24/7 but, during the first visit the manager was roaming around the restaurant, checking on the customers constantly. I gave the biggest tip I've ever given a restaurant here. 
   During the second visit with my family, again, we had exemplary service. We were seated outdoors at the patio. I don't know if it was super busy that specific day, or if the waiters and waitresses for the patios are just less organized. Our waiter for that day was friendly as well but wasn't as attentive. A few times different waiters came to our table with something that wasn't ours (but all of the food we had ordered had been served already) and at some point went from table to table asking if they had ordered what she was carrying. It wasn't bad though, we're all human and they just opened so there will always be a few kinks here and there. I overall definitely recommend this restaurant.

Food
  During my first visit I had the Filet Mignon, which by the way, is the best Filet Mignon I've ever had! It was very juicy and had lots of flavor, I find their Filet Mignon better than Cheesecake Factory's (and Crave's Mignon is a bit bigger). It's accompanied with "potato puree, caramelized brussels sprouts, [and] topped with garlic butter" which is a perfect (I guess you would call it) side to the dish. My coworker had the Ribeye which is also accompanied with the same sides as the Mignon. I had a taste of his Ribeye and it was pretty delicious too I'd give the Ribeye about four stars and the Mignon five stars. We also ordered the sushi, Godzilla. Very delicious. I'd give that about five stars as well. 
   With the desserts that night, we had the Smore's Brownie and Signature Cheesecake. We devoured the smores, and we didn't really eat much of the cheesecake. The smores had the perfect balance of sweet flavors: five stars. The cheesecake was ok but nothing really special: three stars. 
   During my second visit I initially wanted to have the Filet Mignon again (it's that good) however, I'm a person who loves to try new things so I went for the Pork Tenderloin instead. The Tenderloins were not as delicious. It was kind of dry, but manageable, nothing really special in my opinion: three stars. 
   My Father had Half Roasted Chicken, which was absolutely delicious; I took a taste of it as well! It contains rice, bits of grilled pineapple, and "jalapeno orange glaze". The chicken was juicy and seasoned deliciously, and with the pineapple and the orange glaze it tasted delicious altogether: five stars! My Mother had the Chicken Stir Fry, (which again, I had a taste of. I'm a foodie) it was okay for me, around three stars. My Mother however found it to be too salty for her, and asked if she could have something else (which they happily obliged) and then ordered the Half Roasted Chicken.
    Both times that I was here I had some tea with peach in it (different drinks) the first one was mixed with raspberry I believe, and it was okay. The plain peach tea was not sweet enough for me, so it'll be good for those who like not-too-sweet drinks. Wait time for the food wasn't that long as well, pretty average wait time for a restaurant. 
   The food overall? 4.5 Stars

Pricing
   The prices of the food here are kind of pricy, but my coworker and I thought it was worth it; I think they would have even more business if they maybe lowered the prices a bit. The bill for my coworker and I came up to the low $100, with the cheesecake being free (Filet Mignon, Ribeye, Godzilla, Cheesecake, Smores, Peach tea, Raspberry  tea). I do not know of the total bill for the lunch meeting during my second visit, but as far as I know, there were no complaints.

Been here many, many times. Love the happy hour. We came here for lunch and ordered off the regular menu recently. Most from my party had burgers. They enjoyed them and said they were juicy and full of flavor. I had sushi, which was great as always. Our waitress made us some sort of lemonade concoction she recommend...turned out to be delicious AND bottomless! 

The only thing I noticed was the hostess (seemed to be new) disappeared from her booth. We could see the main entrance from where we were seated. We noticed a family with two small girls waiting around to be seated for almost 15 minutes. The bartender eventually saw them and apologized. That's the only down-side I saw. Even when it gets slow, make sure your hostess is where she's supposed to be. 

Otherwise, great food and service at our table! Will be back.
A half-hour wait, expected on a Friday evening.  Menu contained a good mixture of American and Japanese selections.  Kids entrees were on the house.

Crave for lunch and drinks. My friend and I had the Hoshii Boat which is a small boat and a small amount of sushi. We also had the scallop poppers which is baked scallops wrapped in salmon with dynamite sauce it was delicious. I have to say I will be back for the drinks. My friend and I enjoyed the white sangria  it was refreshing!  I would also like to try other dishes on the menu. Our waitress was also super nice made us feel comfortable and was friendly.

This place has so much potential. The service was good and we were seated right away. The crab and artichoke dip wasn't bad but the 2 bento boxes and the premium bento box were terrible. The panko shrimp was basically all panko. The sushi tasted fishy. I was going to give the place a second chance but when i saw the bill i changed my mind. For the price we payed and the location, I was expecting a lot more. I'm not saying that you shouldn't go and give crave a chance but, yeah i was a little disappointed.

I am giving it three stars mostly because it was a terrible value.  The service was pretty good.  Not stellar but I had no complaints.  The food was good.  I mean really good but not OMG amazing.  We split a chicken salad which was the star of the meal.  14 bucks for a lunch portion salad.  We each orders the sushi lunch combo which is a midi soup, one 6 piece roll and 4 pieces of nigiri.  Again, it was all tasty and presented well.  14 bucks each for the combos.  Just ordered water to drink in order to better enjoy the Unami of the sushi.  Total bill.....almost 24 bucks each so all in 28 dollars for lunch.   To me, a bit overpriced considering the choices Vegas has to offer.  

I don't consider myself a cheapskate, so I think I am pretty accurate in my value ratio.  The food was good, not a single complaint.......it just wasn't 28 dollars of good.

The worst service ever wait to be greeted like 15 to 20 minutes after that I had two different servers both of them in bad mood I just paid my wine and left I was here before really enjoy service and food no any more

After reading the reviews I was kind of skeptical to try this place out. Most people complained about long waits to get seated and for food to come out. But as a new restaurant I know they're probably still adjusting and learning so I tried anyways.

I was not disappointed.  We did get seated immediately,  I guess we were lucky. I had a hard time deciding so our waiter helped us decide. I wanted a burger so he highly recommended the bison burger.  And if anyone is planning on eating there, please please please try it. It was the best burger I ever had! 

The peach ice tea on the other hand did not taste good. It wasn't sweet at all. So I don't recommend that. 

Price was a little high I must say

But other than that it was good. I will be going back in the future. We had excellent customer service when I went

Don't bother,I'm not sure what was worse,the service,the prices  or the food
Slow service ,overpriced menu and terrible food
Sent back the raw chicken pesto and choked down an ice cold burger

Wow, all three entrees ordered - Poke bowl, fried rice, and penne pasta with chicken - were totally uninspired, bland, overpriced, and arrived after more than 30 minutes when they weren't that busy. How they stay open is a mystery.

Food was good service is horrible. After being told we would be text in 30 mins when our table was ready we went outside to wait. 40 minutes went by and no text, no one came outside. So we went inside and they said we wrote your number down wrong. Your table is ready.  We waited another 15minutes for our table. We finally ordered, meals were coming out except they for got to serve our main course. 1 hour and 30 minutes later we decide to go. Manager comes to our table to apologize stating the kitchen thought they served us our main course. We were given our meals to go. I was very disappointed seeing this was our first time eating here and it was Valentine's Day dinner. Someone needs to be fired as the management here and food expeditors were relatively nonexistent. Very disorganized.

Dined here over the holidays with a out of town friend. We arrived fairly early in the evening via the back door and were seated at a high top. I will tell you this, the chairs to the high tops stink! They are super uncomfortable and not a lot of room for your booty! The menu offers a huge variety of choices and the Happy Hour menu is decent.  Since it was happy hour, this is the menu we stuck with. We ordered up a sampling of sushi, miso soup, edamame for our first go round. I really appreciated our server advising us of which dishes she felt were the best. Note to self, never order sushi unless you are in a sushi house! I was sorely disappointed with the sushi and let my friend eat most of it. The miso soup had the oddest taste and I could not finish it. The edamame was ok but how much can you screw up edamame?? We then tried the lemon garlic wings and the mini pesto chicken flat bread which were actually quite tasty and these made up for the poor tasting sushi. The wine choices were the best part of my experience at CRAVE. The "Freakshow" Cabernet was so yummy. We had to have a couple of glasses. This is a wine I have always wanted to try and it did not disappoint. Overall the service was A++. Our server was attentive and friendly and we enjoyed talking about wine with her. As we lingered, the restaurant began to fill up with holiday shoppers and then they had to move our table which we didn't mind as "The Human Jukebox" was setting up to provide some holiday fun and entertainment. He made the night, by playing all kinds or requests from holiday to classics. I may go back again in the future to try an actual entree as the location of this restaurant is very close to where I live which makes it a convenient place to have a bite.

We made a reservation for a party of 6 adults at 5:30 pm ,  upon arriving the table was not set yet - even though restaurant was fairly empty.
Got seated in the back behind the bar and 
Sat there the staff kept looking at our table as to who was going to be our server ! 
Finally someone came over to help us , we ordered 
Well the whole time it was freezing in the restaurant we all kept out jackets on no a very comfortable eating setting.
3 of us ordered salads which on the menu had a variety of stuff in each ,  where ? 
The portions were very small compared to the price paid !!!!!!!!!!!!!
Cheap with the avocado that was supposed to be included in the salad maybe a few pieces .
Also a few sushi rolls were ordered and guess what had to pay extra for ponzu sauces , who does that i never heard of this before . 

Wanted cappuccino after the small meal waitress said machine is broken and referred us to a clothing store with a cafe in it .


Well sorry CRAVE won't be back ,  pay all that money and leave hungry does not work with me !

Did not have a good experience here last night. Ordered sushi, and while the waitress was very sweet and did what she could, the sushi took far too long and was far too overpriced for the quality of the food and sushi service. It took 15 min for miso soup, over 40 mins for our sushi (small sushi plate, 4 rolls and caterpillar role) and over 1 hour for the tempura bites. When the manager stopped by, he only apologized for the wait. It's common practice in the restaurant industry to comp some part of the meal. On an $80 dinner, only the tempura bites were comped ($6), which was told to us by our waitress. Supremely disappointed with our choice, will not be coming back and i will be advising anyone who asks about this restaurant to do themselves a favor and go to an AYCE restaurant where you will get the same quality at a better price!

Gr8 selection of dishes.  Lunch is a bargain w/big servings.  Dinner prices go up for same portions.  Service is good.  I like the salmon, chicken brie sandwich and sushi.  Spacious and beautiful ambience w/nice tables and booths.  Gr8 bar and happy hour.
I loved the salmon salad!  So good I wanted to lick the plate clean.  Granted, the service was a bit off but our server was nice.  The truffle fries were YUM.  I would go back just for the salad.

The atmosphere vibe and service are amazing.
The bread basket is very tasty.

I orders the BLT....really very good.

I love the place and will definitely be back.

My wife and I had a fantastic time Friday night at Crave - we eat alot of restaurants in Vegas and also base alot of dinner outings on Yelp reviews. I heard some good things about this place but with a 2.5 rating I was a little skeptical. This rating proved to be wrong. The whole night was perfect from the food and decor to the waiter (Marianna). Starting off with bread basket, sashimi (very fresh yellowtail)  and crab cakes the cakes were very tasty and the jalapeno tartar sauce went perfect with them. Dinner was Mahi Mahi for my wife and I had the Sea Bass. Both pieces cooked perfectly and the sauces that accented both were spot on. The flavors all just worked perfectly together on both plates. Desserts were tiramisu and I want to say a hazelnut pudding? Cant recall but it was a bit grain for my taste, but the flavor was good. Tiramisu was not too traditional but again really flavorful. We ended the night with Almond Coffee which was really a great ending note and was pretty damn good - we had to have a second one before heading out.

On a side note Drinks were all perfect from the bar and their mixed drink menu was pretty good - ginger lime Margarita is worth trying. The biggest plus of the night was our waitress Marianna - probably one of the best we have encountered at any restaurant and was on top of everything throughout the night. From recommendations paired with drinks to explanations of each dish she was all around worth asking for on your next visit. 

Dont base this place on the 2.5 stars it has right now - these will go up. There was obviously some issues upon opening which any restaurant will have - especially when you try to match ticket times from a main kitchen to a sushi kitchen. I was a chef for years in Las Vegas and observe what goes on in restaurants very closely when I visit - they have obviously pulled it together here - its worth the visit.

My first time here and I wasn't disappointed.  Our waiter, Jordan, was very attentive and quick(and witty too). He answered all our questions and made sure that our drinks were never empty.  The food was also very delicious and we didn't have to wait very long for it either.  I ordered the 702 Burger and my friend got the Bison Burger. We even made sure to ask for a side of ranch when we ordered or food and didn't have to remind our waiter about it because he had it on our plates upon delivery.   Although it is a bit pricey, the delicious food and excellent customer service make it worth every penny.

UPDATE: I had received a message from the company and sent them my info but did not get any response back. I have not returned here. I am not looking for anything from them but would like to state that i haven't had the chance to give them another try.

Not the best experience we've had... The server was very attentive but unfortunately the food fell flat... We did enjoy the sushi roll for our app but my husbands burger was not cooked properly and his fries were cold ! Also I had the salmon and it smelt extremely fishy which usually means it's not fresh .. Ruined my appetite and sent it back .. Was excited about this place but unfortunately won't be returning

We ate at Crave last night, expecting a nice dinner to enjoy with our friends for their last night in town.  The hosted Chyna was lovely, but beyond that the service was lacking.  I wish we had chosen another restaurant.  We had been to Crave once before and because our food was really good, we had forgotten that we  had almost left due to the extreme long wait for a server to even acknowledge that we had been seated.  On this night, our 3 children were dining with us and from the time we sat down until we asked about the progress of our food, it had already been over a 40 min. wait.  A good waitress would have submitted our children's orders immediately.  When we inquired about the food the waitress Julie stated that she didn't enter our food order until 10mins after the appetizer was brought out - only one appetizer was order and it didn't come out for over 20mins.  Her remarks were said in a snarky tone, as if we should be grateful for her failure to realize small children were at the table.  Children have a hard enough time waiting 20mins let alone the almost 60+mins from the time we were seated to receiving their food.  We appreciate they brought fruit bowls to the table for the kiddos, but the fruit was sour and was old, hence none of our fruit loving kids ate the fruit provided.  We watched our plates sit under the heating lamps for over 20mins before being served, I imagine they were waiting for the other meals to be completed.  Just in case you were wondering the restaurant was only about 1/4 full and we seated about 7:15.  When the meals arrived to the table, we were very hungry.  My Bison burger was tasty, however luke warm, as was the rest of meals at the table.  The kids food was barely warm.  A manager, Joe,  passed by with plates in hand for another table, asking how are meal was...we didn't have time to actually answer him, nor was his question sincere.  He stated he would "be right back" but that was not the case.  A few customer service 101 tips: When something goes wrong, ie, slow, slow food service, especially for children, don't give or make excuses...simple say you are sorry and correct it quickly.  As a bonus bring the kids some chips, bread...anything (edible) when there is an extended wait.  If you want to ask your customer how there food/experience is, be genuine and have time to listen.  I have a Crave loyalty card and I really want to love this place, there are some great tasting dishes, the cooks are clearly not the issue.  However, I don't for see us going back or recommending it to friends because the restaurant truly lacks great servers and management.
OK, this review is on the mac and cheese only, because that's all I ate. Yep, big enough for the main course. I had it with the apple sausage mixed. Loved it.

Ok, Kelvin is an excellent sushi chef with his own creations, we tried the Middle Eastern ceviche and it was wonderful. My wife says the edemame was good. The steak was alright, my son was not happy with it. Service was good, not too bad . Just walk in and go to sushi. These chefs invent stuff, the ceviche, so good. Making this place a regular hang out

5/5 or the food
1/5 for the service

We came here with a group of 20 for a birthday dinner, and we sat down at 9pm. We ordered at about 9:30, got our food at 10. One thing was she didn't ask us for our drinks. She just assumed everyone wanted water.  We finished eating at 10:30, waiting for our checks. As I am writing this review now, at 10:54 p.m., we are waiting to pay for our bill. It took 25 minutes for the check! That's a pretty long time.

The food, however, was good. We ordered a rib eye steak and Mac n cheese. The Mac and cheese is alright, but the steak was packed with flavor! I really loved it. 

Like most of the reviews here, service needs to improve.

I absolutely love this restaurant. I discovered it and ate here 3 times in the past three days. Service is great! Ask for Jordan, he's funny and gets things to you right away. Also, definitely get the calamari no matter what you end up ordering for the entrée. Delicious.

I really wanted to like this place, but was EXTREMELY disappointed! The server was clueless and gave us the wrong information. Ended up moving tables because sat by cold front door area. Waited for service,
but server never came back. Moved to bar and totally regretted that because the bartender was soooooo rude. Very short w us when he took our order like we were completely bothering him. We observed him with the other guests and he was the same way with them. Our food came out wrong and he blamed us! We showed him what we ordered on the menu and what was supposed to come, but he got defensive and was almost fighting with us. So crazy!!! I have worked in the hospitality industry for 15 years and have never seen anything like it. I will never go back to this place and will advise anyone who asks not to bother trying it. They need to start fresh with staff that is competent and actually want to be there. Your food can be great, but if your service is terrible, your restaurant is doomed to fail miserably...but the food was mediocre so good luck...

Absolutely love this place!  The food is delicious, the service is stellar, and the ambiance is yummy!  I love sushi and my man likes hamburger - they make them both to perfection!  We've eaten at Crave about 10 times, and never had a bad meal, bad service, or a bad experience.  We've brought friends and family, and each guest loves it as much as we do!

I've been wanting to try this place out fit for a while. We decided to go try the Happy Hour. I really liked the choices they had. My friend and I ordered drinks, pretty good. I ordered the kinky mojito. I ordered the kogi tacos. The big plate they used made the serving size even smaller. It was only 2 tacos... Kinda small. Wished they added 3. My friend ordered the Apple sausage flatbread. Looked pretty good. My other friend ordered pork belly sliders. She says there wasn't that much pork in hers and it was just 2 sliders too. At least at cheese cake factory they would give you 4 or 6 I believe. The decor was really nice. Looked modern. We sat at the bar,i didn't know it would be that loud. The staff was very nice. The hostess sat us right away when we decided to sit somewhere else since you can only try happy hour at or around the bar. I would try to go back there and try the regular size food next time instead of just the Happy Hour

This was my second time coming to Crave.   I brought my dad for father's day because of all you can eat prime rib and the first time we came we loved the service and the food. 

However, this time was kind of a disaster.    The service was so slow.    We sat for at least 10 minutes before we put in an app order.   We got our apps even before we ordered our main dishes.  We never got one drink refill because we hardly ever saw the server. 

The food was also just ok all around.   Not terrible, not good.   

Overall I don't think I want to come back which is disappointing because after the first time here I couldn't wait to come back.

This place is pretty fancy inside. A really nice looking restaurant with a large center bar with plenty of seating, and an outdoor patio area. 

My friend and I decided to give it a try. He had already been to Wolfgang Puck's (I haven't so that's another future review). We ordered the crab/artichoke dip in a lemony mayo sauce which was pretty tasty, but lacking a lot of crab. ($14).
For dinner my friend ordered the Chicken stir fry ($20) which he said had good flavor but the noodles were undercooked and the veggies overcooked. I will note that our bartender did try to talk him out of that selection.
I had the Norwegian Salmon in a mustard sauce and that was pretty good. I enjoyed the flavors and the salmon was cooked nicely. I would order this meal again. $27.

They get lower stars due to two main factors. One - my friends Chicken stir fry meal and 2 - we sat at the bar, and my cocktail sat empty for almost 10 minutes while 3 bartenders looked and walked by. That's not good.

I've been wanting to check out The Crave since it opened and finally made it in. We stopped in after 9pm so the rush was over and we're seated quickly by a very nice hostess. Mike was our server and was awesome. We were impressed by the menu selection and settled on a starter of quacamole and chips, it was good but not great. For my main course I'm a sucker for a.good Bison burger so I gave it a try along with some well seasoned fries and was not disappointed. With such a diverse menu and excellent service by Mike we'll be back to try some other dishes. Overall, 4 stars for our first go. And I'd say The Crave has the potential to be our go to spot in Downtown Summerlin.

Got the scallops & risotto, it was ok good not great. $30 for 4 scallops and a small scoop of risotto.  Friends got the crab topped steak filet...they said it was just ok.  Don't waste your money....there are many better restaurants around here.

This place has a nice atmosphere and the food is ok but the service is horrible.  Our waitress took 20-30 minutes to get my table drinks. Then it took another 15 minutes to get lemon for our water. We sat next to the bar. I could of water over and got the lemon. Not once did our waitress apologized for not checking on us or how long it took to get drinks and serviced. I stood up twice and both times she walked past our table and said nothing.  The only plus here is that the food comes out fast. The food runners have better service than our waitress. If it was not for the food coming out fast I would have not tipped at all. We were 5 minutes away from leaving the restaurant. I will never go back.

We have eaten here twice now and are probably not going to again...  

The first time we came was 9:00 on a Friday night, it was mostly empty, and we were seated promptly. The food came out quickly. I really enjoyed my lettuce wraps because they were already assembled! My husband loved his sake and his sushi roll. The server was happy and friendly. I got a coupon in the mail which I actually remembered to use for once! It was just the two of us and we had a good experience overall. 

The second time was 9:00 on a Saturday night, it was mostly empty (again) and we were seated promptly. The server seemed put-out by the 5 of us being there. We ordered our drinks and the other 4 people at my table got them at one time and my glass of wine came 15 minutes later. When it finally arrived, he said "Sorry, we had to open a new bottle of wine". Since when does it take 15 minutes to open a bottle wine in a mostly empty restaurant? Then the food finally came out and the guy quickly disappeared before my husband (who got sushi) could realize he had no chop sticks! Since the server didn't return for 15 minutes, he ate half of his dish with a fork before he could even ask for chop sticks... fail! Then he brought us the bill and disappeared without saying anything. We were like, wait, we wanted to order another round of drinks. What if we wanted dessert? Ok, we get the hint, we will pay and leave. Seriously, we got the hint!

This was a new place to try, for lunch, they have a good variety of foods and decent portions, I would definately go back to this place again, the waiter was very nice and attentive to our needs. The price is good too. We will be back!

Good place.  Went for dinner on Father's day.  Service was a bit slow, not that it was the server's fault, they were woefully understaffed.  I've been here twice before and the service has been good, friendly, timely, and interactive, so I think this time was more of a scheduling mishap.

The food I've ordered is very good, I've ordered off the menu, Gorgonzola Stuffed Chicken last time, and Salmon this time.  Both were excellent, though I think I like the Chicken better.  On Father's day, both my Dad and Mom had the Prime Rib special, which was anything but special.  Super thin, over cooked greyish-brown lump.  But, not one of their normal dishes, so maybe a one off mistake.  It was all-you-can-eat, and when the server came with the second round, the meat looked the same, so we said no thanks, and left it at that.

I'll be back though!  Fun place with a lively crowd, especially at the bar.  They must have a decent happy-hour since I've seen the bar busy the 3 times I've been.

Even after my wife and I (accidentally) made two reservations for 7pm we still had to wait almost 30 minutes to be seated. And we were seated in the Bar, not the restaurant. Okay so be it. It doesn't get any better though. The wine was rancid, the margarita was lame and the main course came 5 minutes after the soups and salads were delivered. It was a disaster and the worse part is the food was just okay. I so want local restaurants to succeed however Crave has some work to do if they are going to last.

The food was terrible. The waiter was nice. Restaurant was empty at 6:00 on a Saturday. Don't attempt to go here if you go gluten free! Can't say I feel good 24 hours after.  I had the lamb meatballs and rice noodles. All of it was completely over cooked and I am pretty sure it was put in a microwave. The rice noodles they replace the pasta with were soggy and I could only get two inch pieces at most on my fork, because they were so overcooked. It was in a green sauce. Not sure you could say it was cream sauce as most of it was soaked up by the noodles and it was green? Can't understand the choice of rice noodles as there so many other options of pasta that taste amazing as GF. The meatballs were completely dry and tasteless and the tomato garnish was as dry as a potato chip. Maybe an attempt at their own sun dried tomato? Not feeling this restaurant. Kids and husband had pizza flatbread that they said was Ok. My six year old had chicken fingers that could have come from a cheap diner and wouldn't eat the fries. Ice cream sandwiches down the street saved the night. Don't bother going here. So many better options a walk away in Downtown Summerlin. Can't say I didn't warn you!

My husband and I went to crave after receiving a coupon for by 1 entree get 1 free. We had a reservation and were sat right away. The reservation didn't seem necessary even though it was Sunday lunch time. Our server was nice and attentive. We ordered Salmon Sashimi which was ok. Then our entrees came out. I had steak sliders that was beyond boring in flavor. It was so bland that I could hardly make out anything I was eating and my fries looked old and also was lacking in flavor. My husband had the Steak, he asked for medium cooked but all we could taste was burnt meat, it was tasteless even after asking for a1 sauce. I was glad we had that coupon since paying for a disappointing meal is never a good time. We won't be going back.

I came here at 9pm, hungry. I ordered the philly roll, #9, dynamite, and parmesan truffle fries. They got my order wrong, but that's just minor. My fries were soggy and cold, the philly roll had lettuce in it (and it tasted gross), #9 roll (nothing special,lots of greens), and at all normal sushi restaurants the "dynamite" roll is a baked roll. Not this one. It has some kind of mashed fish with more greens. Have you ever been to Yardhouse? I would give Yardhouse food 5stars compared to this. This is Yardhouse like food, done wrong, and they don't know how to do sushi. DO NOT COME HERE FOR SUSHI. Food, one stars, service, two stars. Not my kind of place.

Would have been 4 stars if not for slow service.  Restaurant had us wait 10-15 minutes despite not being overly busy.  Ratio of diners to staff seemed off and staff was scrambling to keep up.  Wife loved  her soup, and food was good.  Not over the top and you are certainly paying for the environment and aura but it just did not do it for me.  It was a race to wait, wait for a table, wait for a server, wait for food, wait for a beverage refill (which we were never offered or had a chance to ask for).  Check took 15 minutes to arrive, another 10 to get picked up by a manager who acted like they were doing us a favor. With lots of other choices here in Downtown Summerlin Crave might be a middle of the pack choice in the future.

I came here during happy hour, so I cannot comment on their regular menu. Most of everything I ordered was below average to average. 

I personally love California rolls, and it was my fave out of all the HH food items we ordered. They serve Tenaya Brewery beer on tap, and had some good stuff during HH.

I walked away however, feeling that I am okay never coming back. At least for the food.

My first visit here was a refreshing new dining experience.  My party of four was greeted warmly by the hostess, and we were quickly escorted to our reserved booth amidst the plush decor and opulent design of this relatively new addition to Downtown Summerlin.

Pan-fried Pork Dumplings was a good opener.  A cup of seasonal Lamb Meatball Soup was so spicy it literally took my breath away, but was nevertheless quite tasty.  To the degree that next time I will order a bowl!  Pan-fried Pork Dumplings were crispy and also tasty.

A nicely laid out massive Wedge Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing was a refreshing starter.  And Pita Bread from an ordered Bread Basket was supple and fine.  

For my entree, Beef Stroganoff, with Braised Short Rib, Mushroom Cream Sauce, and a large dab of Horseradish Chive Sour Cream was meaty and quite satisfying.  And, seated beside me, Diane very much enjoyed her real creamy Mac & Cheese.  

Dakota, our server, was friendly, helpful, and proficient in all waitressing tasks  The restaurant manager stopped by three times to chat briefly with us and check on our dining progress.  Afterwards, our dining companions were effusive in their praise for this restaurant.  And, I will surely be back!

4-1/2 stars overall on this autumn night!

Tried 4 different flatbreads, 3 sushi, lobster linguini, meat balls, 3 different beers, cocktails, and white wine, nothing is good. The only thing that is fine is the chicken flatbread. 
The server, Darius, is attentive and friendly while others are not.
Will not come back unless I take my puppy here to enjoy their patio and open air.

Love this place! They have awesome drinks, both alcoholic and non. An awesome variety of food and if you feel like sushi, they have it, too! And it is great! More chilled than Kona, with all the middle aged meat market, and better food menu than Cheesecake Fcty. 

We belong to their loyalty club, and get points that add to pretty nice discounts. Service is always chilled and know their menu. 

We enjoy eating here.

The restaurant is beautiful inside but I would recommend ordering your food to go. Service is alway mediocre...wait staff seems unengaged and they move at a sloths pace. Dining with children is a tough enough task but when it takes your waiter/waitress forever to grab drinks or even forget to check on you mid meal your experience goes from good to bad because your feel the need to get out of there ASAP. What I thought would be a quick meal in a restaurant that was nearly empty took about 1 hour and 45 mins. Way to long with children.

This is our first time venturing through Summerlin area.  We didn't know what to expect, walking through this deserted shopping center.  

We saw the menu, saw they have gluten-free, so I'm testing a new diet to see what my allergies are.  I never knew how hard it was to eat GF, dairy and soy free, when dining out.  

The sushi is nothing to run home to, but at least it was decent.  My chicken and rice noodle dish was a good-interesting, really flavorful, also filling down to the last bite.  Not good for low carb, but perfect for gluten-free, minus the goat cheese for a non-dairy meal.  I always associate rice noodles with my Chinese flavored broth, but this lightly salted, olive oil concoction was surprisingly great.   

This place has the generic contemporary sort of look, nice choice of orange/red tinge to their decor.  Service was slow to start off, until I made a remark and the waiter was super attentive throughout our entire meal.  Now, that's customer service.

Here is my review of the restaurant. The decor is nice and modern, upscale looking but the food doesn't match the ambience. Portions are small and bland. Do not order Steak Sliders if you are hungry!! It's consider an entree/burger which looks like it should be an appetizer $14.95!! A White Castle burger is bigger than the sliders I got. The wait staff was decent and friendly which is why I gave 2 stars. FYI you'll be "Crave"ing that you had more food on your plate. Pass!!

I stopped into Crave with my boyfriend for a cocktail and a snack.  I tried the blueberry lemonade which was great, I enjoyed the flavor- it was a perfect mix without being too sweet! We ordered an appetizer, which was tasty. I want to say I like Crave, although the service was lacking. I know that Crave is one of a few restaurants open in Downtown Summerlin at this time, so I want to give them the benefit of the doubt and hope that the service will improve, I think they have the cocktails and food to be successful, they just need the service and hospitality to catch up with it.
Very average.  Description of food was way better then the taste. I'm sure after a few months they will get their menu straight.

Brianna the hostess was absolutely amazing and so helpful. She was so greeting at the door and made the visit so comfortable. She definitely needs to be a server soon. The food and service was also very good. Will definitely be back.

We sat at the bar and were given menus. Then we were subsequently ignored for 15 minutes after putting the menus aside. Customers around us were served multiple times but we were not addressed at all. They were busy, but there were 7 bartenders for 12-15 customers at the bar. There's really no excuse for the bad service. After futilely waiting for a few more minutes, just sitting and waiting, we left. I will not be returning here anytime soon.

Visited Memorial Day. Nice looking place, waited a few minutes fro a greeter to arrive, some what bizarre for the size of place. Waitstaff was very friendly but overworked. 
Food could have been great, but seasonings way off. Beef taco, too salty to eat, Mac and cheese bland, Maui Maui was overcooked and no seasoning. The food looked great, but not tasty.  Server never brought wine ordered to wife, so she had enough. Happy hour prices were not discounted on ticket. $81 for 2 adults and one teen, not worth the cost.

Maybe a good place to go after work and have a drink in bar, nice atmosphere. If you want dinner, Yard House a similar concept, much better choice.

I'd like to review an entire experience at this restaurant, but we sat for 10 minutes at our table without acknowledgement from wait staff or management. We left. Sunday, 1 PM, far from full. I guess that is a review.

Went upstairs to Public School 702 immediately after leaving. Seated with water and drink orders in - less than 5 min. Just for reference.

We love this place. Kid meal is free everyday with a purchase of adult entree. Their loyalty program is great!, you get credits for signing up, your birthday and anniversary. The food are delicious, I love that you can have sushi and American meal too. And our waiter Zaid took a very good care of us!

Horrible overpriced sushi. I've had better sushi at 7/11. Tried multiple items on the sushi menu and they all lacked taste and quality. Service was mediocre as the waiter seemed in a rush all the time and did not want to wait till we finish our sentence while ordering and got a bunch of things wrong , 

Never again

This is our 3rd visit and only returned because we had a coupon. First visit was opening day, so we gave some slack on the lousy service. Second visit we were seated in the back which is dark and uninviting and service lacked. We said that was our last visit. When coupon came in mail we gave it another shot. Food is good but the service has been slow and inattentive on each visit. Too many good restaurants in Summerlin to come again. I predict this place won't last.
